name: J R
text: Took my truck here in Oct of 2020 and they forgot to reconnect the sway bar up front, which I fixed. Then gave them a second chance with my wife's car and just discovered they only replaced 3 of the 5 lug bolts on one wheel. Now I have to buy new lug bolts. Go somewhere else if you want the job done correctly.

resp.text: Our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! I see that we have already opened a customer service ticket, we will be back in touch soon!

name: Amanda
text:
As a woman I can say that I have never had a good experience in places when getting my car serviced.  I am spoken down to, given hidden charges, and just treated with general disrespect.
But this was absolutely not the case coming here. Ricky was incredibly nice and spoke to me like an actual human being. I told him what I needed and what time I needed it done. Not only was it done in the exact time I needed, he called to verify what we discussed and verify the price. He did not try to sell my anything unnecessary. And the price wasn't a penny over what he told me. It was an amazing experience and it will be the only place I get my car serviced for the foreseeable future. Thank you for your respect and impeccable service.

resp.text: Thanks for the stars, Amanda! Glad the team was able to take such great care of you. Take care!

name: Kevin Stephens
text: This review is more for an employee than the store itself. Not to take away from the store, though, the store is great. Tire Tech, Ricky, deserves a large amount of praise. That gentleman works his behind off. Every time I’m in the store, he’s there. Working hard. He’s got a fantastic attitude and a general willingness to help. If someone from Tire Discounters sees this, give that man a raise.

resp.text: Awww, thank you for the 5-star review and the kind comments Ricky. We are so glad you had a great experience Kevin, we do what we do for customers just like you. Please come back and see us again when you need us and stay safe out there!

name: Claire Tomlin
text:
Fantastic service! They helped me with my tire issue and Ima go back to them for all my tire needs!

Pros: Honest and down to earth; easy to talk to!

Cons: a bit standoffish at first but it may have been the weather (Torrential downpour)

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Claire! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: William Swinson
text: Joseph the manager and his staff have been phenomenal. Great prices and the service is simply outstanding. He and his team helped me solve a major problem that 2020+ Ram 1500 have major complaints about due to tire shimmy at certain speeds. They fixed the entire problem by performing a “dynamic balancing” splitting the needed weights and road force validation. So these folks saved me from a problem that most folks can’t figure out. Truck runs smooth as silk now and these guys were a pleasure to work with. I will NEVER NEVER take my vehicles anywhere else. You guys just made me a customer for life. Just so you know, I make a living teaching organizations how to be efficient and “customer-centric” and these guys rock !!!! Thanks guys!!!!! Ed

resp.text: That’s how we roll, William! Glad we were able to take such good care of you. Thanks, and we’ll see you again down the road!

name: Ryan Cass
text: For the last 5 years I’ve been taking my Camry to NTB in Huntsville and they were fine until they started trying to up sell me on stuff I didn’t need and their prices kept going up with the staff becoming less and less friendly too. When Tire Discounters opened up on Winchester road I looked forward to trying them out since they are much closer and after having some work done on my other vehicles I knew this would be the right place to get a fresh set of tires. They had a great sale going on for Pirelli’s and they are driving great, hopefully they maintain their friendly service and good prices because this is where I’ll be going for the life of my new tires.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll! We're the authority in customer service and auto safety, Ryan. See ya in 5000 miles for your 1st of many free lifetime tire care visits. We want to take make sure we take good care of those new puppies.

text: Only 1 tech there.  2 went home the day we were there. Who knows why.  We had appt to get a flat fixed and by 1230 we were ready to make earliest appt. Next day.  The woman said we should have made appt anyway.  Well we did... we told her when we walked through the door. So she looked and got pretty nervous.  They got us in ASAP ands we finally got the tire fixed.  Overall we will use our tire discounters on W72 and county line. We were out of town and Hampton Cove was thre closest. Good luck if you use them.

resp.text: Terry, our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! We definitely care about your experience and we'd like to connect to learn more. If you would like to discuss, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com so we can get back in touch with you. Please include a copy of your review for reference, we hope to hear back from you soon! Thank you and stay safe!

resp.text: Rockin' and rollin'! Glad we could keep ya rollin' safely, Dan. Hope you enjoyed your trip and we'll see ya again when ya need us.

name: Stefanie Terrell
text: Do not take your vehicle here unless you’d like something coincidentally to happen requiring an additional repair. My husband took his vehicle here for a tire patch which resulted in him being told he needed new tires due to uneven wear. He received a quote and agreed to pursue the new tire service. During service, he was told that his alignment was extremely off; although he had taken his vehicle to the dealership for routine maintenance. They drove his vehicle to our house (courtesy drop-off) and didn’t even mention that the vehicle was making a grinding noise when accelerating and slowing down (4WD issue). Deceitful and dishonest. Their management told my husband that this was a coincidence and a known issue with the make and model of his vehicle. Then proceeded to give him a quote to repair. BUYER BEWARE

resp.text: We have strict policies in place to never oversell unnecessary items and follow MAP guidelines when making any product or service recommendations. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concerns, Stefanie. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

name: barry&mandy tuttle
text: I took my car in for a windshield replacement and noticed that the rear view mirror cover was damaged in the process. Nobody said anything to me about it, they just tried to get it back in place but it kept falling down. When I called to report it, they said they would order another one and replace it when I took my car in for its next oil change. When that time came, my husband took the morning off and drove  the car the hour and a half drive it takes to get to this dealership. My husband was told the rear view mirror cover had been replaced but when I got my car back, I noticed it had NOT been replaced. I called the service department and was told that it had indeed been replaced. When I inquired as to how the service tech then managed to break TWO covers and not mention it, I was told they would need to get back to me. When they called me back, I was told the the part had never actually been ordered and that they would order it and ship it to my house so I could replace it myself. This is not the first time I have had issues with dishonesty when dealing with the service department at this dealership. I had issues with them not being honest when I took my former BMW in for service as well. It’s the closest dealership to me and still an hour and a half away. It’s a shame that honesty and integrity mean nothing to them. The fact that they just pushed the cover back up and tried to pass it off as “fixed” tells a lot about the care and pride they put in to their work. This car company seems to be going down hill fast. Their car prices have gone up but their service is minimal at best. I paid a lot of money for my car AND for the service I’m not receiving.

resp.text: Our General Manager, Roger, would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (334) 557-8873. We look forward to hearing from you.

text:
We Saturday at 4:59pm ( yes it was closing time on a Saturday night) we called over to this place, explained to them what was going on we limped to their parking lot we were told they did not have the tire and that they were closed. Just as we were pulling in Mike, the manager was coming out of the garage (while calling other locations to see if they had the tire size we needed) to let us know what he had already done in 60 seconds!!!! After getting Mike the correct tire size, that he had in stock, he was pulling us in to get the old tire off and new tire on. Scott kept us company and checked us out! These guys were able to get us in and out and back on the road quickly! Despite it being closing time on a Saturday night Mike and Scott were there to provide outstanding customer service, quick action and a can do attitude!  Thank you guys again for everything!

Johnny Lavalais

name: Sean Copenhaver
text:
So there I was, just dropped the kids off at school with minutes to spare, running a little behind on my way into work, and with my tire low on air the entire time! It truly felt like a Monday indeed. The caution light erupts to life on my dashboard nearly blinding me, my rear driver side tire...is low on air. *Que dramatic music*
I pull into the nearest mechanic shop and park right in front of the first available bay. They were all open and currently being mopped by the staff. Before I have a chance to throw the car in park, there is a young man walking my way. With the car now in park, I step out of the car and he greets me with a warm smile and a "Good Morning to ya, what can we help with?", but before I have a chance to open my mouth he whistles in shock at the sight of my tire. When I turn around to see the damage, there it is, staring me in the face like a angry mother-in-law when you make an inappropriate joke at the dinner table, a screw.
Now there's two men attending to my car. Courtney, the first-responder, and Lamar, the muscle. The elect to change out the tire and find what they have in stock. 2 good conversation and half a cup of cheap coffee later I've got keys in my hand and ready to start my day. I made it to work on time too for anyone who was wondering.

resp.text: We are so appreciative for you sharing your story. These guys really do work hard to try to be a positive impact in people's lives. Some may say, "you guys just change oil." but we like to say, "we're not just changing oil, we're changing lives!" we strive to be the best 10 minutes in a customers day. thank you for your business and we are so grateful again for your kind words.

name: Ernest G Waters
text: Update to previous review.  Since my initial visit to the McGee rd service facility back in December,  which did an excellent job, I have had 2 bad experiences.  1st bad experience was with my wife's car. She had the oil changed at the eastern blvd facility.  Approximately 1 week later her car's check engine light came on and the fault was for dirty oil. She had the oil checked at a local change facility and it was a quart low. They did another oil change, and I have the filter from that change and it is not as clean a filter as you think from 1 week previous. I had also gotten my oil changed in my truck a few days after she did at the eastern Blvd facility.  So I decided to take a look at my oil and filter. The filter on my truck had an install date written on it from the McGee Rd facility of 12/9/19. The date I first got Express to change it. They supposedly changed my oil and filter on 2/7/20 at McGee rd. I will also attach a pic of the filter . Needless to say this is a very bad way to run a business.  Engine damage from dirty oil is very significant possibility from these action.

resp.text: Hi there, Ernest. While we never like for a customer to leave unsatisfied, feedback like this helps us grow as a company. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. When you have time, please leave us your contact information as well as the details you provided here at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you!

text: I highly recommend this location. If you want your auto fixed right the first time take it to the 6th avenue location. If you are self diagnosing your vehicle, then you might want to fix it yourself, but if you want professional, experienced mechanics to diagnose and repair your vehicle this is the place to be. Rick, Steven, and Gus, shout out to you guys. Best customer service I have had from a business that has done work for me. Also a shout out to the guys in the shop that never get recognized, you all play a big part in keeping this business successful by the great work you do. Thanks Rick for saving me money on my backup camera sensor. The dealer would have easily charged me a diagnostic fee and a labor and repair fee for what you did with the flick of a wrist. Steven my good buddy, we didn't fuss on my last shop visit, but I was so glad to see you in the shop and feeling well. Thanks again guys, I' l see you at my next oil change.

resp.text: We really appreciate you and are always happy to serve you. Thanks for all the kind words. The team really enjoy and appreciate the recognition you give them in your review. Thanks for taking the time to give us a great review. See you at the next oil change.

text: I cannot recommend the guys at AAMCO enough. Over the last 3 months, my truck has been in and out of their shop (due to my truck’s issues, not AAMCO’s). Each time, they were honest, fair priced, and went above and beyond to find the issue and offer a solution - whether that meant fixing it themselves or pointing me to another shop that specialized in what I needed. Stephen, Gus, and the rest of the team took great care of us!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review. We enjoy seeing you when you come to our shop. Always smiling even though you have issues with your truck. Come back and see us any time.

name: Tommy Allmon
text:
Can't say enough about Rick and his team at AAMCO. Unfortunately, the extended warranty company on my truck is a joke. And that's just the truth.  If you can avoid it - do not use Penn Warranty Corporation.

Rick has fought on my behalf to make sure the work on my truck was covered, as it should be. He is fun to deal with and is honestly just a good guy. After doing a bunch of work and the warranty company telling him to tow the truck to someone else (to avoid having to pay), he is still helping me out. He could've given up on me and the warranty company - and tried to get me to pay out of pocket. But he didn't.

I fully recommend this AAMCO as they have the best interest of the customer in mind.

resp.text: Thank you Tommy for the great review. It was our pleasure to help take care of you.  I hope they get you back on the road soon.

My car shifts gears smoothly now and I have a 3 year warranty on this transmission work. This staff went above and beyond to make sure I was taken care of as a customer and it is greatly appreciated. It is great to know there are still honest people around here. Mr Rick was awesome to deal with and his son who works at the front desk was also very kind as well as one of the technicians I met. I recommend all of my family and friends to come here for mechanical repairs from now on!!! I came in as a stranger and felt as if I left as a friend.

name: Efrain Rodriguez
text:
Here my car got the transmission rebuilt, torque converter changed, etc... I paid over 2K bucks for the repair with 3-year warranty. Now my car is shifting gears kinda funny, sometimes earlier than should, sometimes later... So, I took the car back to AAMCO because is still on warranty. After the 1st workday, I did not get a phone call. Seem like they are not used to customers or they don't know that they are supposed to call the customer even if did not have time to check the car. I would appreciate a courtesy call and a reasonable plan to fix the issue, let's see how long that takes. Unfortunately, today will have to walk home. I will continue updating this post...
The second day, 1st thing in the morning I got the call. One positive aspect about this Shop is that they keep their eyes on the rates and reviews. Looks like the previous owner messed up very bad with customers and the new people at the shop are trying very hard to fix the bad reputation. By phone, I got a fair enough excuse of why they did not call me yesterday and they have a plan to fix the car issue, which btw should not cost me a dime because the transmission rebuild is still on warranty...

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. This store is under new ownership. We have been here since June of 2017. Even though we are under new management and you bought and paid for this under the previous owner, I will be honoring your warranty and fixing your transmission. We are dedicated to our customers and want you to know we contact our customers are soon as a thorough diagnosis is completed. We have to schedule the vehicles into the shop as they are received and then we call the customer to inform them on what the issue is and how long it will take to complete the repair. We strive to meet our customers needs and understand you want your vehicle repaired as soon as possible.

name: Mickey Mcduffee
text: I run a business that specifically deals with one brand. I received a call from them about a problem they were having with a vehicle. We took the time to find out what the manufacture required to fix this issue. Plus we had seen this problem before. We told them what parts were needed for the repair so the customers car would be repaired long term. We sent the parts that were needed and a few days later they returned have the parts and said the car was repaired. OK... I don't know what he did but I do know they did not fix the car they way the manufacture suggested. Burke the owner originally paid with a check. So I had him a check cut for the returns which he cashed the next day. Then my business office tells me he canceled the original check he used to pay for the parts. I called and he told me several times he would come by and pay for the parts. This was the first couple times he lied to me. Finally I drove to his business and talked face to face where he gave me some excuse why he did not have the funds but he would pay tomorrow. It was always tomorrow. I would pull up and he would run and jump in his car and drive off like a coward. Even his own employees  said he was a layer. So do yourself a favor and find another repair shop. And if you own a shop and do business with Burke DONT TAKE A CHECK (CASH ONLY!) To this day he has not paid a dime of his bill. And I am sure if I called he would lie to me right now!

text: If I could rate this AAMCO center a half star I would.  We received really bad service.  I assumed this franchise was rebuilding my transmission but later discovered to my surprise the location wrote the repair ticket in more vague terms describing the work as a recondition transmission with specifics about what was repaired.  I took this car in to this location three times each time the work took 1-2 weeks for the same repair.  The last time this franchise kept my car for three weeks provided a rental car for one of those weeks.  A got the car back only to discover the D5 LED was flashing indicating a high pressure switch problem which was denied by this franchise as a warranty item!  Use them at your own risk!

text: I went to get an oil change and get my tires rotated. Had I not asked if my car was ready, I would probably still be sitting there. text:
Bacon Alignment was recommended to me. Super friendly staff. Work was great. No surprises; they did what they said they'd do at the price they quoted. When you see them they truly care that their customers are putting a safe car back on the road, which was very important to me. I recommend them to anyone.

[Edit] I have continued to take my vehicles to them with great results.

[Note] They're not just an alignment shop. Other than paint, body, or stereo work they can do basically anything you need from brakes to a full engine rebuild.

text: Bacon Alignment came through like a boss. Very helpful and the staff is super friendly and fantastic. My starter went out and I was in jam. Definitely a place I would recommend to anyone. More than 5 stars in my book.

text: I can't overstate how much I appreciate this shop.  Long Lewis Ford gave me an estimate for over $4,000.00 for a new transmission (E350 drivetrain).  I came to Bacon for a second opinion because the owner is a transmission expert.  Turns out the transmission is fine.  I paid $35.00 for the assessment.  Previously, I had Bacon do a transmission service at 195,000 miles on my Ford F-150.  They fixed a glitch that Ford dealers could never get a handle on - when I accelerated hard between 30-40 mph, it would miss.  No longer!

name: rtc
text:
Went in for new shocks and coils, they installed them well, but when I started driving, my vehicle constantly pulled to the left. If I didn't hold the steering wheel tight it would have flipped at high speeds. So I called them and they swore they had done an alignment. I asked if they'd check again to make sure it was done right and they begrudgingly said yes. Took it back in, they said everything looked great. I drove it off the lot and there was still a severe pull to the left. They blamed my tires and said it's because they had a bad wear pattern. (My tires were only a few months old).

So I took it to another place on the other side of the river. They did an alignment and told me that whoever had done my previous alignment lied to me. They showed me on a print out how the camber was over an inch out of line and how the toe of one wheel was turned too far in. I drove off the lot and my vehicle drove as straight as an arrow.

Bacon Alignment lied to me twice and charged me for something they didn't do. Avoid.

text: Only rotated two of my tires on the passenger side. They didn’t know I marked my tires. Watch out for this scam.

name: Scarlett Dolbear
text: I hate this place. I bought my car from them in 2014. It was a 2012 Nissan rogue. They were over priced compared to other dealers, and the service department is terrible. For instance, I had my oil changed and they did an inspection that is routine. They gave me the sheet showing everything they had checked, to include the tread on my tires. A couple of weeks after this inspection and maintenance my tire almost blew out. It was in terrible condition for some unknown reason with no blame attributed to them because yeah it happens. They told me they could have me a new tire in 24 hrs. So, I agreed. They also added that it would be in my best interest to replace all four tires because the rest of them were in such terrible condition as well. Now, why would they have checked the tread on my tires less than two weeks prior and marked them good if they were in terrible condition?? So, I obliged and told them I would just order four new tires. But, I also told them I wanted to keep the old ones just in case I needed a spare. When I came back to pick up my car it did have new tires. I asked where I could pick up the old ones because my fiance at the time told me to keep them, and they assured me that I didn't want them. One guy, I'm guessing the supervisor, even included that his wife wouldn't be driving around on tires in that bad of shape. So, lesson learned: they will try and take advantage of you in any way they can when it comes to getting the most money out of you. I left without my old tires and to top it all off they even charged me a recycling fee for them after I told them I wanted to keep them. I went back not too long ago and the service was just the same. My AC had went out on this same car. Long story short, they charged me a diagnostic fee and couldn't even tell me exactly what was wrong, but worse case scenario I was looking at $2000 worth of repairs. So, after the tire incident I went elsewhere and got a second opinion. They took less time and narrowed the issue down to a relay problem. But, told me worse case scenario $1500. So, again they are over priced. I ended up trading my car in at a dealership in Bay minette and I couldn't be happier. I purchased the extended warranty on the rogue with them, and it served no purpose. It ran out at 100,000 miles and every issue i had either wasn't covered  or started at 104,000 miles. Another lesson learned. I will not shop with them again, or use their service department for anything to include routine maintenance. I don't recommend them to anyone. Of course this is just my opinion of them from what I experienced.

text: Super grateful for this business and Brian. They called down to another Express Oil Change 10 miles away who had one for us. Instead of putting our young family on a spare tire in an area we didn’t know, they drove down and got the tire for us and changed it there. They had us back on the road in about an hour and half. While I don’t know when we will be back through, I will forever be grateful for their kindness, and professionalism and highly recommend them if you are traveling through.

name: Britt Noelle
text: I happened to be traveling through Calera on my way home, and unfortunately got a flat tire. It was the perfect storm of bad timing, incredibly delayed roadside service, and the literal annoyance of cold and rainy weather. I looked up tire mechanics in the area and happened upon these guys. After a couple of calls to let them know i was still awaiting a tow truck, we realized I might not even make it to them before closing time. And on top of that, if it was deemed that I did need a new tire, they might not have what I needed. It was at this point that the managers asked me where I was located! Wyatt and Sam actually drove to where I was, helped me put my spare tire on, and assisted me safely to the shop. They were busy, and still took incredible care of me. I truly can't thank the team there enough. The customer service is off the charts. Everyone was personable and kind, the shop itself is clean and orderly, and they got me taken care of super fast! Honestly, I am just so thankful to have encountered such a great team. Its too bad I'm not a local, but I'm very thankful that it was in Calera that my tire blew. :) THANKS AGAIN Y'ALL!!

resp.text: Hi, Britt, thank you for the positive feedback! Our team here at Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is always happy to service your vehicle, and we’re thrilled to hear the customer service was stellar. We look forward to continuing to do business with you in the future!

text:
i went out to get lunch and noticed my tire was low, so i stopped into the calera location. i pulled in to the parking lot and sat for several minuets and no one came out to great me. so i decided to pull behind one of the bays and wait. after the car in the bay was guided out, they guided my in. i told them i needed my tire pressure checked and after checking them he said one was very low and that i probably needed a patch. i asked how long it would take  (since i just got lunch and needed to take it home to the family)
he told me 20 min. an hour and a half later, no one even came to tell me it was taking a little longer and at one point a customer pulled into the lot and almost drove into the bay because no one was in the oil change area. the driver got out and walked into the waiting room and asked "where are all the employees" i told her i had not seen anyone in a while, she got back in her car and left. terrible customer service.

resp.text: Hi Jamie, we’re sorry you were dissatisfied with our staff and experience during your service. We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please visit us at www.expressoil.com/contact/ and leave your contact information, as well as the details of your experience, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

Second time through trial and error we got my A/C up and running. Then most recently I found my self having to make frequent trips to bham and my car started overheating.  You guys got it right in and fixed that too!!!  Just got back from Bham and not once did it even act like it was thinking about over heating.  HEROS I tell ya!!!!!!  You guys rocks. name: Sierra Eutsey
text: I've been coming to RoadMart for two years now and I am now having the worst time with them. I brought my car in a week ago because the front end of the car was not driving properly. RoadMart said that they could not replicate the issue but they did see I needed my tires balanced, I let them balance my tires and when I left I was having the same issues. I brought my car back and then they said the tires were  separating on the inside, so I paid 367 for four brand new tires. Replacing the tires only helped the car drive smoother but the problem was now worse! So I brought my car back today and now there saying that the back tires are the cause of the front tires shifting and that wasn't something they could fix, I would have to take it to the dealership. The guy said he could try to align the front to see if that would help but it made the issue even worse then when I had initially brought the car in. I am now sitting here after closing hours so they can set my alignment back to were it was. I just feel like if they were unable to repair the car in the first place then they should've said so instead of me coming out of 446 dollars for no reason. I asked if I could a refund for the alignment and the guy said that he wouldn't be able to refund me, would have to wait until next call and ask for a refund or he could credited as two free oil changes which is not acceptable for my inconvenience

text: Oil change was extremely to high it cost twice as much as the dealership would charge. But they are fast but was away to high .

resp.text: Mr.Thompson, we are sorry that you didn’t find our prices appealing. Your invoice reflects that you purchased a full synthetic oil change plus an air filter. We strive to be price competitive in the industry while continuing to provide high quality products and employ a well-trained staff with years of experience to get the job done quickly and correctly! We do offer coupons and discounts, but we are ultimately known for quick and top-quality professional service. Thank you for your feedback.

name: M. C.
text: I took all 5 of our vehicles to them for two years and all was great. For no reason other than to up-sale us, THE MANAGER began lying to my wife about what she needed. He told her her brand new car with less then 7k miles needed a new air filter, she couldn't switch from synthetic to conventional oil without damaging her engine and she couldn't use the coupon specifically from Fausak that she just printed that morning because it was no longer honored. They did not reset the oil change counter and did not fill the wiper fluids - likely because my wife did not fall for their pitch. When I confronted him, he admitted to the lies and said he wouldn't do it again. Not acceptable. Moving on...

resp.text: We take your feedback very seriously and would appreciate the opportunity to further discuss your concerns. What you describe does not reflect our high standards of professional and honest service. We'd like the chance to learn more about your experience and in hopes of working towards your complete satisfaction. Please send your contact information and availability to reviews@fausaktire.com. Thank you.

Again, I apologize on behalf of the entire Fausak Crew and my family. I can be reached at chris.fausak@fausaktire.com. I look forward to speaking with you.   Chris Fausak, Owner.

text: You drop your car off seven or eight days later no one calls you they tell your car is done and it cost $2000 to fix they fix my car with no approval I said OK paid the bill picked it up less than 10 days later I start to hear funky noise like something is loose then transmission fluid starts pouring all out of it  end it won’t move they send a wrecker after it same thing car sits there for almost 4 weeks no one calls me tells me the car is done I come to pick it up drive home put about 400 miles on it guess what car won’t move call him they tell me to bring it in don’t even offer it to tow it back wake they came and got it finally Repeated the same thing 3Weeks later I called to check on my car how they say it’s ready to go said they had a fluid leak told me that park the car out front I come to pick it up it’s dark and raining guess what the car won’t start won’t crank nothing popped the hood the negative battery cable was loose reconnect it car still is dead as a hammer. It’s late it’s dark come back the next day car won’t even jumpstart the battery is so dead go to get a battery put a battery in it started and the emergency brake light won’t go off like they adjusted the emergency break wrong drive it home will never go back oh by the way when I went to pick it up the driver side floor board was full mud . Don’t take your car there

name: Leah Autumn
text: I contacted Alabama Precision Transmission to get an estimate on a new transmission for my Nissan. I spoke with Michael (Mike) and he worked hard and got me the best deal possible! He went above and beyond to get me what I needed and I would never go anywhere else!

text: Great guys to work with, great attention to detail and take pride in their work.

name: Kaitlyn Shotwell
text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

Very, quick friendly and efficient,  I think we found our new place for oil changes too!! Thank you, Matthew.

name: Linda Martin
text: Went in to have air checked. They were very helpful and had air checked in a very timely manor. Their waiting room was clean and comfortable. I will go back when I need tires replaced.

resp.text: Linda, thank you for choosing us to inspect your vehicle's A/C. We are proud to deliver a comfortable and professional auto service experience for our customers and we look forward to seeing you when you are ready for those tires!

name: John Petit
text: To anyone in the Foley, Gulf Shores and Orange Beach area who needs engine repair, please strongly consider Fausak.  I gave them 5 stars and took the time to write a review and here is why.  They performed the service review on my 2015 Toyota Avalon with 70K miles and it was missing badly and seemed like a coil pack problem.  The original diagnosis and estimate came in around $650.  I gave them the verbal to proceed and they called back an hour and half later to tell me that their original diagnosis was incorrect and that they found the problem.  A beach mouse/rodent chewed the fuel line to one of the cylinders and the bill would be $136 parts and labor.  I was overjoyed and consider that an incredible testimony to their honesty and integrity.  I will do business with them whenever I can in the future and I recommend them highly.

resp.text: John, we appreciate you sharing your experience. It is important to our business to treat our customers with respect and honesty when it comes to their auto repair needs. Thank you for coming to us with your Toyota Avalon and we look forward to working with you next time!

name: Mike Cents
text: Matt from Fausak is our go-to guy. His team of mechanics is amazing. Matt consistently has a great attitude and always tries to help no matter the issue at hand. Do yourself a favor and acquaint yourself with Fausak.

resp.text: Mike, we are proud to have a staff that delivers high quality repairs and experiences for our customers. Thank you for leaving us this feedback and we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Tony Chapman
text: Stopped by without an appointment due to a tire on my travel trailer losing air. We were greeted and immediately taken into a bay for service, the technician quickly discovered the problem and the tire was repaired and mounted. Very professional service writers and technicians ×ith a new and modern facility. We were back on the road to continue our vacation all within an hour.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, Tony. It was our pleasure to quickly diagnose the issue with your trailer tire and get you back on your vacation in no time!

name: Joan Harris
text: My son got a nail in his tire, and it went flat on the interstate in Mississippi.  When he changed his tire to the spare, he broke the stud that holds the lug nut on.  With some calling and stress, I got him to our vacation spot in Orange beach.  I called Fausak and talked to Raymond (who was very kind). They were so accommodating, fixed his tire, and even found another nail in another tire and fixed it.  They did it quick and we were back to our vacation within an hour.  I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: It was our pleasure to take care of the punctured tires on your son's vehicle and get your family back to your vacation! We appreciate you sharing this experience and if there are any auto repair or tire services we can assist with in the future, just let us know!

name: Donna Jo Mcbride
text: I really appreciate the people who work there, they are pleasant and give me information on what's going on with my vehicle, I will be going back im glad they're there

resp.text: We appreciate you trusting our team to perform quality auto services, Donna! Thank you for sharing this feedback and we look forward to working with you next time!

name: Bill Scott
text: Fast service and great price.  Give them a chance to  earn your business.

resp.text: We appreciate your business and your feedback, Bill! Thank you for trusting us with your vehicle's service needs!

text: I had a very pleasant experience with this company. The customer service was by far the best I have received in many years. Very friendly and helpful staff , all the way around! All at a great price, to boot! Will definitely be returning! Thanks guys.

resp.text: It was our pleasure to provide you with a quality auto repair experience, Stacey! Combining great repairs and great customer service is what we strive for with each customer! Thank you for the kind review and we look forward to seeing you next time!

text: Bought a set of tires and had them mounted on wheels to install on a project later. They had to order the tires, but they came in as promised and the job was completed on-time, as priced. If you need more from a tire store than what Fausak delivers, you're going to be looking for a long time.

resp.text: We appreciate you coming to Fausak Tires & Service for your tire needs, Doug! It was our pleasure to order and mount the tires onto your wheels for your future project. If there is any service you need completed in the future, don't hesitate to reach out!

Susan,

We are sorry that you didn’t find our prices appealing. We strive to be price competitive in the industry while continuing to provide high quality products and employ a well-trained staff with years of experience to get the job done quickly and correctly! We hope for the opportunity to provide you with quality auto service again in the future. Thank you.

name: M. Tyler Arthur
text: Stopped in to check a deflated tire and was told a ( perfectly fine otherwise) tire cannot be repaired/plugged more than once. Upon a quick search - this isn't the case at all! Fausak will not see my cars again. Honesty and trust are most important to me and was let down on both fronts.

resp.text: Mr. Arthur,  Thank you for reaching out to us and pointing out our miscommunication.  Your tire had a puncture that was too close to a prior repair and together the repairs would have overlapped.  This makes the tire unsafe to repair according to the Tire Industry Association and the US Tire Manufacturers Association.  Our top priority is the safety of all our guests and employees, and ultimately every other car on the road.  We failed to explain these guidelines accurately which led to the misunderstanding and for that we apologize.  We have sent a copy of the excerpts from each of these guidelines to you.   If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to reviews@fausaktire.com or call the Foley store.  Thank you.

name: Jerry Campbell
text:
EarIier this year I had a 1987 S10 with a 350ci worked on for worked on for 30+ minutes  and was charged zero.  Dennis Morgan the service manager said the mechanic was unable to  improve it but also stated what needed to be done and if I needed them to let them know.  Thanks Dennis Morgan..

In August I returned with the same auto after someone else worked on it. They did the fine tuning for $25.50.  I should have used them for the complete repair instead of wasting alot of money and time? A very costly mistake on my part.

Thanks Dennis Morgan (Manger) and Jesse Simmons (Mechanic)

I would use them again and highly recommend them to anyone who wants to be treated fairly and needed help at a very fair price! They let you make the decisions and apply no pressure to get yor business! Its very hard to find a business like that today!

resp.text: Thanks for the high recommendation, Jerry. Happy we were able to help. Don't hesitate to reach out anytime you need our assistance again. All the best. - David Below

text: I had a car emergency and limped in to their shop early Monday morning. Greg was already there and welcomed me in even though they were not open yet. resp.text: I'm so glad we were able to help you out with your car, Greg. My team does their best to make sure our customers are well taken care of and that our work stays fast and exceptional. Thanks for the awesome rating, and if you ever need anything else we're here for you! -David Below

text: I was taking a trip from Florida to Kentucky and below car clinic treated me and my mother like family even though we had never met. name: Denise Vivian
text:
We were traveling back home to Indiana from Florida and experienced terrible vibration on trailer. We exited I65 to troubleshoot. Googled tire store in vicinity and we were at truck stop right next door  to Dodge City tire store. We pulled in and they got to work immediately.

We had 2 bad tires about to pop.
Within 1 hour we were back on the road with all new tires, balanced and installed at a good price. We were lucky they  didn't blow out on the road. Sheer luck we found this store  who does honest work, no price gouging for travelers. No pressure,  just honest people.
Very clean store with friendly staff
Would use them again. And they are dog people too (extra points for us)
Believe the good reviews you read!

text: We were headed to the beach and got a flat tire. Not being from the area, we were worried, but when we found this place, they took care of us. They had us in and out with a new tire within 15 minutes. Super nice staff that worked quickly to get us back on the road. I would definitely recommend Dodge City!

text: Truly, I can't say enough nice things about this shop.  They are trustworthy, friendly, helpful, and reasonably priced.  They genuinely care about their customers, and they will give you honest advice about your vehicle.  I'm so glad we found them!

text: Great place. Fast friendly service. With fair prices. Fixed us up and had us back on the road in minutes. Even wished a safe trip back to indiana. Good people.

name: Kenneth Overton
text: Very good service had appointment at 9:30 out by 1015 oil change and fix brad leak on tire

name: Kevin Bradshaw
text: Driving down the highway at 11:30pm, we had a flat tire and no spare. The wrecker dropped my dog, wife, and I off in front of this shop and left us with our vehicle. We had no access to uber or Lyft and were stranded with no options. As we stayed in our vehicle over night, we wondered how the next morning would go and hoped this shop would be able to take care of us so we could be back on the road. Well 6:45am rolled around and we were honored to meet the owner Doug. This shop doesn’t open until 7:30, and at 6:45, he welcomed us in as he got there early to open shop. Instead of morning opening routines, he got right to our issue instead. He opened the waiting room and bathroom so my wife could freshen up and be comfortable after our joyous night in the vehicle. Doug and one of his workmates took the tire off and had it fixed within 15-20 minutes. They made sure all our tires were aired and ready to roll again. There was even a scheduled costumer there that we kind of got ahead of, and he seemed so nice and not put out that we needed help quickly, and I could tell the owner even treated him like family.  I am beyond impressed with the service and this business. As a fellow business owner, I understand costumer service, and this place has it right. Thank you so much again Doug for getting us on the road quickly, efficiently, and cost effectively. Your business is amazing, and I hope you can serve yourself  vacation sometime soon as well. Thanks again!

name: Daniel Hall
text:
They were very helpful.  I was headed to Birmingham when my check engine light came on so I pulled off the interstate and they checked the code and got me going quickly.

Their shop is conveniently located right by the truck stop so it is easy to get to for those who are traveling on interstate 65 north or south.

name: Rachel O'Shea
text: We were driving on I 65 South bound, stopped off in a rest stop and realized our back tire had a nail and was leaking at a quick pass.  Luckily for us Dodge City Tire and crew were less then 3 miles away!  Hobbled along on our spare, the guys were friendly, quickly assessed the situation and noted that BOTH back tires had punctures!  After a short cool down in their clean and relaxed waiting area, we were back on our way!  They were able to patch both tires.  With two "out of towners" in a pickle, they could have taken advantage. Can't thank the team enough for the quick, friendly and professional service on such short notice.  We were back on the road within 45 minutes of stopping!!  The offer of Chicago Pizza and beers on us will always be open :)

name: Garrett Smith
text:
I had came in to get a tire changed. Place was packed out, that's cool, I dont mind.
They have the tire I want but can't put it on the day of because of time constraints, that's okay.
The manager, who's name I will withhold, told me that no other tire shop was open that day and I would have to come back on Monday, although I had already came from Walmart TLE and they were changing tires.
I go up the road and to the other Express Oil and tire center. They have my size tire and change it for me.
Now why the manager of this store lied to me on both occasions is beyond me. I can only assume he was trying to save his sales instead of trying to help a brother out.

I'll be going to the Express Oil on 280, instead. There's good people there.

resp.text: Hi Garrett, we’re sorry you were dissatisfied with our staff and experience during your service. We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please visit us at www.expressoil.com/contact/ and leave your contact information, as well as the details of your experience, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Elysia Bailey
text: Great friendly people. Will go over everything with you about your vehicle.

resp.text: It’s always a pleasure seeing you, Elysia! One of our top priorities is to provide the best customer service around and we’re happy to hear about your positive experience! See you down the road!

name: tynesha bryant
text: I arrived and was requested to wait. I waited over 20 minutes. They were finished with the two cars in the bay, and yet even once the car in front of me was done being serviced, they moved that car and never signaled me to pull forward. Then to service a car that pulled in to the bay next to me before ever even pulling me up. While having two men service that one vehicle when you had two cars still waiting. I’ve used express before and always have a good experience, but the sylacauga location leaves a lot to Be desired. 2/5 would not recommend

resp.text: Hi, tynesha, we’re very sorry for the less than satisfactory service you received! We’ll be addressing this issue with our team members promptly, and hopefully, you'll allow us to make up for this experience in the future.

text: Awesome group of people .very honest bunch of men very polite and there were kind of to take me home while I waited.. as far as women I would take my car there anytime..

text: While traveling, we had a bad alternator. The shop did a great job with the repair and made a bad situation, much better.  Gary was super friendly and helpful.

name: Michelle Kuznicki
text:
I was heading to Gulf Shores, AL from Hazel Green, AL when my 2014 Jeep took a nosedive in Prattville, AL. After taking it to a Jeep dealership up there, and getting the call that nothing was wrong diagnostically and to come get my vehicle, I started my journey to Gulf Shores once again the next day.

However, about an hour into my drive my Jeep failed again. I chose D and D Automotive at random because I was in the middle of nowhere and had zero clue about my surroundings. I am so glad I did.

After my insurance company got me safely to their shop via tow truck, both Mr. Gary and Joe helped diagnose the issue (it was in fact the alternator), explained the repair to me, checked on me several times (mind you, I was in their shop for close to 6 hours with no where to go), and were incredibly knowledgeable about their trade.

I grew up around cars and can tell pretty quickly when people are in this business to rip off those in need and I can say, without-a-doubt, this shop genuinely cares about their patrons and those they serve. They could have *easily* waited to work on my car the next day but they were immediate in their desire to help and get me back on the road.

I could not be more thankful for their help and cannot recommend them enough. Hearts of gold and quality work, D and D Automotive is the place to go.

resp.text: Michelle, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate the 5 STARS!  We are so glad we would get you back on the road.   We appreciate your business and let us know if we can ever assist you again. Safe travels!

Phenomenal, honest, inexpensive care, they go the extra mile...actually it was closer to ten miles, I was halfway to Greenvile when my idler bearing seized on my Mercedes Benz 350 SLK, shredding my serpentine belt and leaving me properly stranded at Grace Garland exit. Hands down they are the absolute best, and in my case saved the day, and what would have been a long cold night on the side of I65. Thank you Gary and D&D, I owe you guys breakfast next time I'm up that way. AAA doesn't hold a candle to D&D 10/10 would not hesitate to use them again or recommend them to anyone, anytime.

name: Tiffany Walls
text: I absolutely ADORE Brian and Tammy! They have serviced my Hyundiai Tucson as well as a second vehicle for our family. In August 2019, I had my AC compressor replaced. I had shopped around some other businesses (including Firestone, which I would NEVER recommend) and I was quoted a far more reasonable price for parts and labor through Brian's. Brian took the time to diagnose my issue, explain what he would do to my vehicle, how the part worked and why the part that needed replacing wasn't working properly. After the repair, Brian took the time to have me look and listen to the new part, showed me the broken part before he disposed of it and even gave me some insight to another belt that may need replacing at a certain point. They won us over with their communication, responsiveness, kindness and honesty. They have customers for life because they did such a stellar job! Wonderful experiences at this shop!

name: Ethan Lake
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with a mechanic. I called several of the places around to see if I could bring my truck by and this was definitely the friendliest of them. Tammy answered my phone call and was beyond helpful. I instantly took the truck by and Brian greeted me as soon as I arrived. For the first time, a mechanic (Brian) actually took the time to hear me out and see what I thought the issue was. He checked various things in the truck and under the hood. He did a little tinkering and sent me on my way with no more problems! I will definitely be back, and for anyone else new to this area and looking for a place to get your vehicle fixed, go see Brian!

resp.text: Thank you Ethan!  We appreciate your review and look forward to helping you in the future.

text: Highly recommend Brian's Automotive, Tammy and Brian are wonderful people and they take the time and listen to you. I have a 2004 Chevy Silver ado 4 wheel drive and he has changed the transmission for me and some other work and he does great work. He does stay busy so he may have to keep your vehicle a little longer than normal but its worth it. Thanks Tammy And Brian.

name: Phillip Smart
text:
On may 9th 2020  I purchased tires from the Mavis on Highway 31 in Pelham. I went with the discount tires, because the last set I got from a Mavis ( trussville AL) lasted a decent amount of time mileage wise.
Here is my list of grievances
1. About two weeks later, I noticed one of the lug nuts was almost falling off. One round and it would have been off on the ground .This infuriates me even more, because I specifically instructed the technician to make sure I could get the lugs off with a regular lug wrench, as I do my own tire rotation and oil change every 5-7.5k. Three of the lugs were so tight I had to stand on the hands. Again, one was falling off, three were almost impossible to remove.
2. of course I got talked into the 89$ alignment
3. Its not my vehicle ( wife ), so it took me a couple of weeks to notice the bad vibration at 70mph, so back to the shop to get tires re balanced, which I already pay 75$ for. I did not go back to the Mavis because I don't trust them. They couldn't even tighten my lugs
4. When I get to the new tire place, I find out that all of my tires are set to 41 psi. 41!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Now the tires are cupping, which means they will need to be replaced soon.
5. One of the tires was out of balance

They were super quick to get an alignment and do it, but they couldn't even get my lugs on and get the tire pressure right?
This place is an embarrassment.

resp.text: We apologize, Phillip, We at Mavis believe you deserve nothing short of the best. We're so sorry for your experience. Your feedback is truly valued. You're right Phillip and we need to do better than this for you. Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can have the opportunity to talk to you!

name: Nick Lions
text: I picked my tires on their website July 15th and scheduled install on July 19th at 9am. I ordered the 3rd set of tires down the list that were recommended for my vehicle (2017 Ford Transit 250), Michelin Defender T+H. I work 6-7 days a week as a contractor so Sunday was really my only option to get tires on my work vehicle. I arrived early for my appointment, confirmed my appointment, and confirmed the tires with the employee behind the sales counter. I confirmed that the tires I ordered will be the best fit for my vehicle with the employee and he said they will be great for it. So my wife picked me up and we went about our day. I received a phone call at 11:18 informing me the tires are installed on my vehicle but they’re not going to work then proceeded to tell me they can order the correct tires for it but they won’t be here till Tuesday July 21st. I explained I can’t just leave my vehicle up there not working for 2 days, and asked if they can just put my old tires back on the van. The employee responded with yes but we will have to charge you for mount and balance, my only request was to install the tires with the best tread on the rear which he agreed to. I received a second call at 4:10 stating my vehicle was ready but that they close at 5 and needed to be there before 5 to pick it up. I arrived paid the clerk $75.96, received my keys, walked out to my truck to find my tires low, tire light on and the rear tires (almost bald) on the passenger side and the front tires (still had a good amount of tread on them) on the drivers side which was not what I asked. I asked if they could add some air to my tires and get my tire light to turn off. They did add air to my tires but when I asked about the tire light the manager had to stop putting Alabama stickers on his truck brought a computer tpms sensor out and showed me very quickly the tire pressure was fine and told me this would be expected with used tires... My tire light never went off like he said it would. Today is July 29th and I have yet to receive a phone call stating my tires have arrived or a update. I emailed Mavis corporate on July 23rd and have not received a response or anything. Never once did anyone apologize for the inconvenience that this mishap caused me that was clearly Mavis Tires fault and caused me to pay for their mistake. I at no point complained or expressed any frustration to the employees there because I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. I don’t ever leave bad reviews for businesses because I know what that can do to a business, but I did want to take a minute and send you a email about my experience. I ended up purchasing a set of tires from Discount Tires on Hwy 280 and it was a great experience. I called them in the morning they called me as soon as the tires arrived, and installed them the same day in less then 1 hour after leaving my vehicle with them. Upon arrival there was no tire light on and the tires had the proper amount of air in them. I hope this email helps in one way or form, I’m not complaining but just find it hard to understand why Mavis Discount tire would charge a customer any amount of money for a issue/mistake on their end.

resp.text: We're sorry, Nick Lions. we apologize your appointment time was not honored. Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can have the opportunity to talk to you!

text: Had a simple oil change done at this location got home and noticed oil pouring out of my car. Brought back to the store for them to fix. The shop manager said they left off the rubber seal on the filter. The amount of oil that leaked all over my motor was over a quart. They fixed the problem but didn’t clean all the excess oil from the motor so i still have oil dripping on my driveway.  I’m guess it the leftover oil because they said it couldn’t be anything else or it must be a leak somewhere else. I said the car wasn’t leaking when I brought it. They lost my business from this point on if you’re mechanic can’t do a simple oil change without checking it for leaks. Now i have a car with oil leak. Will probably have to take it somewhere else and have it fixed since they messed it up.  Good place for tires just don’t have anything else done here!

text: I give this company zero stars, it just wouldn't allow me to post without marking at least one star. We called around to various tire stores to compare prices. The man at Mavis Tires told us we could get two new tires, plus have the front tires moved to the back and everything balanced at an all in price with everything we needed at $224. We specifically asked if that included tax and were told it did. We made an appointment. When we arrived today for the appointment, the man at the register told us it would be $259, which is much higher than we were quoted originally and from other tire stores. We told him that we had been quoted $224 including product, labor and taxes, and he said no it's $259.  We feel like we were victims of a bait and switch. We chose not to accept the new price, and we left. We will never go to this business again.

text: I was pulling out of the RACEWAY and saw  something amazing. There was a guest leaving and one of the employees was actually walking the customer to the door. He waved at them I was like told him to have a good day obviously the customer said something back they smiled and waved and went to the vehicle. I called and spoke to the manager Richard and told him that walking to the customer to the door and giving a world-class experience is what separates the big boys from the little boys. Richard is the manager and told me that he was the one that actually walk the customer the door so I gave them a virtual high-five and say great job that's what we do  being in the service industry walking the customer to the door and give a world-class experience. World-class job tire engineers well class job Richard keep up the great work another hi five. Kind regards Kelly Lambert

name: Richard Sabol
text: The manager went out of his way to take care of me. I needed help. He went over and above.

name: Brian Spaeth
text: Do you need my business?  1 car in a bay and 1 car outside the tire side.  Pretty slow.  2 guys inside just looking at me and one of them sitting down. I use this company 100% of the time with my fleet company and have never been completely ignored.  2 minutes go by and I turn around and pull out to visit another one 2 miles down the road.  The reason I like this company is because they are fast and good with oil changes and tire rotations.

name: Leslie Kirk
text:
I had a slow leak in a tire (that developed into a not so slow leak) that I had brought to the attention of where I usually have my oil changed and tires rotated. They didn't find anything. I came to Tire Engineers because of a positive experience a few years back. I would say within 15 minutes (or less) of my arrival, the problem had been found and was on it's way to being fixed (it was a drywall screw in the tread). While waiting, the gentleman that checked me also discussed the life expectancy of my tires (he did not try to sell me anything). We also had a very nice conversation about what sounds like great place to eat in Louisiana.

Yes, it was a very nice experience.

text: I highly recommend Moates Auto Xchange! Jordan was awesome and went above and beyond for us. We were at another dealership and called to see what he could do for us. He got us a better deal on a better car, so we drove 2 and a half hours to get it! !We will go there from now on to buy!

name: Brent Vance
text:
Worked with Mitch here and was not disappointed. He didn’t BS me or tried to conceal any information.

He also let me come after hours to see a car and then stayed an additional 3 hours after closing to work finance terms on my 2013 Elantra.

The car is very clean and they put a lot of miscellaneous service work that I requested before I picked it up a couple days later.

I highly recommend this business.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Vance! Dont forget to come back for your free Oil Change!

name: Len Gordon
text: My wife and I purchased a used Tahoe from them. We dealt with Jordan during the purchase. I have purchased several used vehicles that items were given a "Band Aid" to hide problems and that did not occur here. Overall I feel they were honest and did not try to hide anything from us. I came with a change of clothes and gloves to go through the vehicle myself, instead they let me go through the car on one of their racks. The vehicle checked out as we had discussed. Also, I might add that I feel like Jordan really put in the extra effort to ensure he earned our business. The paperwork and transaction was simple and very straight forward.

resp.text:
Thank you guys, it was a pleasure to meet you.  We look forward
to helping you and your friends in the future.  Dale Moates

name: David Giles
text: Bought a gorgeous low mileage Miata from Jordan and crew.  They were very friendly and honest and the vehicle was just as described except for one minor issue.  I had been told it had a new battery, but during inspection we discovered that the battery was not new. It was just a mix-up and they were happy to install a new battery while we were finishing up the financial side of the deal.  Would have loved to have gotten the car at a bit lower price (who wouldn't?) but this was an exceptional low-mileage one-owner specimen, and they did work with me on the price.  I've shopped Miatas for quite some time and lately Carvana seems to have almost cornered the market on clean low-mileage Miatas and have jacked the prices up really high.  But I was able to buy this Miata well below what Carvana would have priced it at, and I feel that I got a good deal considering the current market and the premium condition of this vehicle  (and lots of buyers have had very bad experiences with Carvana, so I'm glad I didn't have to deal with them).  Highly recommend Moates Auto Xchange and would absolutely do business with them again!

resp.text: Thank you Mr Giles for the review.  We appreciate your kind words, yes Carvana is not what everyone thinks it is, I've heard nothing but horror stories and that "return policy" is quite the scam.  Enjoy that beautiful Miata.

name: AJ Nashville
text: Ive had incredible luck with Moates. As an out of state buyer you typically run into questions that most local buyers dont have. Simply because you cannot see the car first hand. Ive always ran into an issue that when I showed up at other places to pick up my nice new car, its never what I expected it to be. Thats not the case with Moates. The staff there has been extremely forth coming and honest when it comes to small things like dings and scratches on a car. This way when I arrive, I know what to expect. My next car will come from here, its a drive but its one that I see as well worth the time. Thanks Moates for an awesome car buying experience!

name: S. Berlet
text: We bought a great car at a great price from an awesome sales person! Thank you Jordan McDonald for an incredible and quick car buying experience.

resp.text: Glad we could help you get a great vehicle at a great price! Thanks for letting us know how everything went for you, and we're always here to help if you need anything else. -Dale M., Business Owner

name: Rev. Clayton Lassiter
text: I bought my wife her 2018 Sonata and got a great deal from Dale and the team. I would and probably will buy again and I live 3 hours away now!

resp.text: Satsuma, I'm so glad I was able to help you and your wife find the perfect car! Whenever we can help, don't hesitate to stop by or give us a call. -Dale M., Business Owner

name: Jodi Berger
text: How dare you assume that we are ungrateful. My husband gave them more than half for the vehicle. It was NOT at no cost. This is not about the church, who helped us tremendously during hard times. That was pretty low of you. You sold the vehicle "as is," I understood what that meant. My husband was warned "do not drive it very far." After a week, a main component (the fly wheel and belt), literally fell out of the vehicle while I was driving. I lost all power. I and/or my husband or someone else could have been fatally injured. The reason for what happened was that it was improperly torqued. We would have been back to not having a vehicle. Only the parts that you replaced were new, everything else had to be replaced from factory parts. Hadn't you even done a tune up? The filters were all factory. Like I said, "as is," but it should have been thoroughly inspected by a mechanic. Most likely, you only did what was necessary to pass the inspection. Do not assume that because I'm female that I don't know anything about cars. I do, I was the owner of a NASCAR in the '80s and raced with the legends. You wanted an edit, this is what happened and your response was shameful.

resp.text:
As clearly stated on the CARFAX history service records. 7/3/18  Control Arms, Ball Joints, and Sway Bar links and alignment. All Parts replaced were new OEM quality, I have the receipts.  Repair order #19147  anyone disputing that is misleading you, btw.

This work was done prior to your "acquisition."

I say "acquisition" because you DID NOT buy / purchase ANYTHING. This old (but clean) 1996 SUV was as a GIFT to you at NO COST by a charitable group of church members to help you, to give you a way to go.  You paid for NOTHING for that vehicle (which given to you) well over a year ago.
If you "could have BOUGHT a brand new car" why did you need others to pool their money to GIVE you an SUV?

Rethink who you call "Swindlers" next time you decide to get mad because your 23 year old vehicle might need some maintenance.

I'll give you the opportunity to edit your review and apologize for your comments and misleading review.  Only actual customers leave reviews and comments per Google's Policy and you have never spent $1 here.  You are NOT a customer and obviously you are NOT thankful either.

P.S.  If anyone who works with charitable organizations and give their time and money to help others, please do not let "this example" deter you from your heart's desires and work.  Most people are very thankful.

text: I love getting my car fixed at Moates! They are excellent! I just love Bryan, Wayne, and Calvin Cole! They are hilarious and everytime I go they give me a wonderful experience. They fix my car right on up. Their customer service is amazing. If I could I would give them 100 stars!!!!

I am old and knew what I wanted to drive. I knew how the technical things worked on this car and I had to have that car. I am usually not this spoiled but I was so happy with my Edge.
Mitch Sebastian was wonderful to work with. I got a great price. He even delivered it to me which was so important since my husband has Lewy Body dementia and does not travel well and my brother lives across the state.
I will go to Moates Xchange and Mitch for any future car needs I have.

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

name: Joshua Kirts
text: I was stranded on the interstate with my wife and one year old daughter in the blistering heat in desperate need of help (hundreds of miles from home); I had a flat tire and when I pulled the spare from the trunk, it too was also flat.  A man pulled up asking if I needed help, I told him what was going on and he said that he would take the tire, that initially caused us to be stranded, and repair it at his place of employment (THE CHANGE) and bring it right back.  After returning with my repaired tire I tried to give him money, he refused, I tried to convince him to take the money, but he still refused.  Really the only request he had was to pray with him; therefore, my family and an additional driver that pulled over to help prayed with this unknown man on the side of the interstate.  All I know is that this man worked for "THE CHANGE".....The moral of this story is we live in a time where ethics are not always important to the standard employee, and with vehicles becoming more and more difficult to work on, we rely on mechanics and businesses to be honest.  If "THE CHANGE" hires other employees like this unknown man, I would be a customer for life.
