name: Covenant Wildlife
text: Decided to give this new location a shot with one of my companies trucks that needed tires. After they installed the tires I left and within 30 min the TPS light came on. The technician never calibrated the sensors. I called the store and told them what happened and the guy said to bring it back by and I told him that it would have to be tomorrow as I had a full route planned and did not expect it to take over 2 hours to just install 4 tires and that I was late for my customers. I asked if I could bring it by in the am and he said that was fine that the tech would calibrate the sensors and that it would only take a min to do. I show up this am  (after clearing some time on my calendar) and I tell the guy who I am and what I am there for and he informs me that they have no mechanic available to do this and that I would have a pretty long wait. I tell him that if the tech did his job correctly, I would not even have to be here a second time. He just says sorry. So I make an appointment for Tuesday to come back a tired time for something the tech should have done right in the beginning. I will take my fleet plus my personal cars elsewhere. Probably go right next door to Christian Brothers.

name: Craig Winn
text: Love the Firestone auto care locations. One of the service reps from the Pelham location is moving here. Great guy and lots of help. Looking forward to this addition in our neighborhood.

name: Richard Thompson
text:
Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.
I spent 10 minutes on the phone the day before letting the guy know that I was in search of a car mechanic I could trust to tell me what NEEDS to be fixed on my car, not what makes them the most money.  He assured me they would take care of me and he completely understood and that I could trust them.  The next day, after bringing my car in, it was clear they were trying to upsell with strong recommendations for everything from new tires (still have 5k-10k of tread) to all new brakes and rotors for the whole car to the $130 "fuel treatment system", to a NEW SUSPENSION FOR MY CAR.  Yes, they tried to recommend I buy a new suspension system.

I will never go there again and will go find a different mechanic I can trust.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: Fast and friendly service! I had something stuck in my tire and I only had to wait about 30 minutes for them to repair it and get it back on my van. I will definitely be back!

name: Richard Gayheart
text: My initial experience was pleasant and we discussed what was necessary to fix the truck. I needed to order a specialty part to finish the work. When I brought the part in, there was a different person running the front. At that point, things went downhill. Now I needed several new parts. The person was condescending and spoke to me like I didn’t have a clue. After I explained I had cleared the repairs with the first person and we had emailed the parts needed, this new person demanded to see the email. I retrieved the email and the reply was ‘wow, that was an expensive part’ and told me I needed more parts. I left the store because further conversation was not going to improve the situation. The next day I called the store and spoke with the original front person. My issues were resolved and the truck was fixed, but I will not return based on the second person I interacted with.

name: Tim Hedderly
text: Employees are friendly and personable.  I live in Helena, but will (am) traveling to the 280 location for this service.

name: Brent Curtin
text: I'm a little disappointed.  i went in to see if they could patch my tire.  its run flat so they said they couldn't.  said i need to buy a new tire.  that's ok.  was told that at other locations.  but then he told me that i need 2 new tires on the back as well.  my car is brand new and has 18,000 miles on it and i know tires can go bad at 18,000 miles, unlikely, but can happen.  that was a real turn off trying to sell something not needed.  when i used to go to another of their locations in mobile, the girls and guys down there had me running on slicks before they tried to sell me a tire.  they made sure i didnt buy tires until i really needed them and they had my loyalty.  trying to rip people off isnt a way to get return customers especially when they are putting competition right across the street from you.  just my opinion.

text: This location was led by Wendell and was heads and shoulders better than the service I received at my previously chosen location. I'll definitely be back soon... even if I have to go 30 mins out of my way to get there.

text: Best and most trusted place to get your car fixed in all of Tuscaloosa!!! The people who work here are the definition of southern hospitality. I've never had such an enjoyable experience while getting my car fixed (I got to hang out with the sweetest dog in the waiting room). They walked me through what they were doing with my car and made me feel informed. They even fixed something small for free because they noticed it. Can't recommend them enough!

text: I come here for all my repair needs. The place is run by 2 brothers who have decades of experience. They are extremely honest and always work to get you the best price for what you need. They won’t recommend additional work just to make an extra buck. You can’t go wrong!

text: The gentleman that help me was very kind.  he checked the brakes on a car and saw that I did not need new brakes and he was not trying to sell me something I did not need. I Highly Recommend going here...

name: Vance Olmstead
text: Although Midas is a national company this one has a mom and pop type vibe to it. they're extremely honest (which is surprising considering the business), and super professional. Today's visit had me going in and checking why my brakes are constantly squeeling. They took a look at it, and told me they were fine. They didn't try to replace something that wasn't broken, nor did they try to find something else wrong with my car. No charge and on my way within about 30 minutes. Highly recommend them!

text: The brothers who own the Tuscaloosa Midas, as well as the other employees, were very genuine and helpful throughout the whole process. They took the time to explain the problems I was having with the rear shocks on my car, as well as showed me how worn the shocks were. I would recommend the honest service of this shop to anyone who is deciding where to get car work done.

text:
Pretty much got scolded going here. Due to an issue that really wasn’t taken seriously.
I won’t be going here again.

My family and my boyfriend even drove the car. They still notice the problem.

Took it Hyundai and they actually diagnosed the problem.

text: Great team of technicians & office staff caring for customers .

text: Shop of honest guys doing an honest day's work. Very friendly, very upfront with the costs.  There were no hidden charges or surprises. Very efficient work done as quickly as possible.  You don't feel like you are being taken advantage of.

name: Alexis Brewe
text: Very dissatisfied with my experience here. I chose Midas based on the great reviews and went to the shop to get an oil change and maintenance check, because my car had been shaking the last few days. The maintenance tech did not properly check my tires, inform me of the extent of damage to my tires, or give me any answers about the shaking. I had a tire blow on the interstate four days later that caused an incredible amount of damage to my vehicle. First time in my life that I’ve gone to a car shop and they haven’t recommended that I buy new tires, and I seriously wish they had. I wouldn’t go here again.

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for the feedback. We are very sorry to hear that you didn't get excellent customer experience we expect to be provided to our customers. We'd really like to talk to you more in regards to your experience, but we need some additional information from you first. Please click goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

Will definitely return there next time I need work done.

He even told my husband, "I don't know why she didn't just take it to the other location." (referring to me. ) Would not recommend. That employee just completely ruined my experience with this company.

name: Jake Jones
text: Great place. I'm usually out in 30-45 minutes when getting oil changed. The key to not waiting hours is to not go when everyone else does (as is with any other service). They offer shuttle service to the surrounding areas. They seem to retain their employees which means you are getting experienced techs each time. Recently when getting my oil changed, the tech found $10 in my seat. They made a point to bring it to me. To me this showed that I can trust them (in all honesty I didn't even know it was there!) I've also gotten tires here and they gave me a great price and did a great job.

name: ashli Jennings
text: Always a great experience.  Great customer service!

name: Bill Wolfe
text:
First visit I woke up to oil all over my garage floor the next morning.  Care was not taken to capture the oil when they changed it and left my skid plate full of oil which resulted in the mess.  Not to mention the oil that blew all over my exhaust and the smell I had to tolerate.  Complained to manager and received a sincere apology.  He asked that I give them a chance to do it right.

Second chance...  Leaving on a trip Saturday.  I called Thursday to inquire about an appointment.  I was told they do not accept appointments but they will be happy to work me in Friday.  I took 2 hours of vacation in order to allow ample time for my oil change and tire rotation (arrived at 1:00 PM).    When I arrived I was told they were not accepting any more oil changes for the day.  I explained I had called the previous day and was told that I would be  accommodated.  The reply from the counter was "Don't know what to tell ya..." while bouncing a pen on the counter and sucking air through his teeth.

There won't be a third chance.

name: Stacie Haney
text: Took our van for a quote that was outrageous. Said we would get one somewhere else and the man refused to give my husband the car keys back and that we would have to pay to have it towed. Said legally they have the right to refuse to return our vehicle to us. What’s legal is us signing a document that we will not sue them if we get in an accident after we leave their place and chose not to use their services. They can not legally keep our car no matter how unsafe it is. Once he said we are going somewhere else the guy said he was just kidding and would throw in a discount if we stayed Took it to Farrar instead for better service, price and done professionally.

name: Randy Lambert
text:
Unprofessional and Poorly Managed, Don't Go Here.

I went to Midas in Meridianville for specific (rear diff) and general (oil change etc) services, I choose to do business here after a midweek visit asking if they could provide everything I am looking for. The Manager indicated they provided those services and I made a 7:30 am appointment for a few days later. Appointment day I arrive at the appointed time to locked doors and wait 15 minutes for someone to show up, while I was waiting I noticed trash from the previous days services and appointments all in the service bays. With the late open and the trashy appearance I should have left as these are signs of poor management. They took custody of my vehicle for the remainder of the day, of which I had to call them at closing time to see if there was an update, they were unaware of the status and had to call me back. When I heard back from them they said it was done and we agreed I would pick up the following morning, when I arrived they indicated half of the things I asked to be done weren't done and they can not do them (rear dif & and tire service). I was not charged for the items but now I need to make another service appointment elsewhere.

Separately, one of the Technicians blocked my wife and kids in while they were dropping me off. I went out to ask him to move of which he replied "she can get by", I followed up and asked him to please move, she is driving a larger unfamiliar vehicle (my truck) and would appreciate some extra space. He slurred at me under his breath and attempted to coal roll me in the parking lot.

resp.text: Hi Randy, we are sorry that you did not have a positive experience at our location. If you'd like to tell us more, please visit https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

So far,, (because I have to take it back

With All new system its harder to apply "what brakes I do have them my peterbilt with a 53 foot and 80k lbs load on board. So far I'm $3000 in the hole and my truck runs worse Note that it was good, I just wanted to have it restored. So much for restoration. All new system ! SO FAR, VERY VERY DIS SATISFIED.   CHECK BACK WITH ME, IF THIS THING DONT GET ME OR MY FAMILY KILLED TAKING IT BACK. Either way, check back with me, because if it isn't fixed properly and something happens you will hear from me or my sons or lawyer. Cant believe this kind of stuff from Midas. But I do now!!!!!!!

name: Thad Hankins
text: Finally got into a bay. Requested the full service oil change. Start filling out the card, a gentleman asks me how long since the oil had been changed. Told him I wasn't sure, it's my son's car. Immediately shows me gunk gunk on the oil cap and says I need another service (which may be the case but at that moment, I only wanted the oil change). I say just the oil change. He huffs at me and as I sit there with my window down, he begins berating me to the gentleman who has already opened up hood. He made a couple of more comments I couldn't hear and then said something to the effect of "I told him. He said no so it's on him if something goes wrong." Yep. It is. So, I politely said "Never mind, I don't want anything. Close the hood, I'll go somewhere else." Which I did. As if it's not bad enough to have to listen to them try to up-sell you 50 different things, for them to then mock you condescendingly while you sit right there is terribly unprofessional and maybe the worst customer service I've ever experienced. Just my experience, though. Go and draw your own conclusions.

resp.text: We are disappointed to receive your feedback and would like to visit with you a bit further regarding your feedback. If you are willing, please reach out to our Market Manager, Mike Veros, at 334-799-1849. Thanks for your business. We appreciate you!

name: Garry Singleton
text:
Report "overfill" of tire air at American Lube Fast upon last visit. 6.24.2018. It caused a front tire to fail as a "bubble" appeared on the tire tread area after a 6 hour round-trip the next week. I checked air pressure to find a whopping 45 lbs in each front tire. The rear tires were still around 35 lbs per tire. I ended up having to buy a new tire to replace it. This set of tires still had plenty of tread remaining and could have been used for another year before replacement.
Why was this done? You should let the work crew know this. Although the crew was nice, they always try to get that last dollar from you by offering the extra flush or services, and only because I feel that someone neglegently overfilled the front tires to an unheard of 45 to 46 pounds, which ultimately caused me to buy new tires, I won't be back. After returning from the trip and trying to get the tires rotated and balanced at Walmart, I found out about the bubble forming on a front tire had happened only days after getting my oil changed at ALF and making the trip. Sorry, but I lost confidence in your services.

name: Andrew Roberts
text: Spent over $1200 and never got the problem fixed. Brought my car in and told them exactly what was going on. They misdiagnosed it twice and charged me over $1200. After the second time, I decided to tackle the problem myself. 2 hours of researching forums and a $15 sensor from autozone fixed the problem. Steer clear of this shop. Their mechanics are not properly trained.

resp.text:
Andrew – We cannot find any Andrew Roberts as a customer since 2012, and that was for only $185. We did try to call the last number in our records to reach out, but that number no longer works.  Perhaps this review was incorrectly posted to the wrong business?

If you visited us under another name, we would like to talk and better understand this situation, as we always educate customers about concerns first, and never sell services or repairs they do not need.  205-663-6088.  Thank you.

name: Jason Naron
text: Melton Automotive is great including Doug and everyone he has on staff.  My wife and I have used Melton for over 13 years and they have worked on all of our cars at a reasonable cost.  They have always been honest regarding work estimates for service/repair and have completed each repair thoroughly.

name: Charles Boyd
text: Poor communication and double talk - two bad experiences in a row. I would steer away from this place. Maybe they were good at one time but not any more.  I want to do loyal business with an honest repair shop. This isn’t it!

resp.text:
Mr Boyd -  1) Our communication with our customer, your son, was clear.  2) Your son only paid for the diagnostic on his first visit, chose not to make repairs, and was appreciative of our thoroughness. 3) After taking his vehicle to another shop that made some attempt at repairs, he returned to us asking us to fix a couple of the critical issues of the many we diagnosed.  The fact that some key parts needed are unavailable for this particular vehicle is no fault of his or ourselves or speak to the skill and talent of our technician, nor the honesty of our business. 4) After we communicated to your son we could not source parts needed, we agreed to remove the parts we had already installed and did not charge his any labor for this authorized work.

We are disappointed to find a review not based on your own experience with us a customer.  Negative reviews with no merit harm our business and our hard-working employees and their families.  Had you been involved in each piece of communication, you would find our recommendations were in the best interests of your son, were clear, and in the end – your son did not pay for parts or any of the hours of work our technician performed.  We understand your sons vehicle needs are very frustrating. We hope he finds a solution quickly, and you get your own vehicle back soon.  If any customer ever has questions or concerns, I am always available to help at 205-663-6088. - Doug Melton

name: Whit Allen
text: Melton's was recommended to me from a friend who has been using them for years.  My car was repaired and returned in an expected time frame and cost under estimated price.  04 Tundra.  Very pleased and will be back when necessary.

resp.text: Whit - We appreciate the review and the 5 stars!  Thank you for the kind words.

name: Alyssa Oliver
text:
Called up there to schedule a drop off. Because they had good reviews. Not the friendliest person who answered the phone. That's fine but when I told him what was going on he said we dont do transmission work. My problem is it says they do on their website. Rude and waste of time. Going to add to the post I was discriminated against I guess because I'm a woman. my husband called the place and said exactly what I said the problem
Was and they told him yes they do that there.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Oliver. We do not rebuild transmissions, but we do remove and replace transmissions with either used transmissions or remanufactured transmissions. A gentleman called yesterday and obtained a price to replace the torque convertor. I am not sure if this was your husband or not, but we can replace a torque convertor because it is physically attached to the transmission and is not an internal part. I believe there may have been some miscommunication as to what was required to repair the vehicle/transmission. Alabaster Automotive, LLC prides itself in servicing EVERYONE in the community and we do not discriminate against anyone based on sex, ethnicity, religion, etc. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to me with a phone call. Thank you.

I am recommending them to all of my friends no matter where they live in Alabama. Thank you for the little blessings Alabaster Auto!

Fantastic service !

name: Andrae Antwoine
text: They explain, very professional, but not accountable for any mistakes.  I have 4 kids and wife, the expense was necessary..they had to replace spark plugs, explained that if removed, Its a possibility some will break off...well 1 got stuck in the engine.....it requires taking everything out and restructure how it was before...with no mistakes...so it took 2-3 weeks to get it done...after 3100$ mechanic informed us #1 he drove the car 65 miles testing the truck..no gas reimbursement (not considering our financial needs)....#2.that our sensor light was not working, (but we never had an issue with it),they didn't charge us for replacing it, but now it  ironically reads an alternator light.  #3 The mechanic simply said, i don't know why it came on, but it needs to be replaced. Although, your safe to drive it home.   #4. 2 weeks later, a great amount of smoke begins to shoot out exhaust...that very day, I took it to another auto place to get it assessed. (my red flags were to much).The other repair shop did not go into detail, but towed it back to alabaster, free of charge told them the issue and Alabaster Auto's  said "we'll give them a call".  #5 2 days later, I called them...ask "what is the problem?" they replied: The fluid injectors ironically messed up within 2 weeks, causing oil to spill onto the motor, "washing it out"...not only did they tell me an alternator was needed, but now I have to buy a new motor. Their excuse was....this is all a coincidences. they don't know why these thing are happening to my ford expedition that is under 120,000 miles. I called the other auto store to come and get it...I'll pay them what is necessary, but I am not spending another dime at alabaster Auto's.  We are taking legal action against them immediately after proof of fault. I can't except "it's all a coincidence".

resp.text: Andrae, one of our goals is to be honest and forthright with our customers. Also, we make every effort to ensure our customers are satisfied.  We deeply regret not being able to do so in your situation.

That should speak volumes in of itself.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write this nice review! We're glad you like our work, prices, and that you can see how much Ricky and the team care about our customers like you. Thanks again and see you next time!

text: Been using these guys for the 2 years I lived in Alabaster.  Mechanics John and Randall are great, they will talk to you, make suggestions and both tell and show you what they are doing.  Only issue was when I took my vehicle to them right before Christmas and it was 3 days to even look at the car.  I didn't have the time so I took it to another Alabaster repair shop..................................MAJOR MISTAKE!!!  Keep up the great work Wayne and Ricky and all involved at Alabaster Auto! Thanks. Ben

resp.text: You're welcome, Ben. Thank you for your review and continued business with us!

name: Dayon Lane
text:
Do NOT aide this place. My CRV had to go in to have the fan assembly replaced. Upon getting it back I saw that my A/C no longer blew cold and my automatic window function no longer worked. Then, when taking it in to be looked at, I found that they BROKE what holds to coolant reservoir and just had it sitting, and it was empty. They had lost two of the caps on the front, AND they didn’t attach the grill back correctly.

I called them and they said to bring it in Saturday. I head that way and call them to tell them I’m on the way. And they inform me not to come Bc they are not able to do it Saturday and to come Monday. Isn’t an option for me. I paid $532 for them to essentially break my car. WILL never go back.

name: Andrew Hicks
text: GREAT staff! Very friendly and professional. The level of service on my car was too notch. We won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank you for all of the great feedback, Andrew!

text: Had alternator and pulley replaced in June this year here.  Recently car wasnt  starting had to jump off took car to 2 places to check battery and alternator checked (free)was told it was alternator so took in here and they checked said it was the battery which I have no problem with but when I got there it was 42 dollar. Guess I should have asked first just assumed the shop that did the work would have done it free too.  Lesson learned I guess.

We recently had one of our cars worked on here and the service was fantastic.  My son and his family have their cars worked on here as well.

They were Saturday but got us in quickly within a few mins. The mechanic and the older gentleman in the office were very friendly and courteous. The gentleman sent us on our way to enjoy our vacation and didn't charge us. If you're having car trouble in this area this is your place. They are Great folks!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! Our main concern has always been the safety and satisfaction of our customers. We’re glad to hear we have delivered that. Thanks again, Justin!

text: The store manager Ricky Tidmore lied to my family and took over $12,000 dollars all the while blaming me on how the car was driven. Sold us a transmission when the motor and transmission needed to be replaced. DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

text: My last review wasn't what I intended. I just figured how to change it. They really do have a five star rating with me.

resp.text: If there is anything we can do to earn the 5th star warren please let us know.

name: kevin armstrong
text: I came here to have a plug put in my trailer tire. I waited and was told to back my truck around. When i started backing in someone else whips in and i was forced to stop. He comes up to my window and tells me to wait just a minute and let him take care of this customer. I waited another 10-15 minutes. He finally plugs my tire, i pay and leave. I drive 1/2 Mile home. Get up the next morning and the tire is low again. I drive back down there and tell them something was wrong. There was one person in the lobby and he tells me the wait would be at least one hour to put air in my tire. I had to unload several things from my trailer to get to tools needed for me to put air in it myself. I did this in there parking lot as they say inside and watched me. They won't make there wrongs right. Expert tire is right across the street.

resp.text: Kevin, when we reached out it sounded like you had no issues with your experiences at our shop after we offered to assist in any way we could. If there are any further concerns, please reach out to us as we would like to clear up any misunderstandings. Thank you.

name: Chase Miller
text:
First time customer, came in off recommendation from a friend.

Staff friendly, clean waiting room, good location, fair advertised prices.

3 stars due to being told over phone an oil change would be 20-30 mins wait, showed up 20 mins after the call and I sat in the waiting area over 1-1/2 hrs (I waited because I understand business, and things do happen) without anyone informing me of any delays. I left without recieving any service.

Don't set expectations and then not fulfill them without an explanation, before money walks out the door.

resp.text: Chase, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and for the feedback on your visit. We apologize if any part of your experience was less than satisfactory and we hope to have the opportunity in the future to work with you. If there is anything else that we are able to help with please feel free to give us a call.

name: Ben Turner
text:
Been using these guys for about a year since moving to Alabaster. Their hourly rate is the cheapest I have found anywhere and they always take care of my problems on both my cars. Oil changes are only about $22 and that includes a tire rotation and they don't try to upsell you on a bunch of crap you don't need like alot of other places in the area who offer cheap oil changes and then make it up with additional "needs fixing items".

The mechanics and the 2 gentlemen at the front desk are always helpful, and courteous even though they are always busy and I can't thank them enough.

I don't believe for a second these 2 reviews that say they did such a poor job and accept that some people are never happy unless they can drag everyone else into the misery pit where they reside.

Thanks Alabaster Auto and I will continue to use you and recommend you to my friends as long as I am in this area.

Ben

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review, Ben! We take great pride in both our work and customer service - glad to see both show through! Please keep us in mind for any future services.

resp.text: Thanks so much for complimenting our friendly service, Angela!

name: Billy Lee
text: I have done alot of business with these guys over the years both personally and with the company i work for. They have never disappointed me. They one thing i have liked the most about them is that when i pull up, they have time (or at least act like they do) to stop what theyvare doing and come out to my car and talk to me about what i want.

resp.text: We know your how valuable time can be, Billy, thanking you for choosing our shop by learning about what's going wrong with your cars is the least we can do! We appreciate your support of our local business and we look forward to your next visit!

text: Great place to Shop for Tires and oil changes and much more in Service.

resp.text: Thank You for the 5 Star Rating! We really appreciate  your business!

name: J Moe
text:
I had one good experience and one not so good one at Andalusia Tire. I bought tires as well as had needed front end work done on my truck. That was the good experience. I should add they have had the same mechanic for years and he has a well deserved reputation for competence.
The most recent vist to purchase tires for my car was not so good. It was shocking enough that the owner helping me abruptly left for a lunch engagement in the middle of the sale promising to call me after lunch. Even more so when I never received the call back to order the tires. Needless to say I took my business elsewhere and won't be returning.

resp.text: J Moe, we apologize for the misunderstanding. We try to treat all of our customers with the respect we would want to be treated with. If you could please give us a call we would like to correct the situation. Thank you.

name: Tom Kozar
text: An honest owner and hard-working, skilled mechanics. Mike, the owner, is friendly and professional. He takes the time to explain the issue and the repair needed to correct it. I have had other shops like 10-minute oil change chains tell me I needed work done on my car, taken it to Hampton Cove Auto and had Mike tell me "You are good, there is nothing wrong with your car."  I have been a customer of Hampton Cove Auto for 17 years, highly recommend!

name: Timothy Wyant
text: Timothy Wyant Google's #1 Review Guide!  Very friendly and fast service. Took the time to discuss all work being done before starting. Thank you I'll sure return again.

name: Adam Henson
text: I had an urgent repair last minute before a long trip to the beach and they did a great job at a good price. They also fixed my wife’s air conditioner and it works perfectly. This is a family owned shop and the lead mechanic is the owner. He doesn’t pay someone to do the work for him so you know the work is done right. I recommend this shop

resp.text: HOPE YOU HAD A GREAT TRIP. THANK YOU FOR LETTING US SERVE YOU!!

name: Marianne Manley
text: The most amazing HONEST mechanic I’ve ever dealt with. Very reasonable price and very accommodating to my crazy schedule. I truly appreciate everything he did.

name: Rich Pflederer
text: Traveling on way to vacation and about five miles before their shop I lost both belts on my car.  No power steering, A/C, water pump, alternator, this at 2:30 in the afternoon.  They pulled it in, ordered the parts, installed and back on the road at 4:30.  Great shop, outstanding service!!

name: Dylan Hicks
text:
This is a scam run by Greg Talley. Look up his criminal record and all the lawsuits he's lost.
I'm a former employee. If you'd like info on all the illegal business practices taking place email me at dylanchicks97@gmail.com

resp.text: As i replied to your complaint months ago, you are posting your complaint on the site for Hampton Cove Auto Service. Greg Talley is the operator of Cove Auto, Let me be PERFECTLY clear, Greg Talley has NO association with MY business, Hampton Cove Auto Service. We who work in this  business know how Greg operates.  My name is Michael Cox & i have owned & operated Hampton Cove Auto Service since 1998. And as for you Mr. Hicks you have never been an employee of Hampton Cove Auto Service.

name: Zeke H
text: This is a great mom and pop auto service center and the staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating. I had an emergency repair and they fixed my suv on the spot without delay. I was so happy with the service and the price I even tipped my service technician. I will get all my future vehicle repairs or maintenance at this shop.

resp.text: we appreciate us the opportunity to help you out. Please, let us know if we can help you with anything again. Thank you

name: John Muhlhauser
text:
December 2017: Amazing customer service! Highly recommend
January 2019: Mike and Jaquata were again fantastic. Not only through their customer service but demonstrated through their technical skills.  I never feel like just "another customer". This family run business is best in town. Excellent service, again highly recommended. I would rate Hampton Cove Auto Service 10 out of 5 Stars if I could.

resp.text: We appreciate the opportunity to service you and your family.

name: Toby Keef
text: I can not be seen to even get service. I have been by three times to get my vehicle serviced to get told to call on this day or that day. I understand that you are busy but how's about offering a time slot or an appointment.  Often people have to change there life and there families life around to free up a vehicle. Just doesn't seem professional or considerate as a business looking to supply there community and there clients with service.

resp.text: Once again mistaken Hampton Cove Auto for Cove Auto. We set appointments for our customers.

name: Shaun Osborne
text: New management. Used prior to change, always fair. Went by because air quit blowing cold. Asked how much to hook up gauges to test pressure and was told "shouldn't be any charge". The compressor was engaging and disengaging so i figured it might be plugged. The technician hooked it up and saw the high side was too high and low side very low. It was plugged. They tried to say they had to pull codes and all this junk and i told them it runs fine except for the a/c. I shut off the a/c and it ran fine, it would bog down when the compressor engaged. They tried to make more out of it, then charged me $45. Avoid if possible.

resp.text: Not us!! WE have been here since 1998, no new management.

name: Kirk Ward
text: Great Service and always a fair price.

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us.

name: Andrew Raymond Crawford
text: I am looking to purchase a 2002-2006 Cadillac Escalade and I used Hampton Cove Auto Services for the pre-purchase inspection of an example I was considering.  The car seemed ok to me, although I knew there were some issues with the shock absorbers and brakes.  The PPI was the best $55 I ever spent and saved me from getting mired in a long list of reliability problems and expensive repairs that would have equaled the purchase price of the car!  I haven't found the right car yet, but will try to bring a few more examples to Hampton Cove Auto Services until we identify the right one.  As well as having a diligent technical team, I have found Jaquata on the customer service side to be both accommodating and very personable.  My neighbor says she has been happily using Hampton Cove Auto Services for many years and it's very easy to see why.  I will use them again as my first preference auto mechanic.

name: HC Kwok
text: Been going there on and off for 10 years.  Convenient location if you live in Hampton Cove.  Good work with fair price.

name: Brenda Myrick
text: Fellows do a good job.

name: William Deacon
text: I was on a road trip 650 miles from my local dealership, when the vehicle developed a problem. Turns out the wheel speed sensors where the issue. I call my dealer who advised me to find a dealership that could make the repair... easier said than done. I was told 10-14 days before the service could be performed... until I spoke to Shannon Stull at Century Auto. I briefly defined the situation in hope that the parts and time might be available. In record time Shannon with the cooperation Chris Pope, where able to order overnight the proper parts and squeeze the car in for service. The parts did arrive and the service was performed without issue. I’m sure it was a team effort to make this happen, and thanks to the professionals who actually installed the parts! Clearly this Dealership, Century Auto has the service and professional staff to get the the job done. My night mare hunting trip was saved by the team, to include transportation to and from the rental car. Everyone I met at the dealership was outstanding, but I can’t say enough about Shannon and Chris.. true professionals. THANK YOU, for all the efforts and the time you saved me!

resp.text: William, thank you for sharing your experience and I am glad the team was able to help.

name: Necedah Townsend
text: My Porsche was at the Huntsville shop for over an week after I told and showed the parts guy and manger Shannon what was wrong with my Porsche.  We pulled up the part and I left under the impression that the part was being ordered because it was going to take at least two days to arrive. Therefore when the part was scheduled to arrive was the timing I was told my car would be looked at by the technician. Lies lies lies .... I had to keep calling Shannon the manager to find out if there was any information on the arrival of the part ... how much will it cost and never an direct answer. Every time  it was let me call you back and I am about to go follow up. And never return the call/s. After my car was there for a week I called again to only find out the part was not ordered and they were ordering it that day. Which meant at least another two days waiting for the one part that we knew I needed to arrive. The sad thing is this is the only place locally that are certified to work on my car or get parts from. I had to get a rental twice for a week because I never knew when my car would be ready. Extremely Poor Customer Service. Lastly they called me at 4:00 to tell me my car was ready when they close at 5:00 with only an estimate for cost. Never stating that they did not except certain payments. Noted on my receipt I had a premium car wash lol.  My car was so dirty on the outside. I had just gotten the inside detailed myself. Such a joke.

resp.text: We are so sorry about the miscommunication regarding our service scheduling. While we can accommodate walk in clients, our customers who book appointments are priority to have their vehicles serviced. We take pride in our service departments commitment to thorough inspections and quality work, and sometimes both of those take some time. Our team worked as quickly and as diligently as they could to try meet your expectations. We apologize your vehicle was not diagnosed and repaired as quickly as you wanted.

name: Chris Haury
text: Professional, as expected from Porsche. Even though they were backed up and hampered by an employee out sick and weren't able to provide the loaner vehicle requested, they honored my appointment and provided an excellent door to door shuttle service that was really efficient and quick. When they phoned to tell me my service was complete, the driver was already 10 min from my house. The service on my vehicle was excellent as expected, and the Porsche tech sent a video going over my vehicle and the work done. Very happy.

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see you received exceptional care from our team.

name: matthewsleila
text: I have had issues with my Macan, too many in my opinion,  however this team of mechanics and the service team are the reason why I stick with it and remain patient and positive. They truly care and always have done their very best to ensure,  although there have been issues, that they provide the best service possible and always go out of their way to please the customer. Amazing team, technical knowledge and certainly understand and practice high quality customer service. Shout out to Jacob,  Randy and Chris. I appreciate you guys.

resp.text: Thank you Leila, the guys will continue to strive to provide the service that you appreciate and deserve.

name: Bill Brown
text: Great experience for a long time coming first buyer. Total professionalism from all Century employees. No pressure and all were extremely helpful in explaining the new world of Porsche, to include those not directly involved in the sale.  Highly recommend Century and the Porsche Brand.

resp.text: Welcome to the Porsche family and Porsche of Huntsville, a Century Automotive dealership. Congratulations on your purchase and thanks again for your business.

name: raymond fernandez
text:
About over a year or so ago Porshe of Huntsville did inspection service on my Cayenne without informing me of the cost. When I called this out to the service manager he said he would make it right and explained the dealership would provide the next service at no cost to me. He said he would document it in their computer records. I counted on that all this time, so when my vehicle was brought in for service I fully expected them to honor that promise. We'll there service manager said they could not find any record. Please note that I confirmed this way back with the previous service manager that it was noted on their record.
I am completely dissatisfied with the lack of commitment to what was promised by the dealership.
I therefore  refused any additional service and just agreed to pay for an oil change (which costs $430), The car was kept for 4 hours.
I will never buy a Porshe again.

resp.text: We wanted to follow up and and thank you for speaking to our service manager Shannon about your experience and hope the resolution  you came to together was satisfactory.

name: Dave Vaupel
text: I flew to Huntsville from Jacksonville to buy a Cayenne e-hybrid and drive it back home. From my pickup from the airport to drive-off it was a great experience.  Bradley D. and Jon C. Took great care of me. I will definitely be talking to them when it’s time for the 2 seater. Thank you Porsche of Huntsville!

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see your trip was well worth it and that you love your new Cayenne!

name: Ronnie Honbuckle
text:
Exceptional Service staff from the service managers desk, shop mechanics, parts department, shuttle service personnel, the folks who cleaned and washed my Porsche and bookkeeping departments. Thanks for the courteous, timely and a job well done. Cheers
R. Hornbuckle 4/16/'21

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see you received exceptional care from our team.

name: Mike Kurbanick
text: What a great experience!  Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable.  Our car was exactly what we were told it would be and then some.

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us and flying up to Huntsville. I hope you had a safe and enjoyable drive back to Florida.

name: Todd Lackey
text: Century and the team at century Porsche are always top notch. Above and beyond the call of duty is always my experience. Jacob and Chris make it easy. A+ service. Good job!

resp.text: Thank you Todd

name: Kelley Snook
text: Exceeded expectations. I purchased my car sight unseen and had it shipped to Michigan. Bradley walked me through the entire process including what to expect and timing of each step. He is a knowledgeable professional that I would make an effort to work with again—even though there are three Porsche dealerships within 25 miles of me. Everything was exactly as he said it would be and he continues to be a willing resource for me after the purchase. Outstanding communication. Thank you!

resp.text:
Kelley, Thank you for the kind review. Purchasing a vehicle sight unseen from several states away can be a difficult. We try very hard to represent our vehicles to long distance customers as if they were looking at them person, yours was easy. Thank you for your business and entrusting us with your purchase.

Drive safely.

Porsche of Huntsville

name: Ken Boustani
text: As always,great service.My Porsche is ready now.

resp.text: Thank you for your five star rating! We appreciate your business!

name: Len Nelson
text: Per usual, Century Porsche and my mechanic  Graham Boccino are the best. Top shelf service for your Porsche at reasonable rates. He installed the PSE exhaust on my Carrera S and it sounds incredible.

name: Justin Manzanares
text: Ray Diaz is the best. Kept me informed the whole way through the build.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and your continued business. You spec'd out a beautiful Spyder, enjoy it!

name: Roy Duvall

resp.text: Roy, thanks for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Joseph Owens
text: The service department is absolutely amazing. I have never experienced the level of care and detail that they provide..  Randy and Jacob are the nicest and most professional people I have dealt with.  I cannot say enough good things about them.  I will let them service my cayman every time i need something done.  By the way having the videos sent to me while it was being serviced was amazing.  Thank you very much for your help..

text: We traveled from Florida to pick up our 2018 Porsche Cayenne sight unseen and was exactly as Bradley told us. Great working with Bradley. Would not hesitate purchasing again from this dealer.

text: I highly recommend the service department at Porsche of Huntsville. Randy Carter and Jacob Holt consistently provide a great experience and high quality. The service work is always done correctly and the pricing has been very competitive to the market. This dealership is a valuable asset for the local community!

name: Felecia Hives
text: Tried to charge up my car, only for their vehicles

name: Minibike King
text: Love this place but I always leave without a car. Maybe after my next stimulus check fingers crossed.

name: Jacqueline Wade
text: I have used this dealership’s service department twice. Not only are the service folks knowledgeable and seem trusting, I’m so happy that each  and every person are very professional with a commitment to customer service. Quite a class act.  Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you Jacqueline for the kind words. Porsche of Huntsville strives for this kind of service and relationships with all of our customers.

name: Becky Cobb
text:
I live halfway between Huntsville and Memphis. I took my car to Memphis for its annual service a year ago. My check engine light had popped up several times before I took it.   I was told there was nothing they could do for my car’s issue unless my check engine light was “on”.  The issue persisted and became worse.  I decided to try Huntsville to see if they could help.  To my surprise, your dealership exceeded my expectations!  I was provided with a loaner car and constant updates.  Your service manager, Randy Carter, was amazing. After my disappointing experience in Memphis, Randy and Chris Pope will be my “go to guys” for as long as I drive my Cayenne.  This car was our first Porsche purchase and being cared for the way I was in Huntsville, it will not be my last.
Thank you for everything you did. I am a satisfied customer and will continue to use  you for my future purchases.
Sincerely, Becky Cobb, Iuka Ms,

name: Charles Phillips
text: I had a major service performed on my Panamera this week.  Jacob and Randy provided excellent service. From the time I dropped the car off to getting the loaner car to pick up.   Everything went smoothly. Communication was very good.  Definitely recommend this service team.

name: J Williams
text:
I’m am glad others have had a good experience with this dealer. We have not. We found the car we wanted here in Huntsville while shopping from out of state. Initially the process was smooth, easy, friendly...until the salesman, Bradley, sold the car out from under us. This was after several attempts to call, email, and yet for 24 hrs no word back, nothing. Only to receive a call hours after all the attempts to reach...to say the car was sold. Having dealt with other dealers and more specifically, Porsche dealers...the lack of communication and poor salesmanship was absolutely horrible.

I know, in our case, we can shop at other dealers...I can only hope they treat their customers better than they did us.

resp.text:
J Williams,
I am sorry that you had a bad experience. Feel free to call me if you would like to discuss.
Jon Cunha, Sales Manager

name: Anonymous
text: Guys do not ever use the tire department here! We have nothing but issues. We shouldn’t have ever went back. But we tried it again. They have broke lug nuts that we ended up having to replace.  Then today, they broke the valve steam inside of the tire. My husband as a mechanic but we take it to them because we have the life time rotation and balance. He said never in his 15 years has he ever broke a valve steam while rotating and balancing a tire. The employee there then tried to tell my husband he was going to have to go get a new one. I mean have some accountability. It’s not like we are asking a lot. Just do the job properly. Are these employees properly trained??

name: Raymond Theriault (Raym)
text: Fast, friendly service with a great price  :)

name: Gheymarne
text: Quick and eASY in and out oil change. They were finished in no time at all. I often go through auto when I am pushed for time makes checking out easier and much much quicker. Staff is experienced and friendly.

name: Jay Austell
text: Fast quality service.

name: Gage Ricketts
text: 6 hours to put 2 tires on my car I could’ve done it faster with a crow bar. Watched my car sit on the lift in the bay for over a hour untouched! Like what are y’all even doing playing with each other?

name: Greg1971 s
text: Ordered my tires thru Walmart store, when the tires arrived they gave me a courtesy call, after waiting 2 hour's with no cars or trucks in the shop bays, got the tires and went to Goodyear in Hazel Green, within 30 minutes Goodyear had me back on the road. Great job Walmart!!!

text: Prices were good and done sooner than promised!

text: The good: tires were put on correctly and tires were received in a day. The bad: was told one price over the phone when order was placed and was told a different price after tires were put on my truck. They also could not find my keys for approximately 15 minutes.

name: Dennis Faas
text: Very knowledgable, friendly and helpful staff. If a mistake happens, they take care of you.
