text: They said it was going to be two hours to change my oil, but were able to get it done in 45 min.I would like to see more of a selection in the toy section

name: Marty Couey
text: Good tires, good price.  No tire shop is fast but this Walmart seems to have more staff and is quicker than others I've used.

name: Darren Byers
text: Slow,slow,slow,so so so freaking slow. Not worth it. Will by my tires from Sam's from now on. Even when it makes it on the rack in the building it takes another hour and a half. Good God what are they doing?

name: blueEyedBritt Kristen (BlueYedBrittie)
text: Got my oil changed here they done wonderful thanks guys

name: Keith Bowersox
text: 3 oil changes and no problems. $19.88 for oil & filter,  they can do it.

name: Brian Pierce
text:
David is one great guy !!
Stayed late to help a delivery driver of mine out in a bind !!!
Ty sir!!

name: Linda Hames
text: I would have given them at 5 but had some pretty out-of-sorts staff there so I didn't get everything done that I wanted to didn't find everything I wanted to I guess I'll try again

name: Tucker Campbell
text: Fast and great people

name: J C
text: A broad range of auto services but they are slow.

name: Ernie D
text: Need more help

name: Marc Glass
text: I felt my beard growing as I waited for them to install my new tires. Then, turns out they were unable to, and then put my old ones back on. This process took 3 hours. I'm not coming back.

name: Thomas Clark
text: Prompt and speedy service.

name: Patricia Miller
text: I like  Walmart close to home , got what you need most of the time

name: Barbara Peeler
text: Don't have enough different services for auto's

name: Sgt Balint
text: Ask for mike.b hazel green

name: Gary Cheek
text: Good service

name: Hamid Baraty
text: Not enough employees

name: Belinda Perry
text: Waited for two hours to have a battery put in my car.

name: Jimbo Beck
text: Top of the line service

name: Amber Episcopo
text: The staff there is very friendly. There is a nice waiting room and children's play area. They had the best prices around. I highly recommend them.

name: Dexter Willis
text: Great prices on tires. They did a great job on my truck. But they are no longer in business.

name: Angie Mccullough
text: They have great customer service and the best prices on tires.

name: Danny Duke
text: I recently purchased several trailer tires from Patriot Auto & Tire.  Their pricing is competitive and their service was prompt and friendly.  I will be going back for an oil change and other services.

name: John Tipler
text: Fast oil change. In and out.

name: Lynn Dobbins
text: I purchased 4 new tires in March 2020. After driving my car for 2 days the tires were riding really bad. I checked my tire pressure and 4 tires were set at different numbers. After I got out to look at the tires I noticed something wasn't right. I called Corporate and they assured me that they will do whatever necessary to make it right. When it was time to take my car back to be fixed they were shut down due to Covid. I still haven't been able to take my car because they're still closed. A total waste of my time & money. I will never do business with them again.

name: Kari Jandran
text: We were camping in Gadsden and got a nail in one of our truck tires. We arrived at 7:45 AM, with nobody in line ahead of us. It took them an hour and 15 minutes just to do a tire repair. The gentleman who checked us out told me that they "probably shouldn't have assigned us the slowest guy here to do your repair". It's 9:03 and we are finally pulling out of the driveway. They were nice but it's crazy that a 15 minute job took this long.

name: daniel barnett
text: Took two hours to get a new valve stem and the next morning the tire was flat. Guess they just slapped a new one in and never checked for leaks. Generally a leaking valve stem at the rim gets cleaned up at a quality tire shop

name: justin nichols jr.
text: Worst service I’ve ever experienced. Don’t waste your money here. 3 hrs to change 1 tire. No one stayed working in the bay. Literally saw the guy working on it walk to talk to people and grab a snacks several times..

name: Andrew Feltman
text: Speedy service more like slow as molasses we needed one tire patched up and it took about an hour and 30 minutes

name: Sydney Tinney
text: I will be sure to NEVER buy my tires here again. I will be finding somewhere else that carries my size. It is insane that I have had to purchase 6 tires here since March 2018 all at full price because they claim the tires are bald and the $10 road hazard won't cover. How can tires bought in March be bald in September when there has been NO long distance driving?!? And HOW was my flat tire inflated when it wouldn't hold air and was sitting on the rim when I arrived with it in the back of my car?! I couldn't even get the gentleman who claimed my tires were bald to even speak to me face to face or tell me what he did to my tire!!! Incredibly unprofessional! Incredibly rude! Then charge me $10 for road hazard I didn't want it on the tire I had to pay full price for anyways!? Worse experience at a Wal-Mart EVER.

name: Todd Wilkinson
text: This past weekend I ordered online ( $50.00 savings off the in store price) a set of tires and had the auto center install them on my wifes Envoy at the Wal-Mart of Gadsden. I was greeted quickly by the service writter. I was told up front that the wait time was several hours. Told again by the service manager, told about the road hazard, lifetime rotate and balance, new valve stems, tire disposal fees, I was told to bring the truck back in 50 miles to recheck the lugnut torque, etc. They covered all the bases. I was called at home to verify "blackwall out, right?" This is good service in my opinion, and best of all--the wife is happy with her new tires and I'm happy if she's happy. Keep up the good work you guys!

name: Lacey Harris
text: Sat in line for over 35 minutes while the slowest woman alive took her sweet time getting to the 3 people in line to get oil changes. That is completely unacceptable. I normally use the Attalla Walmart Auto Center, but I decided to attempt this one today because I was closer. Never again. I am usually in and out of the Attalla one in less than an hour and I have never sat in line for more than 5 minutes. Y'all need to step up your game.

name: Chasity Self
text: Did well

name: Lindsey Nibblett
text: They broke the censor on my tire and tried to blame it on the people that worked on it before them. Which i cpuld understamd id it wasnt a 2016 modle!! Horrible experience.

name: Laura Phillips
text: The tires didn't last 3 months. They sold me 4 faulty tires. I will never go there again

name: Patti Baez
text: Went for an oil and tire change. They were out of my tires, was just as expensive of an oil change as anywhere else in town, and took 2hrs.... Not worth it in any way

name: Shania Shelby
text: Didn’t take a super long time. Was in and out in about 3 hours. Made the experience really fun and inclusive. Approved me for the wrong car but I love the car any ways and they have a beautiful selection of cars to choose from. Simply a decent car buying experience from a lovely team

resp.text: Thank you for your five-star review, Shania. Our team at Jim Burke Hyundai always strives for the highest standards. We are delighted we made your experience a positive one. Until next time, take care.

name: Stephanie Sloan
text: I assume everything was done correctly, oil change and tire rotation. I arrived at 3:06 for my 3:00 appointment. ( I did say I would be there by 3:15 when I scheduled). It was 5:04 when I left. That was a long time to service my vehicle, especially when having an appointment.

name: Jack Norris
text:
This was honestly the best experience I have had with a dealership.
First, like most dealerships you get a warm greeting and all the pleasantries of being a potential buyer. This is where my experience usually changes. Usually after the salesperson talks to me, and I tell them my wants then start the negotiations it all changes. This did not happen at all. The sales people Adrienne and Chris were friendly and helpful. They seemed to genuinely care. The financial personal Timberley was very warm and tried to relate to my country roots. There was another lady there that helped me and got the car I wanted and worked out the financial part. I unfortunately forgot her name. She was awesome as well and got me exactly what I wanted!

Thank you all and please keep up the great work!

name: Erica Bass
text: Wonderful love the sale man. He was very helpful. Nathan Merchant a around applause to you, And thank you for help my family in these difficult times.

name: Chandra Sekar
text: Do not recommend this place. The wait time is much longer than what was communicated initially and there isn't a proper documentation of the services performed. I  was charged for a tire rotation and this wasn't check marked on the completed services sheet. The response from the service staff was "the technician has done it but doesn't know why it's not check marked as completed". Doesn't provide me confidence to believe if any of the other services was even done.

resp.text: Hi Chandra, Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns. Please reach out to us at (205) 324-3371 to further discuss your concerns. Thank you and we hope to hear from you promptly.

name: carole strong
text: Typically I get good service from Jim Burke but not this time. They made promises they didn’t keep and the service took much longer than they initially told me. Was without a car for two days. Said they would have the part overnighted however it didn’t show up until the second day.

name: Micah Shields
text: Great service! Brian was helpful with getting my car’s routine maintenance back on track and making sure that everything in my car was functioning properly.

name: Gary Schneider
text:
Wonderful personalized service received on Saturday, May 29th.
Broke down on highway on Friday night. Spoke with A J Allen in the service department and was told if I got the car there early on Saturday they would do everything possible to get me back on the road to Texas. A J was there on Saturday morning and was able to diagnose and fix the issue. He kept me updated throughout the morning and had me back up and running by 11:00.

name: Christelle Williams
text: Thanks to the People At Jimburke and Most definitely a HUGE THANKS TO The Hyundai Manager and Team For helping me Get in my First car ❤️ You should definitely stop here before losing hope, They help any situation.

resp.text: Hi Christelle, Thanks so much for taking the time to share your feedback! We're happy to hear that you had a great experience with us at Jim Burke Hyundai and hope to see you again take care!

name: Renee Page-Nash
text:
The service staff are excellent.  I am disappointed with the suggested maintenance packages which are exorbitant.  They should just stick with the  owners manual maintenance schedule.

6/22 No one can tell me why my car is burning oil or why the oil light didn't come on when the oil was low.  This is concerning.

resp.text:
Renee,
Thank you so much for your review of Jim Burke Hyundai! We truly appreciate the feedback and hope to hear from you again.

name: Carey Culpepper
text: Very couteous and were willing to haggle.The new car clean-up dept needs a higher standard.

resp.text: Hi Carey, Thanks for sharing your experience. We hope you stop by and see us again soon.

name: Handsome K
text: It's located at the center of Birmingham city, where easy to access. They understand what the problem of your car and what to do to improve the condition regular basis. Their service reservation website is convenient keeping record.

resp.text: Hey there, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Michelle Patterson
text: They listen and I just love their service

name: Sharon Burtnett
text:
My Husband and I bought our first Hyundai (Sonata) at Jim Burke in 2010. We are still enjoying this car and the sales experience was GREAT and we recommended them to friends and family.

In 2017 we bought a new Accent. Again everything was Great and we shared this experience as well.We returned  in 2018 ams bought an Elantra. The Elantra recently broke
down.  Out of warranty of course. We had it towed to Jim Burke  and we received a call that my car needed  an engine. The cost of $7500.00.I thought since we bought 3 new cars that maybe we could get a deal on this service.INSTEAD we were told there was a $150.00 for checking the car out. This was not diacussed when we called and dropped the car off. Nothing like being kicked while you are down. I did some research and found there have been problems with the Engines in the ElantrI am verys sossapointes with the company I thought was so HRgreat and can no longer recxpmend the company and I will also tell anyone that will losten about thisbjorrivlw expeI qill tell anyone who qill liisten about this horrible experience!

My typing is not so grear because of broken hand and arm.

resp.text: While we are thankful for your feedback, we would like to learn more about why your experience was not an exceptional one. Reach out to us at (205) 324-3371 to let us know how we can improve for your next visit.

name: Tre Zimmerman
text: Go see Brandon Montgomery! He will get you right with what you need! Thank you sir!

resp.text: Hey there, Tre, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Jasmine Densmore
text: I recently had to replace my windshield and I am so please with the service at Jim Burke. The technician did excellent work and also changed my oil without me even asking. The service at this location is always great and I'll remain a loyal customer.

resp.text: Hello Jasmine and thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback! We are thrilled to hear that you have nothing but amazing things to say about our team at Jim Burke Hyundai and what we offer.

name: Robert Cato
text: great friendly service!! Jordan smith and Toni vines both worked with me through 3 visits. They both took time and patience working with me and getting me the best deal for what I had to offer.. I highly recommend both of these salesmen if you go to Jim Burke used car lot in north Birmingham. I was also checked up on and greeted by several other employees through out the visits. Overall great experience!!

name: Mary Ricks
text: Erica Holmes and Tanya Shelby made my experience at Jim Burke Hyundai best ever in my life. This was my first new car and my experience was overwhelme by the love and kindness and hard work that Shelby and Holmes put in to make it happen.

resp.text: Mary, Thank you so much for your review of Jim Burke Hyundai! We truly appreciate the feedback and hope to hear from you again.

name: Kleindienst Adams
text: Erica Holmes and the entire Jim Burke car purchasing experience was outstanding.  I will definitely be back

resp.text: Hey Kleindienst, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Janita Armstrong
text: Always get things in writing with Jim Burke..turnover rate is ridiculous. You never know who you are speaking with. Sales person and manager who made "Promises of detailing my vehicle when purchased and reimbursement to the hyundai customer who recommended me, were all lies..when I called to follow up there were no longer there. The new manager had no clue and lied to me as well. I called to follow up..he was no longer there. Poor service, inaccurate quotes, and nothing but lip service given (telling me what they thought I needed to hear).

resp.text: Thank you, Janita, for taking the time to voice your concerns. Please reach out to us at (877) 796-4559 to further discuss your concerns. Thank you and we hope to hear from you promptly.

name: Hilda Henderson
text: Our experience with Jim Burke Hyundai was a very positive and pleasant one. Our sales representative, Larry Greenhill, went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied with our purchase. His efforts were not in vain. I am very pleased with my 2020 Tucson Sport.

name: Frankie Washington
text: The whole team was wonderful but special mention for my salesman Antonio Gillespie and the Finance manager Melvin. Speedy and professional service with a smile and no games. Everyone was so friendly!! Got a wonderful deal and reasonable monthly payments!!! I recommend them highly!!!

name: Sandy Stern
text: Time expected to be finished was what they told me. Unfortunately,they could not complete all the repairs today. I really think that they needed to wait until they could repair all things at the same time.

name: PATRICK HASSELL
text: Good people GREAT product!

resp.text:
Patrick,
Thank you for reviewing your service experience! We aim to provide time-efficient and exceptional service for our guests, and we are proud that this was received during your time spent with us.

name: Essie Johnson
text: I can honestly say my experience was great! My salesman, Dennis Johnson was absolutely AMAZING! He is very knowledgeable, courteous,  attentive, patient, honest. If you are looking for a car without all the hassle, Jim Burke Hyundai is where you want go. The staff is great.  Great deals, great cars, great people!  They really care!  I am a customer for life!

name: Alexus Carter
text: I had a great experience at this dealership, everyone was really friendly and willing to help. The best thing was I drove away in a new car! Big thanks to everyone who helped! I definitely recommend!

name: Paul Berman
text: Jordan Cook continuously goes out of his way to ensure that my service visits are done quickly, in the most cost efficient manner.   Servicing my car can be a challenge as I am currently traveling outside of AL weeks at a time.  Whenever its time for the vehicle's next servicing, help is only a p[hone call away.  Jordan demonstrates unwavering attention to details and customer service, which is why I bring my 2016 Hyundai Sonata Sport to Jordan in Birmingham versus having it serviced in Atlanta or other possible locations.  Why?  Because in my opinion, he cares about his customers and their satisfaction with Jim Burke's service and his own professional service as well.  Thank you Jordan for all you do!

name: Angela Brown
text: I purchased a new Sonata and everyone at Jim Burke was so helpful & nice. My salesperson Alexis was so knowledgeably and was not pushy at all. The General Manager Tanya worked really hard on getting me approved for the vehicle and was very detailed and explained everything to me and kept me informed through the whole process

name: josette rice
text: Always outstanding service!  Jordan and everyone on the service  team is always very helpful and believe in making sure you're a satisfied customer!

resp.text: Thank you, Josette for this wonderful review of Jim Burke Hyundai. Jordan and the rest of our fantastic team here pride themselves on making every visit with an exceptional one. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Have a nice day!

name: Melissa Mynatt
text: The service center was excellent. From the time i got there until I had left the customer service was one of the best i had visited to date.  The only complaint i had was grease was left on my driver seat and on the driver door liner.  I wished the mechanic had paid as much attention as the service center or possibly protected the seat.

name: Bryanna McClain
text: The associates at Jim Burke Hyundai all were welcoming and kind. In particular I would like to acknowledge my dealer Andrew Briggins who made sure I was comfortable and that I got what I wanted. He was very thorough and very knowledgeable about the inventory at hand and unknowingly persuasive when introducing me to the 2020 Hyundai Sonata SEL. I absolutely love my car and I am proud of my choice. Thank you Andrew and Jim Burke Hyundai for my sweet sweet ride!

name: Susan Crow
text: I have had a great experience with Eddie Hicks as my service advisor.  I always feel like I am being dealt with honestly.

resp.text: Susan, we are glad to hear you had a positive experience working with Eddie.  Our team prides themself on providing an honest and easy approach to helping our customers with all of their automotive needs.

name: Bama Born & Bred
text: I went to Jim Burke Hyundai recently and received excellent service. The service technician was very nice and polite. He advised me of a recall that was on my car and explained what it was for and how they would fix it.  I got three services for my car(which included the recall) and was out in 1 hour. I didn’t even have an appointment!!! The customer waiting area was comfortable and check out was easy and quick.  I would highly recommend the service department to anyone needing great work on their automobile and good customer service.

name: Jon Tanja
text: I was satisfied

name: Ayesha Aj
text: Jessie was the best car salesman I have ever encountered. Adrienne was not my salesperson but she was very hospitable, friendly and thorough! I would definitely recommend either of them to anyone needing a vehicle !!

name: Tae Alexander
text: Purchased a 2020 Hyundai Santa Fe’ through Brandon Blagg. He was excellent from the beginning to the end. He made the process easy. He explained and demonstrated things to us in a way that most others might have not. Although the sale was important, to him he showed just as much concern about driving away in something that we wouldn’t regret. The atmosphere was nice and welcoming. Not boring at all. The staff was friendly too.  In the end Brandon wouldn’t stop until the last tire received its shine. Thanks a bunch!

name: Monica Leach
text: I am enjoying my little gas saver.

resp.text: Monica, we hope we can turn these 3 stars into 5. We want to hear from you—please give us a call when you can at (877) 796-4559. Thanks!

name: Brittany Card
text: Took my car in for a check engine light that was on for a month. The light was off by the time I took it in of course but Jim Burke found the problem and fixed it. Location is so close and convenient to my job so made it easy to drop off and pick up. Will definitely be going to them again for any service for my car! They were fantastic!

name: Dayatra Laster
text: Service writer recommended I get a transmission flush on 2/17/20. I had a transmission flush done on 1/27/20. Same auto shop same service writer.

name: Jillian Carter
text: I had a really awesome experience at Jim Burke Hyundai. I was referred by a close friend of the family to go in visit Alexis and Tanya. These ladies lets my family and I  know that they had our best interest at heart.The service was quick and smooth. I truly thank Jim Burke and staff for our 2019 Elantra Value.

name: Alexis Morton
text:
I had a very wonderful experience at the  Hyundai service department.  Eddie Hicks, the service representative was very knowledgeable and helpful during my visit. Questions were answered without hesitation and he didn’t try to rush me off. Eddie was also helpful getting me an Uber to my friends house . After getting to my friends house and getting a bite to eat my car was ready to be picked up. Fast service. Thanks again for taking care of my car. I will be back for an oil change in a few months.
Alexis Morton

name: Beth Cooper
text: The staff were wonderful and extremely professional.  They updated me when needed, took time to explain the automotive issue and the repair used to update the vehicle. Another impressive detail I noted was the multiple transporters who checked to see if the customers had a need for transportation.  I’ve been highly impressed by the service provided and I will definitely return .

name: LUIS FELIPE ORTIZ ALMODOVAR
text: My experience from the start was very respectful treatment from all the team at Jim Burke specially from Clearance thanks to all you guys and for the cups of coffee during the deal thanks to be so kind with me even when my English it was not perfect you deal with and gave me a good attention to all my request God Bless You All Guys and thank you Kendra for your help and beautiful Smile all the time

name: Andrew Gordineer
text: Even though I didn't get my car there, they were very accommodating.

resp.text: Andrew, We're grateful to know that your experience with us was an amazing one! We look forward to seeing you again soon at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Holly Davis
text: Completely satisfied!  I would 100% buy another car from Jim Burke.  Their selection is great and the Sales and Finance teams were excellent to work with.  They were understanding and able to work with our situation and got us exactly what we wanted.

name: Berdell White
text: I was very pleased with the service that I received from everyone at Jim Burke's All my questions were answered promptly!  I'm enjoying my new 2020 Hyundai Palisade! I love it!

name: Peter Newman
text: Good workmanship but the place is rather crowded and hectic.  They need more space and the ability to put fine touches like cleaning to a job after completion considering the quotes are a bit pricey.

name: Sandra D Kindell
text:
The service associates are always professional and courteous.  They advise on service needed to your car, giving details of the service and the expected cost. The cost factor is important, because  quite frankly, money doesn't grow on trees.  They  also give you an estimation on the length of time involved in completing the setvice.  Most of them remember you if you have had repeat business with Jim Burke.

The cashier at the Hyundai service area is always very friendly and helpful.  She is an asset to the department.

name: mycal garrett
text: I just purchased a car from Hyundai and i had the best experience I've had in a long time. My sales rep was Ashley and she is a very polite and respectful salesman. She helped me with everything that i needed and then some. Very knowledgeable about the product and very informative as well. Probably one of the best sales reps I've had the pleasure of dealing with. If you are interested in buying a Hyundai from Jim Burke. Ask for Ashley she wont disappoint.

name: Sherry Lacey
text: Chris Thomas and the finance manager were great! I know God sent them to me. They are the best! Thank you!

name: Steven Gross
text: My experience with Jim Burke Body Shop was a pleasant one - from the initial phone call, through the claim/repair process, and finally to pick-up. At the front desk, Ashley handled my reception with the utmost courtesy and customer service. Josh, the assistant manager was equally professional and the one who handled my claim and kept me up to date on the status and dealt with the insurance company on my behalf. Finally, on pick-up, I found my car waiting for me, freshly cleaned - inside and out. The body shop is a Hyundai preferred repair center and I would recommend them to my fellow Hyundai drivers.

name: Myra Reed
text: I was thrilled with the short wait time. I always ask for Eddie and once again he provided superior customer service. As an example, it was raining and he pulled my car inside so I wouldn’t get wet when leaving. Super great guy!!

name: Bobbie Cagle
text: Always quick and on time.  Always friendly and helpful!

name: dorothy thomas
text: Jim Burke Hyundai is a great place to get a car Tony take his n da rest of the team to I love I would have them ten stars

name: JOEL BUCKLEY
text: Very courteous service writers. Quick turn around on repairs. Mechanics are great! Wouldn’t take my Hyundai anywhere else!

name: sandra richard
text:
Eddie Hicks is very nice and very up to date on the details of our Hyundai. Has been very helpful during recalls.
Also pleasant and friendly when car needs serviced.

name: S G
text: Great customer service. Excellent and fast service. Would recommend to everyone. They made us feel extremely confortable. The waiting room and restrooms were in excellent condition. Awesome awesome awesome job guys.

name: luvsnow83
text: I had an awesome experience and appreciate the whole team! Thanks a lot everyone ❤️

name: Vicki Colburn
text: Me and my husband purchased a 2019 Hyundai Kona a few weeks ago and we are very pleased with the help of our salesman Dennis Johnson, and all the staff they really went above and beyond just a salesperson.. we won’t go anywhere else when we get ready to buy again we will definitely be back

name: Charles Chancellor
text: I have been doing business with this dealership for over twenty five years. The Hyundai dealership at Jim Burke is the best when it comes to respect, courtesy  and understanding the customers need and successfully meeting them. Great people and great to do business with.

name: BLAMS 4Life
text: A professional and thorough experience.   They worked wonderfully with my insurance company and repaired my car back to like new status.  Great job

name: christopher kendrick
text: It’s was fast and easy and that’s not something I’m use to with car buying. The sales rep Kera took her time to make sure I was not just getting a car I liked but also a car i could truly afford. Jim Burke has earned me as a forever customer!

name: Bella Divine
text: I am always impressed with this dealership. The quality of service is unmatched by other shops or dealers. They are always friendly, professional and they value my time. I would happily recommend them to anyone.

name: Ally Trigg
text: Love their innovative interface with texting and choosing what is and is not done as well as status of your vehicle. Amazing communication.

name: Miranda Cantlow
text: I like to say that everyone at Jim Burke Hyundai was so caring and helpful I would recommend friends and family to come and purchased a car. And my sales person Brandon Blagg was so helpful to me and explained all the details. Everyone was so nice. Thanks so much. Mrs. Miranda Cantlow

name: Patricia Carden
text: Eddie was very helpful. Explained all work that was done and work that needs to be done.  He was friendly and courteous. Will definitely recommend him and Jim Burke.

name: Andrea Thames
text: The service guys are always to attentive and personable!  They are always so nice!!!

name: sylviash2
text: Jim Burke is by far the best Hyundai dealer in Birmingham  they found problems that the other dealers could not find. One thing I was a little disappointed in though was not detecting a massive hole in my air intake on the first visit, which seems like it should have been easily detected it was only discovered when I brought the car back the next day because it still wasn’t running right  but they went out of their way to helpful our service writer Eddie Hicks was a class act and seemed like he genuinely cared

name: Miranda Cantlow
text: I like to say that everyone at Jim Burke Hyundai was so caring and helpful I would recommend friends and family to come and purchased a car. And my sales person Brandon Blagg was so helpful to me and explained all the details. Everyone was so nice. Thanks so much. Mrs. Miranda Cantlow

name: Andrea Thames
text: The service guys are always to attentive and personable!  They are always so nice!!!

name: Karen Hanson
text: My service representative is very friendly and helpful. The work on my car was done quickly. They are good about getting me in and out in a timely manner. I wish the location was closer to me but I like this service department.

name: Connie McCreless
text: Had a really good experience.  My sales rep Brian Christopher was very helpful without being pushy.  He listened to what I wanted and did everything to make sure I was satisfied.  The entire experience was very pleasant.  After the sale was completed he sat in the car with me to go over everything and told me if I had any questions to give him a call and he would be more than happy to help.  By the time I left I thought of him as a friend and not just a sales rep.  I was very impressed with the lease experience.  Had never done this before but it was not at all scary or stressful.  I have always had a high opinion of the dealership and this has confirmed my opinion.  Love the car and expect to be doing business with this rep and dealership for a long time.

name: adam jaffe
text: Brian Christopher is absolutely fantastic to deal with.  His outstanding attitude and extensive knowledge of the vehicles makes every car buying experience a great one.  Brian goes above and beyond making every buyer feel comfortable and at ease with their purchase from Jim Burke.   Brian always returns calls in a prompt manner and no question is too small to answer.  Once again thank you Brian I love my purchases.

name: Paula Johnson
text: It's always a pleasure to go to Jim Burke service center. My advisor Jordon is like family. I know everyone there. We always enjoy seeing each other. I will continue to take my Hyundai to my favorite place!

name: mark Myszka
text: Jim Burke makes car buying easy. I told them which car I wanted. They showed me the options available and I made my choice. I wanted a red one they didn't have it in stock so they went and got it for me. Financing was a snap with their help. This was the second car I purchased at Jim Burke and next time I need a car I will go back.

name: Patricia Carden
text: Eddie was very helpful. Explained all work that was done and work that needs to be done.  He was friendly and courteous. Will definitely recommend him and Jim Burke.

name: Patricia Russo
text: We were on the way to Louisville, Ky. from New Orleans. We got off the interstate in Birmingham to fuel up.  By the way, we went 360 miles on one tank of gas in my Tucson. Anyway, riding around looking for a station, a huge piece of metal pierced my right rear tire. No way we could ride all the rest of the way on the spare. I knew I wanted a Hyundai dealer to replace the tire.We found a gas station, then found this dealer right around the corner! The service department was incredibly nice and squeezed us into their busy day.  We were back on the road in no time! Thankyou, Thankyou, Thankyou, Jim Burke Hyundai! I love my local Hyundai dealer (shout out to Hyundai of Metairie!) but this one is fabulous too!!!

name: Suzanne Helmick
text: Once again I am extremely pleased with the service provided by Jim Burke Hyundai.  The service rep, AJ, explains just exactly what they will say do.  Love having my Tucson serviced here.

name: Tebriel Alexander
text:
I went to test drive a Hyundai Santa Fe'  two days ago. This is not my first Hyundai since reinventing itself and blowing our minds. Needless to say I purchased what is now my 5th Hyundai.  However, i'm here to brag on the man who walked my husband and I through this entire process in this humid Alabama weather.  Initially, I came in to take advantage of the $50 GIFT CARD that Hyundai was offering for simply test driving its vehicles, but I also knew that I would potentially be driving off the lot with something new as well. Brandon Blagg was awesome from the gate. He stood and walked over to me, invited me to his desk, and inquired concerning my business. A few questions later, a copy of my license, and "BAM" we were test driving a base model Santa Fe.' One would think that this guy designed these vehicle with his level of knowledge concerning them. Recalling that I have own several vehicles in my lifetime, it is feasible to understand that we have dealt with our share of sales consultants. This is by far the first person who not only informed us of what we would potentially enjoy about the vehicle, but patiently explained in detail its benefits, and demonstrated  to us its functionality. He took a base model vehicle and literally painted a picture that lifted it beyond it's level. He hung out with us for over an hour doing comparisons and contrasts. He was honest concerning pro and cons, but never negative.. not one time. For him every vehicle had its benefits, and for every person there was vehicle that fit them. THIS IS WHAT HE DID! He didn't interfere with our choice, but he made sure that we would be satisfied once we left  the lot for good. In the end we ended up purchasing a Santa Fe' SEL 2.4 engine with both the Convenience and Premium Package. He didn't use a hustler tactic to cause us to go for a higher grade, it was simply his transparency and patience that ultimately led to our selection. Recalling that this was in 90 + degree weather, this man didn't stop until the tires shined.  He made me laugh, shared stories, explained who was whom of the CEO vs. COO, and also wasn't shy around me whatsoever. He even blew bubble gum bubbles for our delightful 6 year old who stood amazed at the excellence his gum blowing abilities. Brandon Blagg, job well done. You deserve all that's coming for your hard work and dedication to service. Aside from our direct experience with Brandon, everyone rocked. Their pleasantness was superb, two of the women conversed with me, they offered treats to my babies, and others smiled and waved. There wasn't a rude attitude in the building. The lobby and bathrooms are well designed and clean. As lengthly a process that car buying could be, they have enough going for themselves to make you relax and enjoy your time.

Thanks Again, Tae A.

name: Agee Richardson
text: I can't say enough about the awesome staff in the Jim Burke Hyundai Service Department. Rusty, the Hyundai Service Department manager, has been very attentive to my automotive needs. When there was a way to hold the manufacturer's accountable for repairs associated with their recall, this service manager had no problem going to bat for me. Although my first impression of this establishment was not a good one due to lack of communication, my final impression is the one that REALLY COUNTS! I feel so blessed that these were the guys: Rusty, Eddie and Justin that tended to my 2013 Hyundai Sonata and me when my car just STOPPED RUNNING on the interstate. It took about a month to get my car fixed right, but they have stuck it out. I am proud to say that my blue-silver streak and I are on the road again tearing up the highway!!! Adrienne Richardson from Birmingham is your #1 Fan!!!

name: Steve Ariens
text: Overall experience was good, we had hit something unseen on I-65 N and blew out a front passenger tire. My car has high performance tires and not common sizes and front and rear are different sizes,  The dealership was able to locate the appropriate sized tires.  When I returned to pick up the car I was surprised by being told that they had done a oil change on the car.. claimed it was due... I have used a specific full synthetic oil in this car since it has 1200 miles on it and now the bill from the dealership was not clear as to what oil is in the engine..  By factory requirements.. it had  abt 1800 more miles before it needed to be changed. IF they would have asked me - they had my cell phone - and they had the oil that I use.. I would have been glad to authorize the oil change.

name: Bernice Bunkley
text: I went in for a oil change . I have a 2016 a Hyundai genesis. We were told we could get free oil change,but because  I didn't want to get the 45000 mile service done I was told I will have to pay  for my oil change. I told the guy that I  have had my oil change for free without the service done before.  He said  than pull all the time I came in ,on the 24000 mile I didn't get service but free oil change. He said  I didn't  need service at that time. All I went to go to the waiting room. He stop me and told me I had to go to the other side that was for Hyundai customers.  The last time I was there I went to the side he said was for Subaru customers only. While  waiting in t by e waiting room for Hyundai customers and customer ask this lady what kind of car she has, she said a Subaru.  He ask me to give him a 5 rating.  No you get a 2 rating from me.

name: Jackson Pike
text: We traded in our vehicle about a week ago and purchased a certified Sonata. Not to say we were screwed over, but the entire experience felt shady. The salesman knew nothing about the car itself other than the price and the carfax. During the test drive we asked about features and got shrugs. This place also takes its sweet time to process a sale. We arrived at 10 that morning and didn't leave until nearly 5 in the afternoon. Expect a whole day ordeal. Also, make sure you know what your car is worth to the dime before attempting to trade. They will not give you anywhere near what your car is worth.

name: Debbie Brazeal
text: Always courteous and helpful. They did not find cause of car noise. Started making it again after I left. Will bring it back when noise starts back

I value honesty so I'm pleased with it being serviced by Mr. Hicks. I am not satisfied with the level of service on my last visit. I was promised free wiper blades for life with the purchase of my car. When I requested them I was told that they had been replaced 6,000 miles ago and that it "was not time for a new set", even though the blades were streaking. You may recall that it has been a rainy year. The service advisor said he would have the windshield cleaned which does not solve the problem and then, the cleaning was not done. Miles driven is not a reliable indicator of wiper wear.

Also, 2 1/2 hours for an oil change is excessive.

name: Keven Akings
text:
I've purchased several cars and this experience by far stands out as one of the worst.......from beginning to end. I test drove the vehicle on a Monday and pointed out a few cosmetic issues that I feel should have been addressed prior to placing the car up for sale (only a few hundred dollars to correct).  That combined with the manager coming outside to talk to me smoking a cigarette, should have clued me in to the professionalism and pride taken at the dealership.
I was asked that if the problems I pointed out were corrected,  would I purchase the car? I agreed.  The following day I recieved the bill of sale and I noticed that the price shown on the internet was not the price shown on the bill of sale. When I asked the manager, the explanation I recieved was that the car was headed to auction the day I saw it and the price on the internet was the auction price, not the sale price (what does that have to do with me? And the price I came intending to pay is the price that I saw advertised ).  I was then told that they would sell it to me at the internet price but I would have to pay for the repairs which would be $400+.  Since the price was still under book value,  I agreed.  I was then told that the car would be repaired, HAND WAXED and ready for me in a couple days.  I was informed Friday that the car was ready. I drove up Saturday only to find the car just as dirty as it was when I test drove it on Monday(they sprayed the dirt off but there was still hair and dirt on the inside of the car.... wheel wells were dirty, etc). Of all the cars I've bought,  no one has ever tried to delivered me a dirty car! I discussed this with the manager who appeared to care nothing about it.  I left with no intention of buying the car,  but the salesman,
Mr. Willie, called and said that he would take care of it...... he took it to a local shop and had it washed and vacuumed.  As a customer, when money is spent, whether it be $30 or $30,000, you want to feel good about spending it. That's not the feeling I left with.  In the end, I purchased what I feel is a great vehicle.   But the service is what will definitely keep me from being a repeat customer or recommending to anyone else.  Professionalism and putting the customer first is definitely lacking and needs a lot of improvement.

name: Jo Jones
text: I am completely dissatisfied with Jim Burke Suburu and will not ever bring my car there again, even if I have to drive outside Alabama. I took the car in for four recalls.  When I picked up the car the car three lights came on, the car wasn't running smoothly, and I called the technician. He said "nothing they did could have caused this."  Also he told me the diagnostic test -which I didn't want or ask for - indicated the car needed a timing belt,AC etc lot of work that's is needed at a 100,000 miles.  I told him this was already done.  I took my car to my usual mechanic who cleaned the throttle so that the new ECM would read it properly.  Your guys should have known this and should not have returned the car to me in the condition they did.  Also,the right passenger airbag light hasn't been reset.  It's still showing an error. I just hope they really replaced the defective airbag

name: denetria mcglown
text: I bought a 2012 Volkswagen Passat with 85,912 miles on it. This was the worst car buying experience ever. My original salesman was nice but knew nothing about a car at all. My battery had a dead cell when I first purchased it. I took it back for the battery to be replace and it took four hours to get a new battery. I asked them to take me to the service center to find out what was taking so long and the guy that work in the front said my battery has been there for two hours. And the guys that were supposed to be working were playing and joking around the next time I needed work done was three days later I noticed the bumper on the car was popped out of place, the 12 volt adapters didn't work, the service light had come on, the key tumbler was messed up in the ignition. I went to try and get that fixed and they told me it would be two days well I asked if they would give me a replacement car to get back and forth to work they told me no they don't do that. Ok so I paid for the work myself. A few days later I discovered my account was overdrawn 500 dollars and when I ask the finance manager why my account was charged and I paid 1000  in cash his response was well we wanted 1500 for the car and u couldn't do that. So they took it upon themselves to take the other 500 dollars. Now after they agreed to give my money back.  I waited a week and called and he said I could pick it up across the street so I went across the street from them and the guy over there didn't know what I was talking about so he called Cleveland Moore the guy I've been having problems with to asked him where I needed to go Cleveland didn't know that he was on speaker phone and said " she so damn stupid" he really called me stupid and then when I informed him he was on speaker phone he said so. Meaning he didn't care. So I feel disrespected and I was so upset I called a manager who said it will be handled and I will be waiting to find out the results of this because if they are not satisfactory I would like to speak with the owner myself. I can't believe people have to go through so much to get a car this is very terrible service and I want to know that my voice and opinion.

name: Anne Murray
text:
I was treated very politely, the salesman even picked me up at my home, because my car had caught on fire and I had nothing to drive.BUT the car I was supposed to look at was no longer available. They did not tell me it had sold when I called that same morning to verify my appt. & it's still on the internet as "Available" the following day. Further more 5 days later, it's still listed on the internet as available. So NOW I'm positive it's to lure customers in. If someone is awaiting approval for financing on this vehicle, the very least Jim Burke Hyundai should do is post a flag on the car saying; "Sold Pending Approval of Financing". In my opinion, that would be " Professional Business Protocol".

I'm of the opinion that they might possibly do this to get customers to come in when it looks like a certified car is lower priced then average.

I believe they tried to do a "bait & switch" maneuver on me by showing me a same priced vehicle that was the same color but a different make and model.

The sales mgr. also told me he would find me a Pre-certified car in the same price range that same day, however he never followed through or even had the professionalism to call me back one way or the other. I called him later that afternoon, I didn't want the other car I looked at, at another dealership to get sold, & asked if he could call me back by 6pm  to tell me if he had found another car so I could make a decision. He never called.

Bottom line... before you make the trip to see a specific car, make absolutely sure it's still for sale.

name: Traci Miller
text: DO NOT PURCHASE A USED CAR FROM THIS DEALERSHIP. And if you do, please, make sure you ask them to print and show you any TSB's (Technical Service Bulletin) on the vehicle you are considering. A TSB is not like a safety recall and therefore the dealership is not required to make the repair. Make them prove to you that they have repaired all of the items on each and every TSB. However, I can almost promise you that they will not make the repairs before selling you the vehicle. I purchased a used 2007 Hyundai Entourage van from Jim Burke Hyundai's used car dealership in March this year after having purchased a new Elantra from them last year. I did not make them show me the TSB's because I wasn't aware of them at the time. Unfortunately there are several of them on the van I purchased. One of them had to do with a part that causes called the "Junction Box Switch" or Instrument Panel Module that causes the battery to discharge. That means when you go out to your car it simply won't start!! I found the TSB on it and it says in large print that it was issued to all Hyundai General Managers and that the repair should be made before retail sale of the van. Many of us believe that purchasing a used car from what you think is a reputable dealership will protect you from these type issues. Well...this dealership is not reputable and should be put out of business. I have contacted them to give them a change to try and make this right to keep customers happy and try to get return business but they obviously are not intersted in this. I will be taking further action regarding this issue.

text: I would not recommend this location, no customer service or respect for customers time. They do not deserve any stars for today's actions. They seemed completely indifferent about not completing the job. I believe that these businesses do not consider the planning that takes place to coordinate vehicle maintenance. I understand things happen but 6 hours to complete an oil change seems reasonable. If there was going to be a problem with completing by 1300, they should have told me at 0700. I took my vehicle and got service completed at Goodyear.

text: I am completely disappointed with my experience here. I caught a piece of metal in my tire on my way to work so i had to leave work to get my tire replaced, $151 was paid for one tire 215 50R17. A few days later my Tire Pressure Sensor goes off and I add air and recalibrate my tires, just for it to go off again. I called them they told me “our calibration system is down and we did not reset your sensors” which seems like a minor fix of course, but it’s not. Now, if my tire pressure is low, I won’t have any idea because my sensor has not been reset and therefore it is not functioning properly. I now have to leave work, again, find another location and have them correct mistakes that were not disclosed at the time of my visit. Very disappointing. Let’s not halfass any other jobs, if you can not do it right in it’s entirety then you should not be doing it.

text: Quality of staff will blow your mind. I've been a few times ever since they quoted me 600 bucks under express oil change rate for a particular fix. This most recent time I was there for 3 hours-I like to pay attention to people as Psychology is my major. Every single person that came in(very busy day) treated the staff and other waiting customers like long time best friends. That, I believe starts with their first experience and how this particular store takes you in as family, wants the best for you, and the atmosphere is contagious. It takes a special kind of mechanic shop professional to turn EVERY stressed/worried car owner that steps foot in the door into thankful, optimistic family. To reassure the readers and hopefully future customers of firestone 280, I want y 'all to know I don't gain anything from this review, and honestly I don't know if it will even be on the website lol. Have a blessed day!

text: Agree with others who posted negative reviews; these people try to sell you services your car doesn't not need. I took it to get "looked" at for a wheel noise, and they didn't bother taking out on the road, just raised it up and visually looked at it. Go somewhere else and trust your own instinct.

text: Had a great experience getting a front end alignment. Very help staff who got the job done.

name: Ronni Lessa
text: My a/c stopped working in Mississippi, on my way back from New Orleans to NYC. I was staying over in Birmingham and went over to Firestone first thing in the morning. They were very kind and helpful. They drove me back to my hotel and picked me up, when my truck was finished (earlier than expected). The a/c is working beautifully. I would recommend this particular location of Firestone, to anyone and everyone.

name: Joshua Deason
text: The service here was outstanding! The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. I was informed of what services were recommended once my vehicle inspection was complete and was also informed of services that could be needed in the future but were not necessary for this visit. In addition to an inspection and oil change I also had 4 new tires put on my truck and had an alignment completed. A few other customers came in for oil changes only and were in and out in no time at all. I will definitely return with my vehicle for future services!

name: James B
text: Con Artists!  I normally avoid chain stores like Firestone because I know they try to scam people, but it was my last option to get my car examined.  I was helped by a woman I think was named Sabrina, and she fed me the biggest scam I've heard with my car, I don't think she realized I knew more about cars than she probably did.  She told me the tires were done and needed to be replaced NOW, the air filters needed replaced NOW, the battery was dead and needs replaced NOW, and the radiator needed to be flushed - and they'd conveniently do all of this for me at a hefty premium.  I was silently laughing at myself because two of my tires had 20K miles left on them (yes the other two need replacing soon), my air filters were replaced 8 months ago, my battery was brand new (I took it to auto zone AND advanced auto parts and they showed me the readings and the charge was fantastic, they laughed at Firestone for trying to pull one over on me), my radiator was also flushed within the last year.  I finally called her out on the battery and she looked me right in the eye and had the immoral audacity to say the battery was still worthless.  These are common things places like Firestone try to trick people into having repaired, because most people don't have the knowledge to know any better.  It was funny because they didn't even identify the things that were wrong with my car that I knew about.  They checked off that both headlights were working great, even though I knew and verified that one of the front headlights was dead... did they really even look my car over or just pretend to then hand me an appraisal for all the "broken" items I needed to have them fix now?  If you do not know much about cars, do not trust Firestone, they will sense your naivete and pull a fast one on you.  Always get a second opinion from a more reputable garage shop (I prefer privately owned places that rely on their honesty for business).  This just reaffirms the longstanding distrust I've had for places like Firestone, avoid them if you care about your money and your vehicle's longevity.  This visit was a total scam and employees like the one I dealt with do not belong in a customer service position.

text: Service is always great!

name: vnehwal
text:
Appointment scheduling is a fake program. Don't rely on that scheduling service. I scheduled my appointment one day before for 11.30 next day, they told the the service will be done by 12.30. I said great and I will plan accordingly.
went there next day at 11.30, now they say they will try to do it by 12.45 and when i come back at 12.30 they even haven't started yet.  They waisted 2 hours of my time(including going there and back) and still I have to take my car back without service as they wanted more time. Problem is not that they took time, the problem is that how they communicated and mentioned the timelines and did not followed the timelines. What point of scheduling an appointment when it does not have any meaning and you still wait in the queue and on top of that you miss-communicate the customer about timings. Don't you think that they have plan accordingly what you communicate.

text: Two stars because they were nice.  They sell tires and are probably good at it, but saying they do much mechanical work is misleading. I took my truck there, based on a call where they said they could deal with my two issues.  After keeping the vehicle all day, they called to tell me they couldn't fix either issue.  I'm not talking rebuilding a motor.  We're talking a power window off the track and leaking hose. Tires, probably fine. Mechanical work, take vehicle to a mechanic.  I won't go back. As I said,  the staff was very nice, but no help on my issues.

text: Great service. I have gone several times for oil changes and tire replacement and they have had my vehicle ready promptly and their work has always been fantastic. My go to shop for routine car maintenance.

text:
This my "go-to" place for an oil change and tires. They have found other problems that could only be fixed by the dealership and let me know about them. They are always friendly and helpful. It is NOT a 10 minute oil change place though! I usually always bring a book to read, or work to do if I am stay and wait for the work to be completed.

I am adding an edit to the review. The previous review was in June 2017. When I took my van for an oil change today I asked for them to check the tire pressure.....they didn't. They also didn't reset my oil change alert on my dashboard. They went from 4 to 3 stars on my review.

name: Stephanie Repass
text: Made an appointment at 11:45 and got there at 11:35. They couldn’t find my appointment. Finally found it and I asked if it would be done within the hour since I was at lunch. He assured me it would. 35 mins later my car hasn’t moved. I go inside to ask what’s going on and the 2 guys at the counter say they’ll be with me in a minute. Meanwhile they’re just talking to each other while I wait for 3-4 mins. Finally I ask for my keys and the guy just hands me my keys and doesn’t say anything. I NEVER write reviews, and I will NEVER go to this location again.

name: Tim Fisher
text:
Changed my oil competently, but tried to upsell me on some other frivolous repairs that would have cost over $100.

How do I know they were frivolous? I had my car at its dealership just last week for a safety recall, and when they did a similar complementary check they found nothing of the sort wrong. Nearly every single number on Firestone's check-up sheet was low-balled by up to 20% from the dealership check-up, and there's no way I got that much wear and tear in a single week.

Bottom line: know what you want when you walk in, and don't let them sell you anything else. If you don't know cars well enough to know a con when you see one, take yours somewhere more honest.

name: Elizabeth Gilmore
text: Driving from South Carolina to Texas, my serpentine belt snapped. Sabrina and the mechanics at Firestone were incredible in explaining to me what happened, what was needed, and recommendations for down the road. I wasn't charged an arm and a leg or ripped off for my lack of knowledge. I'll continue using Firestone sue to this experience.

name: Erica Lattimore
text: Called about a quote on my brakes and tires, instead she was in a hurry to answer the question(s) and just threw a price out there. Ask can she put the make and model of my car in computer instead of just throwing me a quote. Came back a different quote then what she told me. Hire more patient people instead of the Impatient stupid woman that answered the phone.

name: Heart Sigh
text: They are friendly there but if you're in a hurry, don't go there. I went on my lunch break for an oil change. They said 30 minutes. An hour later they hadn't even started. They finally finished almost 2 hours later. Another person I was talking to there he came in before me and was still waiting for his oil change to be finished.

resp.text: Good afternoon. We are truly sorry to hear about the long wait you had when you took your vehicle in to have your oil changed. We know that your time is valuable and we'd like to help get your concerns escalated to our upper management team for further assistance. Please email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with your contact information, a link to this review, and any invoice numbers related to the oil change. We value your business with Firestone and we hope to hear back from you soon. ^Katrina

name: Reeves Burruss
text: Bought a "new to me" car, and same day took it to Firestone to get a new timing belt because they were the only people open on Sunday (my only off day). I paid 850$ and was assured that the car would be ready that afternoon. I called back later in the day and was told to show up around 4:30 (right before close) to pick up the vehicle. I arrived and was told that they wouldn't leave until it was finished. About 15 minutes later I was told the guy didn't know how to do the job. When I asked how it would be done I was told,"oh, he'll just have to figure it out." The clerk later came out and said it would be the next morning. After asking to leave early from work an hour away, I arrived to a car that made a loud racket from the engine. I was told to leave it there and let their "expert" mechanic look at it the next day. I was told the previous day that the expert mechanic was the one working on it in the first place. I asked to speak to the manager, Vince, who is scum of the earth. He told me he was tired of dealing with my problem and that if I drove it away he wouldn't be liable. Fair warning to anyone looking to have service done at Firestone.

name: Cody C
text: I had a flat tire on a Sunday, so everything else nearby was closed. We pulled up riding on a donut, and they were pretty busy. Since I had a dinner to attend, we couldn't afford to wait. However, the guy was extremely polite and offered to check the pressure in the spare for us. It was too low, so he filled it up for free.

name: Brad Yellock
text: I have used firestone for 16 years. They are just like any other business. Sometimes great, sometimes bad. The particular location on hwy has an associate named Sabrina that works the front. Whenever you see her turn around and leave. If you ask for an oil change and an alignment, you’ll get a tire rotation and washer fluid. That sounds funny but I am not kidding. She is a terrible communicator, and a terrible listener. Everyone else great. She should be happy her teammates are professional and don’t give their true thoughts on her, but you can see the looks on their face when she screws up. I am literally 5 for 5 with screw ups from her not listening. What’s more she had an aditude when she makes a mistake. Again her name is Sabrina. Sabrina Sabrina Sabrina.. you see her run.

name: Gregory A. Meadows
text: Tried to charge me for everything but what the problem was. I apologise, it was the Bessemer Rd location

name: Michelle Cranor (FunSiZe)
text: Besides the wait time the customer service is great. I came in when they opened and had a appointment but it took them an hour just to get to my car. Sucks for me I will be late for work. So making a appointment doesn't always work. Besides that they are very friendly and helpful.

name: Margaret Strickland
text: When it came time to purchase new tires or our vehicles, I did a lot research and got a number of comparable quotes.  Firestone easily beat every quote.   On the service side, it's been a big disappointment.  Tried to sell me a new air filter when the one in the car was only 2 weeks old.  Tried to sell me an alignment with no explanation.  When I asked to see the numbers one wheel was so slightly off that I really beleive it could be calibration error as the old tires showed no signs of uneven wear and the car never pulled.  Today I went in for an apppointment at 9:00 am.  Every bay was full and I was told they were "down 3 techs".  Took 2 hr and 15 min for rotate and balance and oil change.  I specifically asked twice to include the full size spare in the rotation.  Left only to see it was not done.  Incidently, it's running the same air filter as on last visit and today it was "fine".  They also did not mention an issue with the suspension they said was problematic before.  So if today they were really busy and everything was "fine", and last time they were not as busy and they offered multiple unnecessary services, makes me wonder about how much pressure they get to "sell" services OR if, when they are busy, they don't do a thorough inspection.  Either way, it's disappointing.

name: Kelly Pan
text: Will charge you $60 to change 1 head light and will tell you it takes an hour. The actual cost of a headlight bulb is about $6 for a Toyota Corolla and it takes a LITERAL 1 minute to change the bulb. GO TO AUTO ZONE BUY THE BULB YOURSELF. THE AUTO ZONE WORKERS WILL CHANGE YOUR BULB FOR YOU FOR FREE.

name: Sidney Garner
text: Got tires from here 2 months ago, the day after I got them one was flat. Took it back they replaced it and now a month and a half later another tire is slowly going flat, took it in to ask if they could look at it and made me wait all afternoon. I would not recommend them.

name: DeJuana McCary
text: Karen the sales advisor and Michael the technician were excellent. People to be trusted, who care about you and your vehicle.

name: Phrawsty Gamez
text: Recently spent $500 for full service only to have my car cut out on me twice in the same day. FULL SERVICE BUT IT WAS BARELY A QUART OF OIL IN IT AFTERWARDS!!

resp.text: We are truly sorry to hear that you had a negative experience while visiting our Birmingham store. We would like to hear more details concerning this oil change service. Please, email us at, socialcare@bfrc.com, with a description of your visit, your contact information, and the invoice number or store address. We hope you will give Firestone a chance to rectify this issue.^Kristyn

name: Corinthean Mitchell
text: The technicians were very friendly and keep me informed of what was happening with my car.

name: Hank Winks
text:
Had tires installed on both trucks, both vehicles had tire pressure fault lights go off within a few miles of leaving the store.

Took them back, the store manager assured me they did nothing wrong. I told her the lights weren’t on in either truck previously, she said I was lying as her master certified mechanic saw the light on prior to changing the tires.

Never experienced anything like that before.

Very frustrating to be told I’m a liar and have the lights going off constantly to remind me of it...

resp.text: Hi Hank, we are sorry to hear about the negative experience you had at our Birmingham location. If you could email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with your contact information, invoice number, and a link to this review, we will escalate your concerns to our upper management team. We look forward to hearing from you. ^Miguel

text: Speedy service plus thorough inspections equals quality business!

text: Words can't express how well the great people here took care of my car that broke down on IH459 on Labor Day Monday! They were open and willing to replace fuel pump and really went the extra mile of service!! Thanks again for your service to complete strangers who were 1000 miles from home!

name: Justin Garrett
text: The lady and man in the office was super professional and nice. I had a rotation and balance done and they did not just do the job and send me on my way. they did the job and tried to fix the problem and even test drove it after to make sure everything was working properly. that is the only tire shop I’ve ever seen do that. normally they just want your money and put you out the door but not this place. I definitely recommend them and the price is way cheaper than what I would’ve expected I’ve got 35 inch mud tires on 20 inch wheels everywhere else was charging 100+ dollars and a lot of the other places wouldn’t even touch my tires because they were too heavy or too big this place was happy to do it and for reasonable price. By far the best Tire Shop I know of I live 45 minutes from this place and still would rather drive there than take my truck to anywhere else.

name: Ann Rhyne
text: Im just disappointed in quality of service and work done. I paid 1700.00, for repairs in December 2020. My check engine light  was on, they checked and gave me a price and I was told this would fix the problem. Less than a month later the checkengine came back on took it back, it was another $300 dollars. Now less tha three weeks later the check engine light is on again. I thought this place was reasonable, but i cannot keep paying them bonuses to fix my car. I ask them to do an oil change this last time and they did not do it. Done with Dave, Jason and the whole bunch, just done.I DO NOT RECOMMEND ANDERSON'S AUTOMOTIVE FOR CAR REPAIRS. Something is wrong, they should stand behind their work!  Reporting them to BBB! Done they arent fixing the problem. I will not use them again! Pretty angry with them., they don't stabd behind their work, they say it was thus this time, disappointed just disappointed. Just because a church going perso recommends someone, dient mean their honest and good.

name: Doug Lunsford
text: Thought I needed a tire after I had badly scuffed one (including a small piece out of the rubber). The service guy checked it out thoroughly with me and discussed options, including not buying a tire until later. I really appreciated that they didn't just sell me a tire (since he knew I thought I'd have to have one) but talked me through the pros and cons of the choices. So I'm waiting a while, unless I have to go on a trip, but you can bet I'll buy it here.

resp.text: Doug Lunsford, we are glad we could help! We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

text: Sales associate was really rude. He judge my pockets by my looks. I was looking for a cash car. The car he showed me look nothing like the one on their website. Every other sentence was this is a cash car. He kept saying cash cars don't last long and I had to realize it was a cash car. His rudeness didn't allow me to think of purchasing a cash car nor a financed car. I could have done either but not with them.

resp.text: Qt, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Capitol Chevrolet Montgomery Service Department!

text: I came in this morning (Saturday) without an appointment at 8:15am. I was in and out in about 90 minutes. All the free TV and coffee I could take. Clean area and courteous staff. Very good experience.

text: After being transferred about 4 times I still weren't able to ask about my vehicle that's been in the shop for 5 days.Not satisfied 😌

name: Danita R.
text: Thank you Mr. Danny Head and Savanna for your Excellent Customer Service on yesterday. You made my service check up easy. I'll be back because of your friendliness,  professionalism and most of all making me feel important/special. See you in a couple months.....🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 Customer Service

resp.text: Hi Danita R., thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Capitol Chevrolet Montgomery Service Department. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Adam Mattes
text: Went to get a misfire diagnosed and no suprise they diagnosed me with a misfire but wouldn't tell me anything past that. Instead they wanted $1200 to replace my spark plugs (they had just been replaced), spark plug wires, and clean my throttle body. A quick look at the throttle body would have told them it was clean. A quick look at the spark plugs would have told you they were correct and attaching a multimeter to the wires can tell you if they pass. They did not check my fuel pressure (takes 2 seconds with the proper tool) or my fuel injectors and did not check the camshaft position sensor which I think (again I didnt get it diagnosed) is wrong. They will say I refused further diagnosis when I refused replacement of everything but what I really refused is their poor excuse of what I diagnosed is. My though is take your money and run I can learn what they told me just sitting in my driveway.

name: Phillip Dunn
text: Oil change was 69.00 yesterday I was told by service adviser, today I paided 83.00 plus. Price change over night. Damm!

name: Kendra Washington

name: Mark Brogdon
text: I live in Florida and found a Jeep Wrangler they had there online. Before I left, I called to make sure it was still there. Mr. Ricky Jones said "let me call you right back, I'm going to walk out there and put my eyes on it before I tell you to drive 3 hours up here." He called back within 10 minutes and told me he had pulled it off the lot and to come on. That started how great the service and experience was there. Everyone was super friendly and personable. I didn't feel like I was being hustled or pressured into buying anything. Even though they aren't a Jeep dealership, they knew the answers to my questions regarding the jeep. I ended up buying it and couldn't have had a better experience, all the way from Mr Ricky in sales to AJ in finance office. Super easy buying experience!

text: I've had my Suburban for almost 15 years from a previous state. Used to get serviced here but stopped because they are super expensive and charged me $100 to tell me my truck needed to be replaced when all it needed was a water pump. Never refunded me the fee for looking at my car even though I was promised it would be refunded. Not reputable in my opinion. Just trying to get me to buy a new vehicle. Go to McGriff's. Honest, fair, and affordable.

name: Samuel Malone
text: I drove from Mississippi to Montgomery Alabama to purchase a pre owned hyundai elantra from Capitol Chevrolet of Montgomery. It was priced $4000 below retail.  I worked specifically with Quenita Mitchell, and S M Harris, who went out of their way to make sure I received the best deal possible. The facilities are very nice, and the staff is extremely friendly knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Giuliana Marie Marinucci
text: I went in to look at the 2018 Traverse on 9/16/2017. When I arrived, I was looking at the vehicle from the outside in before being approached by a salesperson. When the lady finally came up to assist me, I asked if I could look inside of the vehicle - if she had the keys - because the truck was locked. She told me "no" but she could take me inside and give me the specs for the vehicle from the tablet. Ok, fine... thats good for the moment. We get in and she starts running numbers on what the payment would be and telling me what the truck had it in based on what was on her tablet... disregarding the fact I asked her multiple times to go outside and get it unlocked so that I could get inside of it and look. I know what I can afford, I already did the numbers before I got here. All I wanted to do was look at it and see if it fit my family's needs. She finally unlocked it but when I started touching the touch screen she yelled at me like I was a kid even though there was little damage I could do to the vehicle (not that it was my intentions but) since the vehicle was in demo mode. I was also not allowed to sit in the drivers seat. She had told me multiple times that the truck was out of my price range, knowing NOTHING about my finances because I had not yet disclosed that information in any form. Then she had the "manager" come out and he told me the same thing, that I couldnt afford this vehicle but they could put me in a cheaper vehicle. Long story short, they lost a purchase from a client who makes over $100k per year because "I couldnt afford that vehicle". We will take out business on to Prattville to the Chevy dealer up here when they get the 2018 Traverse in stock.

name: Matt Bryson
text:
I went to get my battery recharged or replaced. I pulled up and waited 10 minutes and then was waived off by the only employee in the bay working.

After someone finally came out to check, they said that my 5-year warranty on my battery was actually only good for 3 years and then they give your a credit towards a new battery for whatever is left of the last 2 years. I get it if that was the policy, but just very crummy that it wasn’t explained that way when I purchased and false advertising on the battery as it explicitly says “5-year Warranty”. Luckily the battery could be recharged after an hour.

name: Vanessa Kynes
text: Unfortunately, after an oil change here, I had a continuous oil leak. We finally discovered what the issue was and it required a mechanic and new part to repair. The mechanic mentioned it was from over tightening parts (cracked the oil sending unit) during the oil chance (since we didn't have the oil leak before).

name: ALLAN BARNETT

text: I went there for a simple oil change and a tire rotation and now my car is making the worst noise I’ve ever heard and they say they can’t do anything about it. ALRIGHT LOL
