text: Not really impressed, nobody really does anything, have fun ever seeing your vehicle get finished

name: Hej E.
text:
Took my vehicle for an inspection at my nearest dealership. Learned I needed the outer tie rod ends done, among a couple of other things. So I shopped around for cheaper prices and came across Midas in Hoover, AL. Took my vehicle to have the radiator and outer tie rod ends replaced/repaired and an alignment done on January 29, 2015. A week ago or so I noticed something was off with the ride of my vehicle. It would pull and had a slipping feel when turning and braking and just driving in general. It worsened and I felt I shouldn’t be driving it. I started thinking I needed to take it back to Midas because something wasn’t right with the steering and suspension (which they’d “repaired”). On February 23, 2015, I cranked the car up to leave work and the steering wheel loosened and turned far right on its own. Called AAA to have my baby towed. The AAA guy instantly diagnosed it and said the tie rod wasn’t done right. The pin wasn’t inserted in the tie rod end. We found the bolt that came off in the parking lot.

All three AAA guys diagnosed the problem and confirmed about Midas improperly installing the outer tie rod ends. One even said that could be a lawsuit and Midas would eat the cost. Had I drove home, that could have been my life on the road. My baby was towed home on a flatbed and then towed straight to Midas the next morning on February 24, 2015. I was not confident in Midas working on my CRV again. Especially since they didn’t do the job right the first time and it had to be done again. And on top of that, the same technician from the first time ended up working on my car this time around. They apologized and claimed the part was defective. I seriously doubt that. This was completely their fault. Point blank.

And to top it all off, that same technician (initials TT, according to my invoice, I believe) that worked on my car both times and drove it out afterwards, stole $20 from my ashtray compartment. He reached down and picked something up off the floor and got out of my car while putting something in his pocket. We caught it before leaving and went back to confront the guy, a short white male that looked to be in his 30s maybe; thick southern drawl. They compensated my stolen possession…with the exact money he stole from my vehicle -- minutes before. We made a little scene about it. It’s the principle of the matter. I usually take my stuff out of my car when having it worked on or having it in the care of someone else. But I failed to completely take all my significant possessions out…like my frikin’ gas money left in the ashtray. Another technician informed us that that wasn’t the first time something like that happened around there and that ‘we didn’t hear that from him’.

So not only does Midas not properly repair parts on a car, they also search it and steal possessions. I’m not confident in the repairing of their wrongdoing. I’m wondering if something else might go wrong. Their credibility is shot with me. I actually feel I should be refunded the cost for labor, if not the whole amount. And since it was a "defective part," they should refund me the cost for parts since the problem had to be fixed (and hopefully it actually is, this time and nothing else goes wrong from them working on it). I will be going to the home office about this. I will reach out to corporate about this. I will review the hell out of this Midas location. A situation like mine was potentially life-threatening and a definite lawsuit waiting to happen. They will not be getting my business.

resp.text: Hey there, thanks so much for sharing this with us. Very sorry to hear about your experience. We'd love to have someone get in touch with you about this. Do you mind sharing your name and phone number with us via email? Please feel free to contact us at social@midas.com. Hope we can be of some assistance. Thanks again.

name: Brooks B
text:
JacMac Tire and service was not busy today, which was good for me and for them. I usually get depressed when my car gets sick because RARELY do I walk away without spending a grand. But this visit was very pleasant. The customer service man asked me what was wrong with my vehicle, then asked me for the key. He went out and took my car for a test drive, then onto the rack. I waited in the lobby waiting area for a very brief time and then he came back. He told me I had a couple of options. Option one included replacing brake rotors and option two, pads only. I took the less expensive option two because money was tight. My total bill was HALF of what I assumed it would be. At JacMac, the difference is simple. They don't seem to want to drain your checking account like other places around Tuscaloosa who want to bill you no less than 1000 dollars every time you walk in the door. And I really like that he OFFERED me the different options. Most places dont do that. They make you ASK for less expensive options then say, welllllll, but, if you do that then this will happen, etc.
I think I just found "my mechanic."

resp.text: We're glad we were able to offer you the service you needed, Brooks! Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you, and we look forward to working with you again!

text: Very friendly and helpful! I purchased some tires from them and they did a great job. A few years later I got a nail in my tire and that patched it for free for me since I purchased my tires from them. I will definitely get my next set from them.

name: C.J. Sealy
text:
Quick service and reasonable prices for tire work.

However, this is what won my respect:
I came in to get my tire patched after running over a screw.  The mechanic patched my tire but accidentally stripped a lug nut when putting it back on. I noticed it once I got home and called the service desk.  They assured me I could come anytime over the next few days to fix the problem.  I showed up the next morning with a $5.18 lug nut from Nissan to replace the stripped one.  Not only did the mechanic fix it right away, the manager voluntarily reimbursed me without me bringing it up.

Mistakes happen...  It makes me happy to see a business doing the right thing. Especially without being prodded.

5 stars for this business!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us! We are so happy to hear that you had a great experience at our location and hope to see you next time!

Most places won't do for a new customer what they did for me, and believe me when I say I appreciate it. I think the crew here's gonna see me again for my car maintenance. This is how you do business right - treat the customers with a little respect, help them out, and you'll have them for life. Thanks again JacMac, the car feels great. I'll be back again soon.

P.S. ask about the magnetic helmet in the office. Pretty crazy little thing. Two championships off but still fun.

name: LJ Pack
text: These people have communication issues. We went to make a deal on a used vehicle. We almost made the deal twice. After making our down payment and payment requirements very clear, the sales persons involved went to get approval. When they returned, the vehicle had been discounted, but they added a "fee." That's the only thing he would say, "a fee." They were trying to deliberately be vauge and, in our opinion, dishonest. After discussing their "fee," we never actually achieved full disclosure. We were told the vehicle was at a different dealership within our city and we could go there to finalize the deal. They said that they would call ahead and we should just go over there. Our credit had already been run multiple times, and we had received approval from the credit company. With this in mind, we went to the other dealership location. As we arrived at the other location, they hadn't been given all the details as we had been led to believe. So the process began again, running in circles of double talk and running our credit again... We left at closing time and expected a phone call the next day to complete the deal... That has yet to happen days later. I used to have great respect for Greenway Automotive. It appears that Greenway has only taken over these dealerships at face value, and the same crooks that were already in place are still running things just like they always have. Avoid Greenway Honda in Florence, AL, and Greenway Chevy in Muscle Shoals, AL, if you are planning to make a deal on a used car. They are not to be trusted unless you have the cash to pay up front or your own financing.

resp.text: LJ, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. This is not the level of customer service that we strive to provide at Greenway. We take customer satisfaction very seriously and we hope to have another opportunity to show you that. Should you wish to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to our General Manager, Jesse Gouvin, at jessegouvin@greenway.com. Thank you for your patience.

text: Use this shop at your own peril. They supposedly replaced my fuel pump. 1 year later my fuel pump breaks. I ask them to check it out. What lies. After hearing this I decided to replace the pump myself. They actually held my car hostage & tried to extort me for $100 to release the car. After replacing the pump myself I could see they never replaced the bad pump to begin with. Complete scam artist. I would never use backwood shop like this again. Liars & theives.

text: Scott McClellan only reason your giving a bad review is you bought your own parts to save a dollar, that mechanic or any other mechanic is not responsible to warranty YOUR PART that's the chance you take that is why we mark parts up to cover things like this. The thing your not saying is you drove your truck for a month before the slave cylinder went out and like I said that's your part that went out not his so you a responsible for that repair also the labor cost will have to be took up with the store that sold the part. I've known David and his wife for 20 plus years they are honest and good people I've sent him plenty of customers and they have ALL thanked me and said how good of a job he'd done them. But the funny thing is that in my line of work I visit and talk to just about all the shops in the south Hoover to Montevallo area and you and your wife's name came up a couple of times funny how those guys I spoke with all seemed to remember you having some kinda problem and screaming money back, fix it for free, your just trying to screw me and then the I'll get a lawyer card lol we all love those, cant afford to get your car fixed but can afford a lawyer fee yeah right. Folks these are great people at David's Auto don't believe what one trouble maker puts on here because of their on ignorance.

name: Tracy Slough
text:
UPDATE: 4/28/2021
So I read their canned response that all unsatisfied reviewers get, and I followed the instructions to escalate the issue. I did receive an email, and then called the number specified (4/20/2021). I recounted my story to the customer service agent and was told I would receive a call from the person over our area within 24 to 48 hours. I’m still waiting. I haven’t heard another thing by phone or email from management. I don’t really expect to at this point. Just wanted to update so others would not think all of these issues were resolved.

I have used this location for more than 10 years to service my cars and buy tires.  They bought my loyalty by fixing a flat before I was a customer. Today, they have lost me as a customer. One of my daughters took her car in for the managers special oil change which includes a tire rotation. They did not do this service. This is the second car in a month that they did not rotate the tires when getting the oil changed. The tires for both were purchased at this store. Last month, sending my oldest daughter to get her oil changed, not only did they not rotate the tires, they tried to charge her for the high mileage synthetic oil change when she ordered the managers special when setting the appointment in the app. She only gave her information. When she picked up her car, the charge was over $60 for the upgraded service. When her father questioned why so much, they said the app doesn’t tell them which oil to use and they just have to make a judgment call. When he told them that I usually take care of this and to put in my information, they came back and apologized, issued a credit for the price difference, and gave us a free oil change. After what happened today, I no longer trust them to service my cars. I feel my daughter’s were taken advantage of and have warned them that this is what they face as young women. Also, as this is a corporate owned store, I will no longer recommend Pep Boys or trust any Pep Boys location with my vehicles.

resp.text: We’re sorry you had less than a 5 star experience. Please send us your contact info and the details of your experience to pepsocial@pepboys.com so that we can investigate further. Thank you

text:
If I could leave 0 starts I definitely would. Went to
Get my a/c checked out and they told me it was moisture in the system. Comes to find out it was the a/c compressor. Took my car to another shop and pep boys had clipped wires to the compressor which costed me more money in the end. And then they told me it would be $800 to find a genuine compressor because my car was built in Japan when it was literally built in Tennessee ( checked the vin #) and to add insult to injury I found oil in my intake box after they had my car. The oil wasn’t there before . It was FRESH OIL too. Scammers . Stay away and find another shop

name: Michael Herring
text:
I was headed to Pep Boys to get an alignment on my front end, when the engine light started to flash.

I told the tech I needed an alignment and to see if they could find out why the engine light was flashing. I know I needed spark plugs, but wanted them to see if it was anything worse.

An hour later, no alignment, and I was told I needed an engine because the number 2 cylinder wasn't getting any fire. I asked about the coil pack, wires, and plugs, but they were adament about me needing an engine.

I asked how much it would cost and the response was between $1800 to $2600.

After I left, I stopped by Advance Auto Parts and picked up plugs, coil pack, and cam sensor.

After waiting for the engine to cool, I spent about 45 minutes installing the parts. For less than $100, and now, I have no "flashing" engine light or error codes.

Anyone that lacked knowledge of how an engine works, would have spent quite a sum to fix an engine that had nothing wrong.

Needless to say, I won't ever take my vehicle to them again, for any type of service.

resp.text: Michael, We’re sorry you had less than a 5 star experience. Please send us your contact info and the details of your experience to pepsocial@pepboys.com so that we can investigate further. Thank you.

name: Janet Hall
text:
I just called this location to inquire about purchasing the same tires that I purchased from a different Pep Boys location in 2018 (2 years ago) happens to be the Falken ZE950. I wanted to know if they could honor the price I paid in 2018 which at that time the other location did a price match from another tire dealer to get my business. However the man that answered the phone  listen to my question and asked how much I paid and then  persisted to tell me that the entire series of that tire has been discontinued. He did offer to sell me a Starfire tire for the same price which was made by Cooper tire. After ending the call  I look on Pep Boys website, low and behold their  was the Falken ZE950. Then noticed the suggested Starfire tire he mentioned didn't even have a mileage warranty and it was actually cheaper than he was going to sell them to me. Clearly this locations business is doing so well right now they don't need any additional business.
So I called another location and they was very willing to have my business , the tire I want at the price we agreed on.
Skyland Pepboys you should be ashamed of how you treat potential customers. Very shady, non trust worthy staff. I will NEVER go to this location for anything.

name: Dina Wilson
text: I’m trying to figure out why I’m waiting an hour for an oil change after I made my appointment online. Maybe I’m just used to the awesome service I’ve received the past 15 years from the fantastic guys in Crisshaven Drive at Express. Unfortunately my husband has been driving my car lately and he didn’t get by there. However, I did receive my car as promised within the hour. I did feel really bad for a lady and her daughter that was told it would be an hour for two tires to be put on and she stated she had already been there longer than an hour when we arrived. I recommended she remind the manager that her car was still in the parking lot and Leland did go get her car and take it into one of the empty bays. I stood at the window and watched as my oil was being changed. I’m not sure the guy that changed my oil was very knowledgeable with tools. I’m sure I’ll know soon if he was or not. There was a lot of cell phone action going on with employees and one employee actually let the phone continue to ring up front as he went and found a charger (in the back) for his phone. I will definitely return to my safe place in Birmingham that is fast, efficient, honest and clean. I gave a four star review because Leland said it would take an hour when we arrived and we were out within an hour. But seriously you should be informed of this online when making an appointment. One thing I noticed as did the other lady and we both did not like... I have a 2019 car and when they finally came outside with my paperwork they WROTE (using a ball point pen) on the HOOD of my car. If my paint is scratched I’m going to be one mad lady! I guess I was raised that you don’t mess with other people’s property like that especially if it can damage. Noticed the guys in the back did the same thing (on the other side of my hood) when they were done. Ugh. Not ok with this new car owner. I worked hard to purchase my car and want to keep it looking nice.

resp.text: We’re very happy you’re satisfied with the work we do; our goal is to provide our customers with a service which surpasses all their expectations. Thank you for trusting us. We’re looking forward to keeping your business.

name: David J Hutchins
text: Great customer service and actually backs up their work. I took my 2012 Kia Forte to a Pep Boys in Orange Beach, AL for an AC repair. After a couple of months though, the AC started to get warm again and was not working correctly. After calling the Orange Beach location, they sent me over to my local Pep Boys on Skyland and I took it there. After figuring out it needed more freon, they topped it up and added dye just in case its leaking. This was all free due to the warranty and they also changed my cabin air filter free of charge. I have zero complaints with the guys at Pep Boys, and they may be the most honest and well mannered people in the auto repair industry. Pep Boys will now be my go to shop for automotive repairs I am not able to do myself. I was hesitant due to the low rating on google, but I was pleasantly surprised.

resp.text: That's great to hear! Thank you for letting us know and we hope to see you again!

name: L A (Tute4sho)
text: I took my 2003 Honda Accord for a full diagnosis because I had an oil leak and loss of power. Once I went to pick up the car he showed me a piece of paper that had 3 codes on it, and that's it. The same exact 3 codes I got from Oreillys the day before for free. So I asked him did you look for the leak or did he check my fuel injectors he said no, he just stopped looking for stuff once he saw those codes because that's almost $1600.00. So my problem is this, I paid you to tell me what's wrong with my car, not to determine if you think it's worth fixing. I wanted a full inspection of my engine that's why I paid $90. I paid $90 for absolutely nothing.

name: Daisy Mickens
text: Took a 07 Buick Lucerne to Pepboys on Skyland Blvd in Tuscaloosa, AL to have right tie rod end and other issues with the side replaced. Before taking the car there it never hesitated to start and the battery was never drained. After 2 days there received a call that the car was ready my fiancé, my daughter and I arrived to pay for the repairs and pick up the car. Attempted to start the car but it wouldn’t crank we proceed back into the office to advise the Manager that the car wouldn’t start. He had one of his mechanics to take a handheld battery charger to the car to start it. While charging the battery he says try to crank the car and when my fiancé turned the key there was a spark and it blew the radio, charged it a little more and the car cranked. As he traveled home the car was having issues with ABS and other warning lights, he made it home and the following morning on his way to work the same issues happened and he barely made it to work when it shut down and wouldn’t start, that evening had it towed to Pepboys and they determined that the computer was not working. Now they says that he must have had someone jump the car off, yes you guys jumped it off was his response but they said they knew better than to do that. After paying 1200+ to have the initial issues repaired they said they can fix it for 300+.

Early April, I was visiting Dallas and wanna change my oil there, and my mechanic guy was saying I lost one of my wheel lug nuts. Cannot imaging I was driving 600 miles away!! And then we found out that my OEM oil drain plug has been worn out due to rude work. And one more thing is, my car's cover of oil drain was lost, and the bottom part was naked. Should I blame all these horrible things to Pepboys?

Updates: PepBoys got touch with me and reimbursed the fee that I did pay for fixing my oil drain panel. I am very satisfied with their attitude afterwards.

text: I'm a retired master mechanic.I took my Granddaughter Vehicle to this Den of Thieves to have a Radiators coolant reservoir replaced. $.279.59 later a plastic reservoir was repared, this was closing time on Sunday.drove down the street to the waffle house to eat. I then was informed by my Grand that the car was shaking really bad..I drove the poorly running car Home.with intent to be at Pep Boys Monday morning.   On that Monday Morning I arrived with Vehicle and demanded that they fix a problem that they created.I was first in line.approximately 1::00   I called them while sitting in there parking lot.the car was sitting outside with the hood up.They had no update.At 2::00 I received a call a was informed that # three cylinder had a bad Fuel injector and ignition  coil with fouled spark plug.Cost for this repair $500.00  I have never dealt with such a den of thIves in my lifetime,  I'm 70. I payed the cost by phone to provide my 8 month pregnant Granddaughter transportation .I will continue to fight this ( license to steal operations) until they operate honestly or close their doors. name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

name: Julie Hughes
text:
I had an appointment for an oil change at 10:00 am. I was told that it would be ready in a couple of hours.  I left my car for 4 hours. When I arrived at 2 pm, Kyle didn’t know about my car. When he finally found the paperwork, he said,”they can put it on the rack now.”  I informed him that I had to be home by 3 pm and I live an hour away and to please just bring me my keys. He brought my keys, rudely handed them to me and said,”Bye.”
I was not rude to him. I did tell him that this happened before and that I just needed my keys.
I am more disappointed in the way he handled this. He never once apologized and seemed annoyed that I couldn’t wait.  I think 4 hours is plenty of time for a 15 min. oil change.
Customer service goes a long way!

name: Dorothy Carter
text: I was in the service  department  yesterday  I had another  service   associate. I hate too give a  bad review because  I have been  dealing  with  Nissan  since  2014 this associate  name is ADAM. MONTGOMERY he doesn't have good customer  service  skills. I watch  the other  associate  come in and out and communicate  with customers.He never communicate  beyond checkin.This was first  time the lady a the desk call too sign out for my car.I had go back in tooask for the oil sticker that goes in the window. He did enforce. me my car was ready. Maybe he was upset because  I told him I didn't  need a tire rotation  because I DID one the last visit .I just purchase  this car in August  last year. Next time I will get someone else in the service  department  not him. I Jim Burke  Nissan Sales and Service But Adam Montgomery  is not a good  associate .

name: Beth Jeszka
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I dropped my 2005 Nissan Titian off to have some recall work completed, diagnostics ran, O2 sensors replaced and an oil change. I used one of their rental cars, as the truck would not be finished for several days. I left my truck, after giving them a budget of $1500.00, got on to the interstate and went about my day. I woke up in the morning and the car was not there. I talked it over with my roommate and we agreed i should call the police. Long story short, I tried calling Nissan to let them know the situation. I left several messages, tried calling my appointed service tech, sent an email and even had a conversation with the online chat. This happened Wednesday night- Thursday. I finally received a response, via email, stating my truck was finished. Total cost was just over $300.00. The recall work was covered, the cost was for the rental. All of the work I requested to have completed was not finished. The invoice didn't even reflect my request, the issues my truck is having or why I brought to them. In true honesty, they did complete the recall issues.
I will be staying with Benton Nissan or my personal mechanic, lesson learned.

name: Kayti ackerman
text: Awesome people and service...period...my oil changes are free and I didn't even buy my Nissan from them...also they provide a decent military discount...did it without me even knowing or having to ask once they saw my tag. Wait times can be a little long so watch your timing.

name: Makia Hardy
text: Great love the service Had a lil wait time  but its cool...

name: Pamela Williams
text: This is by far the BEST Nissan service department I have ever had experience with. We own 3 Nissans our teenage/college kids drive and have about 25 Nissans in our company fleet. Needless to say we have a lot of experience with dealerships and I have not come across one that compares to the superior service Jim Burke Nissan provides! Ron was absolutely amazing helping our two sons who broke down just outside of Birmingham while driving back to Florida from Mississippi. If you want your vehicle worked on by a company that is honest and goes above and beyond this is the service department to go to! Thank you Ron and Jim Burke Nissan! What a top-notch company!

name: Timothy Paige
text: I made an appointment a week in advance, came to my appointment only to be told there would be a 2 hour wait. I left very disappointed. What's the purpose of the appointment if YOU can't keep it. A total waste of my time.

name: D'Andria Grady
text:
I purchased a 2013 Pathfinder from another dealership but have an extended warranty on the vehicle so I decided to take my SUV to this location. WORST DECISION EVER. I knew it was going to take at least a week and a half to fix my vehicle but, it literally has been 3 weeks that my truck has been in the shop with no updates. I've been told it will be ready 4 different days and my vehicle is still isn't ready. Are they not on a schedule with what vehicles comes in first gets service first? name: Jacqoura Towns
text: Very horrible service after my radiator was replaced. I was told to continue to put water in my car which I shouldn't  have had to do that if it was replaced with a brand new radiator. For the price I spent it better have been brand new. Smh waste of money and drive and my car is still messed up. Never again will I ever visit this location or any of them because of this bad experience.

resp.text:
Hello Jacqoura, we're disappointed to see your review, but we wanted to take the time to clarify the situation. When you brought your vehicle in to have the CV axle and P/S pump replaced, you noted that your engine overheated on the way to the location. Our service technician discovered a large leak in your radiator, which you agreed to have replaced. When you let us know that your vehicle had overheated again, we discussed with you the possibility of a damaged head gasket that was causing the overheating. We believe that this is the cause of the problem and suggested adding water to prevent it from overheating while you are needing to move the vehicle. We would be happy to take a look for you, as we believe this is the cause of the overheating issue. Please let us know if we can help you with this repair. Thank you, Jacqoura.
Chris, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Julius Matthews
text:
I'm not a very car saavy guy, but do know customer service. I signed up for an appointment through USAA RepairPal and thought that this place would have integrity. I was wrong.

I took it in one week. That Friday I had to call THEM to get an update on a Lexus IS350. They told me they did a few test and had more to run. The following Tuesday they informed me that the control head need to be replaced. I told them I didn't want the work done. At that moment, not the Friday I called them, not the day I brought it to them, but that Tuesday I was informed that I would be charged $45 everyday the car remained there. Why wouldn't you inform someone of this at the initial dropoff?

So I get there and fortunately I was not charged the $45. I try to leave and the vehicle, which only the AC wasn't working and the TPS light was on. When I get the vehicle back my parking brake light, check engine light, power steering light, and my ABS light was all of a sudden on.

I used them through USAA and this is how they are with customers. Poor.

resp.text:
Hello Julius, we were disappointed to see your review. When you came in late to your appointment, we were happy to still accommodate you and take your vehicle in, and we tried to communicate that we weren't sure how long the services would take due to the schedules of our expert technicians. You seemed to understand this at the time, and you signed the storage fee disclaimer. When you called on Thursday, you said that you would pick the car up on Friday and return for the repairs on Monday. You didn't come in on Friday or Monday, so Tuesday, we called to remind you of the storage fee. We're sorry if any of the paperwork wasn't clear, and we were happy to waive the fee for you when you came to pick up your car on Thursday. We explained the repairs your car needs (which is why your warning lights are on), but we would be happy to go over this information with you again if you have any questions. We wish you the best.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

text: Sure, they were nice and did the work, but when I got my itemized receipt checked by an independent mechanic from a different garage, their prices were way more than what should have been charged. The biggest one being that they charged for taking broken parts off, which is part of the work that goes into fixing it and would not be charged elsewhere (which was confirmed by another trusted mechanic my family has gone to for years). Get a quote and get it checked by someone else before you agree to the work.

resp.text:
Dear Alesha,
We sincerely appreciated the opportunity to work with you recently to perform brake maintenance on your vehicle. The brake pads that had been previously installed by another mechanic had several broken parts that needed to be addressed. We spent over an hour trying to salvage existing parts in order to save you the expense of new calipers. Our invoice showed we only charged a portion of the hourly labor rate to keep your costs down. I would be happy to discuss all of this further with you and address your concerns in a positive manner. Please give Jamie, the owner, a call at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience.

resp.text:
Dear Beverly,
Thanks for coming into our auto shop recently. We were surprised by your review since we provided you with effective communication and excellent customer service. We replaced your wheel bearing and discovered a small evac leak. You also had us replace a headlight bulb and rotate your tires.

When you came back the next day and stated you were hearing a noise, our technician, Chris, took the car for a test drive and diagnosed you needed a new tire. You left our shop and purchased a used tire and then had us install it. The next day you came back and stated you were still hearing the same noise. Chris drove the car again and indicated that the used tire was no good. We even moved the used tire to the back to make sure the noise followed the tire, which it did.

Our team did exactly what was asked of us and provided you with an honest assessment of what your vehicle needed. We wish you all the best.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

text: Micheal and his supervisor was so ugly to me. I will never go back to them. Not once did they call me about my car to let me know what was going on and when I called them they just said you can come and it. All it need is a sensor.

We aren't always able to let our customers know how long work on their vehicle will last, as we aren't always sure what repairs will be needed. We apologize that there was a delay in figuring out what was wrong with the vehicle, but we unfortunately had vehicles ahead of you that needed to be taken care of first. Our goal is always to meet our customers' expectations, and we regret that we weren't able to help more. We wish you the best and hope you were able to find the service you needed.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

I’ve been told if they find out someone else fixes your car, they pay other mechanics that people take their cars to to fix the damage they did to avoid going to court. Good things don’t come to those who lie and don’t do right by people.

text: I took my Subaru in for an oil change.  I asked them to look at the brakes to make sure they were good since it had been awhile. I was there really recently and overheard the employees talking about one of the guys there who was so bad and told people they needed work they didn't need done, and were joking about it.!"  So I took it to another place for a second opinion, and they said I did not need brakes!  So buyer, beware.  I put one star because I had to put a star to post this, but I would not put any stars if that was an option!

Dear Laura,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. We appreciate your review and have looked into the issue you raised. We are a family owned automotive center and we strongly enforce providing our customers with an honest assessment of their vehicle needs. We treat all vehicles like our own and value each customer’s time and money. We are sorry if you were not satisfied with your last visit to our center and welcome the opportunity to discuss all of this with you. Thank you very much!

name: travia thomas
text: We just left the shop 30mins ago & when we made it home my belt started making a strange noise. We open the hood to find the oil stick wasn't closed all the way and a drill was stuck in between my belt and melt under my hood.... Wow I hope my belt isn't ruined and I have no future problems!

resp.text:
Hello Travia,
We appreciated the opportunity to service your vehicle for you. Shortly after you left our auto center, our technician noticed one of this tools was missing and we called you immediately to confirm the tool was still under your hood. You indicated you had the missing tool and our manager sincerely apologized for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We really appreciated you bringing the tool back to our shop the next day. Once you arrived, we were happy to inspect the belt and pulleys and found no damage. This was good news.

It was our pleasure to adjust your tire pressure and also install your fog lamp bulb at no charge, to compensate for our mishap. Everything seemed fine when you left our shop and you thanked us for our assistance, so we are a bit confused by this negative review. We are happy to discuss this with you anytime, and encourage you to contact one of the owners, Rick or Jamie Martin, at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

text: On Jan 19, 2019 at about 1pm I took my car to this Precision.  If I could give zero stars I would.  They were to fix a Cv boot leak and replace pads on my front breaks. When I tried to contact Precision about repairs the manager Chris said he was waiting on the police report.  I kindly had my insurance make a copy for him and delivered it to him.  I call week later again asking what will happen or if someone will contact me.  He gives a different story getting short with me and saying they arent responsible for anything.  I asked if his company's insurance co will call me he got short with me.  I have complained to corporate but since this is an independent franchise their hands are tied so they say.  They charged me 584 for work performed and my car still has issues and damage to the body because of the employee's negligence and nobody is willing to fix the issue.  Who wrecks your car and then tells you their not responsible.  Well the manager Chris did.

name: Katherine Miller
text: I wish I did not even have to give one star as this place is so awful. I have paid close to $1,500 in repairs here just for my axle to break because it was not properly repaired. Now that another mechanic has my vehicle he told me the control arms were put on incorrectly causing further damage to the car, the sway bar linkage was held by electrical tape, and I'm lucky I didn't lose control of my car and kill myself driving it in the condition WHICH I PAID WELL TO HAVE FIXED! It is not only completely shady and unethical but dangerous. I hope someone sues this place and gets them shut down before they kill somebody! Seriously, don't take your car here unless you want a near death experience.

Dear Katherine,
We are very sorry to read that your recent visit to our Precision Tune Auto Care center did not meet your expectations. It is our sincere intention to provide every customer with exceptional service. We are very proud to offer a 12 month, 12,000 mile warranty on all services, when the parts are provided by our center. We were happy to allow you to provide your own parts for us to install and our team recommended other services, noted on your inspection sheet. The axle is under warranty and we look forward to working with you in order to find a positive resolution. Please contact Rick at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

text: Seems I'm not the only person who's gotten ripped off at this location. I was charged $800.00 for a Brake job. I paid because I was told my brakes were at 10% and having started a new job across town, I didn't want to take a chance to continue driving on them. The staff was super friendly as long as they got their money but, when I called the next day to inquire about how they price their parts, of course nobody knew anything. I left my number for the manager to call me back, this was in September, 2015 and I still have not received a call. I also reached out to corporate and they informed me that it's out of their hands because each location is independently owned, but they would however forward my complaint/ info on to the regional maanger, who I have yet to hear from. I have no problem paying for services rendered, but I do have a problem when businesses are shady.Do not go to this location.

Dear Tashona,
My name is Rick Martin and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. I read your recent review and am sorry that you feel we overcharged you. We went over all of the costs with you before beginning the service on your vehicle and you approved everything. We do not wish to lose your business, so please contact me to discuss this further and hopefully we can find a positive resolution. I tried to contact you and got only as far as voicemail. I look forward to hearing from you. Thank you, Rick (205) 760-9904!

text: These people will rip you off. Charge you for parts and service that you don't need and take advantage of people in desperate situations. Stay away from this place at all costs.

I am saddened that your recent experience at our auto center did not exceed your expectations, Danny. We work very hard to provide each customer with honest, affordable and professional auto maintenance solutions. We towed your 2000 Jeep Cherokee to our shop after you could not get it started at a local gas station. After running a few diagnostic tests we concluded the starter was bad and you agreed to have it replaced. Once that was done we continued with our testing and also recommended replacing the ignition switch, which you also agreed to have replaced. When asked if we could put the old starter back into the vehicle, we recommended not doing this, since our comprehensive testing showed the old starter was bad. Autozone ran a test on the old starter as well and came to the same conclusion; the old starter was bad and should not be reinstalled.  I am happy to work with you to get your vehicle back on the road and can be reached at the number shown below. Thank you!

name: Frank Buchanan Jr. (VooDoo)
text:
The employees of this location is not well versed in customer satisfaction and have a tendacy to have a sharp mouth. One of the store managers has manhood issues and thinks that all should bow down into him when he's nothing but pie. His name is Chris and have been employed by Precision multiple times...he has been known to steal cash from the register and also, had a bad drug habit as well. I'd strongly advise that you take your vehicle elsewhere. The owner of this Precision also has other locations around town and he doe not care about truth concerning how his business is ran but rather gotten money hungry at the expense of his employees and the customers.  Nor is their word any good for they tell you what you wanna hear but not man enough to deliver. All Precision Tune locations need to be under new management or close their doors for good.
I speak this in truth for I was once employed with this establishment. I'm an ASE Master Certified Diesel & Gas Technician...yet was treated with disrespect and was lied to about the pay scale. I've seen firsthand the deceit & trickery of staff. Nor do they abide by standards placed before them in order to maintain a respectable business. Of course there's more to the story but enough has been said to bring the customers awareness up..for it is my duty & obligation to expose such when at the customers expenses.
It speaks volumes when you bring things to their attention yet they fail to acknowledge you or allow an explanation....so I chose to terminate my employment and since then...I've been trying to contact those in charge so that I may retrieve my other toolbox at the Pelham location but have yet been able to. Goes to show the level of care when they lose a highly trained technician because the so called service manager has no real knowledge of automobiles but is allowed to make decisions above his experience...but I'm being hindered in accessing all my tools since i can't the owners to meet me there to get my belongings. The Pelham store momentarily closed due to lack of business but yet they don't see as to why when it's self evident.
Please take your business elsewhere...even if it's to one like Hellen Keller...you'd have a better chance of getting professional lasting repairs.

Attention to management: I need my tools from the Pelham location and have notified Chris and txt Rick only to receive absolutely no reply. If interested in the truth....please contact me....

resp.text:
Hello Frank,
We always appreciate receiving reviews from our valued customers based on services received. Since you have not been a customer at our auto shop, I believe this review in in direct violation of the Google Review Guidelines which state: "Off-topic reviews: Don’t post reviews based on someone else’s experience, or that are not about the specific place you’re reviewing. Reviews aren’t meant to be a forum for general political or social commentary or personal rants.” We kindly ask that you remove this review from our Google page. Dear ra duhon,

When you first came to us we were happy to repair the issue with the main seal with parts you provided. When we install parts from the customer, they are not covered by any warranty. We reviewed all of our security tapes and found no foul play regarding items removed from your vehicle while on our premises. Since we could not seem to find a positive resolution, a release was signed by you stating a full refund was provided, and all maintenance was performed to your satisfaction. name: Brian Kravitz
text:
First, if you’re going to email coupons, be immediately specific about what the coupon covers or doesn’t cover. I arrived with a $15 off coupon only to be told it’s only good on a high dollar oil change ($80 vs $40 oil change service).

Second, I was NEVER greeted. Just took my info, tried multiple times to upsell me for items my vehicle did not need. Then, began some “shop lingo” babble about me checking different exterior lights. If he hadn’t been pointing, I wouldn’t have understood a single word.

Finally, I don’t believe they actually checked any of the items listed to be checked. If he had, he would have realized my tire pressures were low as was my washer fluid.

Even though they are close to my home, it’s doubtful I’ll frequent this slop shop again. Service and personnel would rather be doing just about anything else.

name: Kayla Mitchell
text: As I only had a oil change I can only rate that service.  I have to say I was impressed with the service. The employees were very thorough. They checked headlights, breaklights, backup lights, all caps under the hood, all fluids and tired pressure. They even showed me the dipstick before and after oil change. The communication between the employees was wonderful clear and concise communication was given when a vehicle entered, what step the employee was taking, how much oil was in the car at the start. It is clear the employees care about safety and their customers

text: Terrible place...dont waste your money here. Went in for a other oil change and the price on the wall said $57 they tried to charge me $70...when i asked why was it more they rambled on about something and they board isn't right. They are dishonest and don't back up their work.

text: Took my jeep to get an oil change and an A/C repair - lets just say now I am talking to their District Manager whom referred me to their insurance company. The DM advised me that the insurance company will advise them on what to do - The insurance company said "YES" fix it / however now the District Manger and Store manager (Dave) said no its not their fault - I bought the jeep brand new / I am the only driver / they were the ONLY one whom worked on the A/C EVER and now it is broke / Another shop explained what happened (long story) - Now I am in the process of calling the DM boss and the insurance company back / why would the DM and SM say no when the insurance company said "YES" - I will keep everyone posted!!! - Just heard back from The District Managers supervisor - So sad what hard working people have to go thru in order to get "Justice"........... Again I will keep you posted as the boss said no even thou the independent adjuster said "YES" - All over less than 500.00 - Wow - I see why independent repair shops have a bad name - This store has a C- rating with the BBB - so sad.

text: I would give zero stars if could, because that's exactly how much service I received. Had a 2pm appointment for oil change, showed up at 1:45pm. He said they would get right on it. At 3:20pm, over 1.5 hours later, I hadn't heard a peep from anyone. I got up to check on it, on crutches BTW, and see my vehicle sitting in the parking lot. I thought it was complete, and asked why no one let me know. He informed me that they hadn't even touched it yet. I asked for my keys, and voiced my displeasure. He handed me my keys, and never once offered any kind  of apology . Why take appointments if you have no intention of honoring it?!

resp.text: Thank you for the alert, Shaun. We definitely respect your time & take your feedback seriously. We do get backed up from time to time, but the team should be providing updates throughout to let you know of any unexpected delays. That being said, we'd like to connect & learn more. If possible, please send your preferred method of contact to support@tirediscounters.com. Once received, a member of the team will reach out. We value your insight and hope to chat soon.

name: Daniel Webster
text: I purchased almost 2 thousand dollars worth of tires from this location for a 2008 dodge dually in September 2020. On February 15th 2021 I took truck in for a rotation and brake inspection. They did the rotation wrong and put two tires that were worn way down and put on outer tears which started skinning them fast. Less than 200 miles down the road and the rear brake pads were metal on metal yet they supposedly just did a brake inspection. Today I took truck back so they could address the issues they cause and they wanted me to pay for their errors. I was fine with covering costs of brakes but the tires was their error. They did want to take care of me the customer. I picked my truck up and will leave this same review on every site I can find and contact an attorney Monday morning to address this matter.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Daniel. We've got an open ticket for ya in our system and we'll be in touch to get to the bottom of this soon. Make sure to send us your contact info if you haven't already done so to support@tirediscounters.com. Talk soon.

name: Stephen Youngblood
text:
I made an 8 am appointment to get one tire changed. I learned don’t ever make an 8 am appointment. It’s 830 and my truck still hasn’t even been pulled in so now I have to scramble to reschedule meetings this morning. Use discount tire instead they keep their appointment times and don’t have people laying out tire displays instead of taking care of customers. Then when they get it in and go to put the new tire on the guy stands there for 5 minutes texting instead of installing my tire....over an hour and a half for one tire as the first appointment of the day and first one signed in.

DO NOT USE FIND SOMEWHERE BETTER

name: Stan D
text: I brought a tire in to have a leaky bead fixed, and was told they couldn't touch it because it was older than 2007, and it was against the law.  Well, I looked it up, there is no such law, state or federal regarding tire repairs regardless of age.  They flat out lied....obviously in an attempt to sell me new tires.  Pretty sad.  Also, their oil changes are wayyyy to expensive.  You can go pretty much anywhere else and save some cash.

resp.text: We take the care of our customer's vehicles very seriously. Thank you for informing us, Stan. We want to dig in to learn more about your experience and work to improve going forward. If you could, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon!

name: Swainer (swainer)
text: These guys are incredible. ALL OF THEM! I have always gone to Discount Tires ...up until now.  I have never met a bunch of guys with better customer service than these guys. We had a situation where we were traveling in our BMW i3 and had a blow-out and nobody- not even the BMW dealership in Huntsville had the tire in stock that our car required. Each and every one of them genuinely cared about our situation and never stopped trying to help us figure it out and get us back on the road. These guys went out of there way and took care of us and got what we needed done.  If I even lived in a 50 mile radius of this store and these guys they would have my business all day long. I cant say enough about these guys... it makes me feel really good that there are still people like this on this planet.  Don't go anywhere else, I can promise you that theres nobody else going to take care of you better than they can.

resp.text: Yeahhhhhh buddy! Glad we were able to take care of ya, Mark. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us. We love having you in the TD family.

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

text: We have been here multiple times and treated badly every time. The last straw was when the manager promised to take in both of our vehicles in one day. When we came to pick up the first car, the same manager acted like we had two heads and told us he couldn't service our second vehicle since they were too busy. It really irritates me when people make promises they can't keep. When we explained why we were upset, we just got brushed off and told to have a nice day. Their customer service is very poor and I will be taking my business to Tire Engineers. I've been treated like a valued customer each time I have visited their locations.

text: I haven't actually bought tires here, but I felt a need to add a voice saying for a place called tire Discounters they have ridiculously expensive tires.  They are $100 more for a set of 4 than Goodyears at other stores, and it was an off brand I'd never heard of.  They were almost $200 dollars more than Goodyears at my new favorite tire place if you include the "free" alignment.  They told me that includes the warranty and installation, but so does anyone.  I haven't even called Walmart for prices yet, but my point is, do your comparison shopping, and don't believe the name.

text: The worst experience I've ever had getting tires. I would leave zero stars if I could. I purchased 4 tires online because of their low price. I went to get them put on 3 different times each time they had over 2 hour wait. Then when I finally decided to do it it took them over an hour to just locate my tires that were ordered online. I specifically told them I wanted my tires back when checking out. Three hours later when my car was finished they said they had cut up my previous tires and I wouldn't want them back. I had looked at my tires the day before going and there were at least 10,000 miles left on them. They preceded to show me tires that were worn until the belts were showing, which were not the tires I drove in there with. I would not recommend this Walmart tire center to my worst enemy.

text: Been using Whitt's for a couple years now. I've priced dealerships and other shops along the way and always found Whitt's to have good prices and the best customer service. No complaints here.

name: Walt H
text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

resp.text: Thank You For The Great Review

name: Brian Toner
text: Great service. Dropped my car off Monday morning, got a call that afternoon detailing what the problem was and the price for the fix, picked the car up Monday before 5. Did not try to up charge me, only fixed the problem I came in for. Will be coming here next time I need service.

resp.text: Thank For the Great Review

text: Brought my truck to them with a worn wheel bearing which caused a few other problems with the brakes, they had the truck for less that 24 hours and had everything replaced and working. Absolutely incredible customer service, very polite and called me before anything was done. I was very impressed, will be receiving my business from now on

name: Pascal Xu
text: This was what I experienced a while ago. It was until today I know I got ripped off...a lot. I am new to USA so I don't know a lot of common stuff. I bought a used car which had its check engine light on so I went to this small stinky shop and ask them to have a look. They told me that this is a very hard job (lie) and they have some fancy $100k dollar machine that can read the engine light code. So I paid them $150 for reading the code. Until now I found that Autozone can do it for free with exactly the same machine which itself cost less than $150. Lol. Very bad experience. Very blantant lie. I wouldn't trust these guys with anything. Your car is very important and car accident can cost your life so don't let liars touch it.

resp.text: I am sorry for your disappointing experience at our repair facility. We always explain what needs to be done and what the charges are before any repairs are done.  If you are not satisfied with the repairs we performed please call and see if we can resolve your issues. Thank You David Whitt 334 502 8848

text: First off I called the shop told him what was going on with the car he said he would test it and pull it for free as long as I was willing to let him fix it I agreed time comes to get the car and test he says he dosnt know what's wrong and i owe him 158 for test and towing I didn't agree since he said it was free but since he couldn't fix it I paid another lie "don't nobody answer my phone but me so I know I didn't tell u it would be free" ok well who just answer your phone on your so called hour lunch break? big liar would never go back or recommend him to anyone. instead go right down the street to tiger auto they do great work.

text: At first I thought they did a great job for a great price. My car wouldn't start and I wasn't sure why. I took it in and found out the battery cables were loose. They tightened them for me and told me I should probably get a new battery because the voltage was lower then it should be. But they tightened the cables so much so that it is IMPOSSIBLE to get them off to take the battery in for testing and even bent part of the battery cable. We tried forever to unhook it till the point that the cable broke with the nut still attached to the battery. So now we have to replace both the battery AND the cable. 0 stars for further breaking my car.

Then, when I was going to leave, an employee walked in from the garage area and said it was closed and told me, my 3 year old and my $200+ grocery filled cart that, "I ain't gonna open the door, walk around". I've learned not to expect much in form of customer service from any Walmart, but this was ridiculous. As I was shopping, there were upset customers on almost every grocery aisle due to lack of products stocked. Wish I could give zero stars it was so terrible.

name: Frank Tucker
text:
Bought wiper blades at Walmart, and there was a sign hanging up that said they would put them on your vehicle. So I checked out and drove my car around and the bays had a couple of cars that were being worked on. An Associate walked out to my car. I told her and showed her my receipt and wiper blades and communicated to her that I wanted my blades put on. She communicated it was 'gonna be a while' because they were shorthanded. She said she wasn't gonna do it, because she didn't want to tear anything up on my car. I communicated to her that I would reach out the Mgmt.  I left. I attempted to call twice and went the thru the phone options. 2 calls and 2 times no one answered. I called a 3rd time and chose the 'pickup' option and asked for the Manager, and got transferred to no one again.

- Poor Customer Service
- Untrained Personnel working Automotive area
- Offerring services and not being able to follow thru on them

name: Shane P
text: Great family-run business. Honest work, fair prices, and quick turnaround. The Howard family are great people, and I would trust them with any vehicle repairs and tire work. Their tow service is also fast and dependable when needed.

resp.text: Hi Shane P, Thank you for taking the time to leave us such a beautiful review. Most people don't bother to leave reviews about positive experiences non incentivized, and that's what makes this so special! It's only when we receive such positive feedback, do we rest knowing that we have done our jobs well. Thank you for giving us this proverbial pat on the back, you made our day! We will strive to deliver great experiences consistently, please do visit us again.

name: Carol Lucas

resp.text: Hi Tammy Stratton!  We're thrilled that you enjoyed your experience with us! We hope to earn that last star during your next visit! Thank you for the review! Howard Tire Service

name: Randy Moore

resp.text: Randy Moore, We take pride in giving outstanding service to every customer here at Howard Tire Service. We are happy to hear that your visit was no exception, thanks for leaving the wonderful review!  Look forward to seeing you next time! -Howard Tire Service

text:
Brought my vehicle in for a alternator swap seen it done before talk about an hour and 20 minutes. I got here at 10 came back at 12 and the woman working the desk told me it would still be another 30 to 45 minutes.
3 hours for a alternator swap? I don't think so I'm very disappointed and not a satisfied customer.

text: They were able to get a tire off my truck that another tire shop couldn't.  I recommend going to Howard Tire. Fast, friendly and effective service.

text: Usually the wait times aren’t great but today, the team was very helpful and set me up when I really needed them. Thanks, guys!

name: Jerry Paulk
text: Good service, good advice. Nice people.

name: Leslie Clark
text:
On Nov. 7, 2018 I went in to get an oil change. Told me it might be awhile, that was ok with me, had to shop anyways.
About an hour later the called me, as I was driving away I noticed they had not reset my oil life gauge..I turned around went back and they acted like it wasnt a big deal. But, they reset it.
On the 17th of Nov a team of of us went to Kinard Fl to give a Thanksgiving dinner to that community. On the highway, the plate under the car that protects the engine fell on the road, the noise made me pull to side of road. Luckily, there was a mechanic with us, who got under the car and took it off..
It was put back on with a plastic screw and a zip tie From getting my oil changed!
Needless to say, walmart TLC will never see me again...or about 25+ people in this area who were either with me or have heard this story..We are still telling it btw.

name: Jermaine Watkins
text: Great customer service and people. Their hours are great & they get you in & out quickly. Mrs. Corretta is a pleasure to work with along with the rest of the staff. Two different times I have taken vehicles here & they have SAVED ME MONEY by diagnosing the real problem of my car as well as having GREAT prices on tires. I tried to go to other tire shops in the area(just to get a tire put on) & was told I would have to WAIT until that afternoon, just to put on a tire! I went here & was in/out within 45 minutes! Trust me & COME HERE for your auto needs

name: Catherine Marie
text: I swung into this walmart around 6:50. My tire was acting funny. I asked them to put a new one on and they told me no. They sent me and my small children away. Thanks for the great customer service and putting our lives in danger. Wtg

name: Not yo Business (Will)
text: Thursday @ 1 pm been trying to call the Chelsea for the past hour after the fourth attempt and at least 25 rings each time someone finally answered. was transferred to the auto service department where the phone rang at least 25 times. Located the auto dept online and called direct and again no answer after at least 25 rings. Purchased a set of Goodyear Dunlop tires for my 2007 Chevy Impala SS on January 25. 3900 miles later the tire is wore out. they are willing to replace it with a compatible tire and suggested a Kumho tire. After doing some research I found out that Wal=-Mart is not an authorized dealer and the warranty from the manufacturer is invalid. what is a person to do.

name: Neal Hauser
text: In and out quick tire repair.

name: Jo'Van Hanna
text: I had my oil changed at this location earlier this year and they didn’t put my oil stick back in the engine. I didn’t realize it was missing until a few weeks later when I went to check my oil levels. I got a new oil stick and went back to that location to get another oil change. This time, they put my oil stick on the floor in the back seat. Never going back.

name: Brandy Sharpley
text: Spent $190 to OBS installed & speedometer.Wire was loose and OBS light wouldn't go off.Went back for what they said was a 5 minute repair & they claimed they need a lift to fix it which I dropped car off at 8am and they wasn't even working on it at 4 pm. I tried calling them and got hung up on so when I drove up there they were all laying around on couches doing nothing. The guy was rude and the mechanic didn't even know where he had put the keys at. Finally got my keys and just took my car home because they were very unprofessional. Now we will have to go to another mechanic to fix what they messed up. I wouldn't recommend this shop for even a oil change.

text: Best place to get your car or truck fixed friendly people that works there great place hands down

text: i had a blow out and had to walk the tire there i Google place it said it was open when I arrived after walking miles they where closed so I had to walk to firestone which was another couple miles away

text: Great place, chivalry isn't dead!!

name: S Reed
text: If you've been here recently, say in the last three or four months- check your catalitic converter. Its probably not there anymore.

name: Brett Hokr
text: These guys take forever to complete the job and do a poor job of putting it back together properly. My wife's car had the alternator replaced and they left the battery just loose in the tray and instead of hooking up the positive lead to the alternator they simply wedged it in place so that it would drive for a little while before the wire popped off. Please use someone else.

name: Deanmu6uio Paulin
text: I had an emergency flat tire. Instead of making me wait like lots of garages the owner came from behind his counter and fixed my tire and I was on my trip. I will repay his kindness when I get my next set of tires.

name: Ariana Leite
text: DO NOT GO HERE, I REPEAT DO NOT GO HERE!!!! I have never left a bad review for anything but I HAD to for this place. Just know that they will work on other things that they find wrong with the car without getting permission and charging you for it! I went in for a specific problem and they did a number of other fixes on the car that I never gave the "okay" for and expected me to pay double what they originally charged. Then I took the car back because the check engine light came back on so technically they never fixed what I played for. They promised to take care of it and when I went to pick it up the 2nd time they charged me AGAIN! I was told they would take care if it but they didnt. My check engine light came back on the next day and now I am completely broke. Please safe yourself money and the stress and DO NOT GO HERE

name: Dathan Ballard
text: I wouldn't go here.

name: David Stanford
text: Because i work their and we do everything we can to ensure the Drivers safty and proper operating machine whatever automobile it may be we more than likely can fix it

name: Moose Trust
text: Ralph is great, and prices are reasonable.

name: Richard Jensen Criminal Defense Attorney
text: Ralph never lies about what you need and always gives you a straight-up honest appraisal about your car and fixes what's broken. He is always cheaper than the competition and deals with you the old-fashioned way -- he's a man of his word. He has been my only car mechanic since 2013.

name: Nancy Elvy
text: Just picked up my car, early to say 5 star but to this point there have been no surprise charges as are common at other service providers. I was treated well and all services were as explained during initial estimate. This is a shop I will return to!

name: Amy Kibbey
text: We are fans of E&E!  They are very reasonably priced and very practical in fixing our cars.

name: Jill Hall
text: Cannot find the one on one service with Ralph and Chad!  Customer is always right.  Never have been disappointed!

name: Kandi Nichols
text: Although the work done at this E&E location is acceptable, the customer service aspect is severely lacking. Today, I left my keys and car with them just after lunch, left then with my phone number and a quote from them advising that the job would take only a couple of hours. I returned a few hours later only to find the shop had closed up early - more than thirty minutes early- with no notice, no notification regarding my car and its status, and with my keys locked inside the building. I had to arrange transportation while waiting in the winter air because they choose not make one single phone call. Very displeased. Will not use this business again.

name: Un Lee
text: I have been repairing my tires for over 20 years from here. Every repairs were dependable and never a had problem.

name: Nathan O'Neal
text: Ralph has always been good to me.

name: Daniel Moore
text: Not usually one to leave a review especially a bad one, but in this case I have to. I took my car in ti have a radiator replaced, once there i was told a day later that the thermostat should be replaced. Bought a new thermostat and the next day i was told that the housing for the thermostat needs to be replaced. I take that and they said they couldnt put the part matched thermostat on my car then couldnt put the old one back on. After coming up pn a Saturday and sitting in the dollar general accross the street i saw people sitting and eating chips hanging out(maybe they were on break idk) once they saw me in the other parkinglot they moved my car behind the shop(adter walking around it constantly) i wqs told vy the older gentleman that he would go to fix it himself and he wanted to let the sealant cure for a day. I called agead and they said it was done so I picked it up Monday qfter it being there for a week and didnt make it to lily flag dr before it ran hot again. So i have to take it to another shop and they also didnt put the bolts back on my engine cover. I was told to bring the car back because they dont know the size of the bolts.

name: erika smalley
text: They are awesome here. Went to a place around town that was quoting me $1300 for a false fix. These people charged me $600 . Thanks for saving me $800!! I will be a forever customer, and I will refer everyone I know to you!

name: Andrew Christopher Baker
text: Does a great job on everything i think everybody should come here

name: Troy Jason
text: Ralph Eppling is one the .Best people alive to meet and be friends with.

name: John Pettitt
text: These folks are great at giving you the repairs you need at very reasonable prices with no up-selling.  Most complaints are coming from people that don't seem to understand that the real world requires tradeoffs.

name: Tipawan Gallo
text:
One of my tires was losing air so I went to see E&E Service Center around 7:30 AM. The gentlemen was kind of enough to see me so early in the morning and I was in and out within 20 minutes. He patched up my air, gave it some air and charged me only $15.

I don't know the rate of these repairs but $15 seemed fair to me, especially for an emergency.

name: Stanley Gibson
text: Ralph always does me right. I have used his services for years. Someone complained about him closing early one day. He got real sick and went to the hospital about that time so cut him some slack.

name: Mary Young
text: Very polite and did good job

name: McKale Simpson
text: Colby was so kind and professional. He really went out of his way to make it a great experience for us. We will definitely go back and hope we get Colby again!

resp.text: Hi McKale! We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed the service you received from our team and appreciate the review. The next time your vehicle needs a little TLC, pay us a visit!

name: Horace Bester
text: Good service, nice crew, in and out i never wait here, but i also try and be the first person😁

text: Went in for an oil change and to check tires. Both light indicators went off in my car.  I did not need an oil change after they checked, so they reset the indicator for me, and fill up the tire that caused the light to come on.  All free of charge.  I always go to this location.  Great service every time.  Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, Tara! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!
