text: Our service master was very patient with me and ...., On his own, decided to check to make sure all of my tires were in proper working order. He found a mistake made by another tire service, corrected it, and let me know what he had found. It's great to know somebody still gives the kind of service we all remember. I appreciate it.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, tom! We’re glad you’re satisfied with the support you received from our team and hope to do business with you again in the future!

name: Kendra Woodard
text: Great service! These guys are seriously the nicest people! Went the extra mile to make aure my car was safe to drive and even reset the check engine light inside the car for me!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind review, Kendra! We’re happy to be your shop of choice for your auto service needs. If you need anything else, don’t hesitate to give us a call!

name: Mary Jo LeCroy
text: Wow, I typically have a good experience at any of the express oil places, but this is the best one I've been to. The man who did my oil change was incredibly kind, and honest about which services I should or shouldn't have done soon. Made a point to ask if I needed anything else. Very professional!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Mary! We’re glad you’re satisfied with the support you received from our team and hope to do business with you again in the future!

name: darcy lee
text: These guys are incredibly nice, professional and timely. Went to get my oil changed in my old Honda with over 200,00 miles on it. They gave me two price options and didn’t try to sell me anything extra, as some places try to do. Thank you Colby!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, darcy! We’re glad you’re satisfied with the support you received from our team and hope to do business with you again in the future!

name: Dylan Patterson
text: Waited 20 minutes to try and get my oil changed no one came and talked to me plenty of their workers looked dead at me. Sad part is they weren't even busy when I got there.. Never coming back.

resp.text: Dylan, we are so sorry to hear about the experience you had with us! We never like to leave a customer unsatisfied. Please take a moment to leave us your contact information, along with the details of your concerns you provided here, at www.expressoil.com/contact/. We want to reach out to you and address these concerns as soon as possible. Thank you for bringing this to our attention!

name: Karen Glover
text: Very professional and nice people. Tried to air tire and realized I  had a nail in tire and that tire would need to be plugged. Referred me to Tire Depot very close by, who fixed the tire. Tried to pay Express Oil Change & they would not take any money for checking the tire. Very nice & professional.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, Karen! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!

resp.text: Thank you for the rating, Linda! We look forward to seeing you down the road!

name: shivangi khandekar
text: Super friendly crew!! My engine oil filter was stuck and many experts couldn't take it out! But the engineer who was assisting our car just did in in under 30 secs! Service is amazing and very helpful people working there.. 😄😄keep it up!!

resp.text: Thank you for the rating, shivangi! We look forward to seeing you down the road!

name: Michelle Stano
text: I had a great experience at this location! The whole team was great! Colby went above and beyond to make my experience great! Fast and friendly service! I highly recommend!

text: Did not receive  a reset  VW and i called ahead of time also did not get a full synthetic  oil filter....But to my dismay it was not the location I Called So Im a little more Satisfied after All....

text: Superb service and very good at communication. It's a little weird to find, but this crew is worth it!

name: EJ R
text: Excellent service; the best! A big thank you to the technician, Conlee, for having such an upbeat welcoming attitude & for being so professional & helpful. This location was recommended to me, & I was not disappointed. Will return. Much thanks!

resp.text: Hi, EJ, thank you for the positive feedback! Our team here at Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is always happy to service your vehicle, and we’re thrilled to hear the customer service was stellar. We look forward to continuing to do business with you in the future!

name: Lizzy Childers
text: I normally hate getting my oil changed, but I after coming here this is my new place. They were honest about things I needed, always tried to give me resources that will help me in the future, and were overall very genuine people. I loved my experience here and I will definitely come back!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, Lizzy! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!

text: Charles was very professional, entertaining and fun. He explained everything that was going on with the car and made us feel comfortable.. Thank you Charles!!!! He should be a trainer on service.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, lakisha! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!

We don’t live in Homewood anymore but take all our cars there for routine and any repairs. Great at diagnostics and don’t try to take advantage of you - they speak truth 😆

resp.text: Thank you for your review, J! We’re glad you’re satisfied with the support you received from our team and hope to do business with you again in the future!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, James! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!

text: What an awesome business. My wife was having issues with our van and Jerry & Tim looked it over. Advised that we get it towed to a repair shop AND they keep the van in the shop over night for us at no cost. My wife has been here several times and Jerry & Tim and the staff have always gone out of their way to be very helpful over and beyond what you would expect. This is a Class A++ business. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Hi, Peter, thank you for the positive feedback! The team here at Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is always happy to service your vehicle, and we’re thrilled to hear that the customer service was stellar. We look forward to continuing to do business with you in the future!

text: Friendly and helpful staff

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind review, Zach! We’re happy to be your shop of choice for your auto service needs. If you need anything else, don’t hesitate to give us a call!

name: Brittany Rodrigues
text: With it being my first time at this facility, I was totally impressed. I highly recommend asking for Conlee. He honestly went above and beyond and helped me every way possible. Not only did I go for an oil change, he checked my headlights to make sure the bulbs weren’t burning. He also noticed my tire pressure sensor on the dashboard was on and made sure all 4 of my tires were equal. Best experience ever !!!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, Brittany Rodrigues! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!

name: Mary Wofford
text: Had such great service today from Conlee and the others! He showed me everything I needed to know with explanation! Thank y'all so much!

resp.text: Hi, Mary! We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed the service you received from our team and appreciate the review. The next time your vehicle needs a little TLC, pay us a visit!

name: Melia F.
text: I have been to this location 6 times and I will continue to come back! My mom just left this location about 20 minutes ago after my recommendation to her and she called me to tell me how impressed she was with the employees and their willingness to go out of their way, specifically Conlee this morning. I used to be one of those people who ONLY got serviced at the dealership but this Express is so impressive. The employees are mainly younger guys but they are all polite, patient, and personable! The managers, Tim specifically, are also patient, and helpful both on the phone and in store and truly take time out of their day to talk to you about servicing, previous records, dates of service, and HONEST recommendations. You will NOT wait in line here like you will at the dealership, the longest time I've waited for the entire oil change to be done is 15 minutes here, and that included the "wait" to begin. Everyone here has a great attitude and a willingness to help! I cannot say enough positive things about this Express location, you will always be treated like a human and not just the next car in line.

text: Unprofessional and shady.  They wanted me to pay them $2300.00 for repairs and when I picked the car up to get another opinion they acted like the biggest jerks. They either had no idea what they were doing, or they were trying to stick it to me. Either way, that’s not the experience I have ever had at other locations. I recommend steering clear of the Homewood location, the location on West Valley is much better.

name: Holly Carr
text: Went to this location for an oil change, but my tire pressure light was on so I got them to check on this too.  One of my tires was entirely too low (pressure at 15 when should be at 35, all other tires were only at 30).  Any knowledgeable technician would have removed my tire to check for a leak, but he insisted the tire was fine.  After filling the tires & resetting, the tire pressure light was still on.  He told me not to worry and to "be careful" with that tire--incredibly vague.  Turns out there was a leak, which left me with a flat tire & stranded in Atlanta the next day.  It's clear that the technicians I dealt with had a blatant disregard for my safety and the safety of my vehicle.  I will never return to another Express Oil Change, nor recommend this location to anyone I know.

text: I think the guys here really know what they are doing, and treat you very politely. However there is either an increase in those desiring service or a lack of employees to meet demand . In an effort to be fair they move cars around ( have you change bay lines) according to the time you arrived. Unless you can maneuver your vehicle,  hang up the effort. I saw a woman with an infant leave without service last time, and it would be very difficult  with small children. Bring a book, and have that phone charged.

While we are so sorry to hear that you’re unhappy with our staff, we are always looking for opportunities to improve, and your comments will help us do just that. We hope you’ll consider doing business with us at Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers again, and we are fully confident the next time will be an all-around more positive experience!

text: Quick service, friendly technicians, easy to understand options! Adam was very helpful with understanding what we needed and how long it would take/how much it would cost! I will be returning!

name: Matthew Tucker
text:
I noticed gas dripping near my fuel filter.  I didn't know for sure exactly where or what was causing it, didn't want to spend my only free evening of the week with my wife and kid trying to figure it out, but also didn't want to leave a leak overnight so I took off work early to go get it fixed.  My vehicle needed an oil change as well anyway so I took it in and explained it was likely the filter or one of the lines that needed replaced.

Sure they changed my oil no problem, but the guy came around and said he wouldn't fix the leak, that it was a "missing o-ring that they didn't carry in stock" and I'd need to take it back to whoever put the existing filter on and have them do the repair.  Now, I replace my filters every 40,000 miles or so and I've moved a couple of times since then.  I have no idea where I was exactly when I replaced my filter last, because it's a small fix.  I got there at 4:30 pm, close of business at 6, so it wasn't like I pulled up at quitting time.  I had to take more time off work the next morning to disconnect everything myself and find it was simply a hairline crack in the filter.  The mechanic that I talked to didn't even verify anything, except what I already knew that yep there's a fuel leak there.  He just spewed some bs that he thought sounded good because he didn't feel like doing his job... REPLACING A DAMAGED FUEL FILTER SO I'M NOT DRIPPING GASOLINE EVERYWHERE I GO.

I'll find somewhere else for auto service, and I'd recommend you do the same if it's anything other than an oil change.

resp.text: Hi Matthew. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

text: Its amazing how God leads you in the right direction! My wife and I were 450 miles away from home and was having tire problems. text: Had oil changed by Express and afterafter I noticed my car leaking oil. I took it back to Express and the guy said it was leaking from the drain plug and for me to go purchase one and bring it back and he would replace it. I take it back the next day and still leaking after replacing it and so the guy proceeds to say I need a new oil pan and they would email me the price for oil pan and installation. A week went by and I never received the email nor a phone call. I took my car to the dealer and and they replaced my oil pan. They said it was stripped and they (Express) had try to repair it with a repair kit but obviously didn't work. My car was not leaking oil before I took it to Express but was after they changed my oil and so they costed me $560+. I will not be going back to Express for anything.

name: Samantha Roy
text: I highly recommend this place! My Mom and I were on our way to Charlotte, NC and were planning a night stay in Montgomery. Our battery light on the dashboard came on about 50 miles out. We made it to the hotel that night as the car dies out! We figured it was the alternator. The next morning (btw, this is Christmas Eve), we look on Google for places to service the car and two others whose sites showed opened at 7am didn’t answer the phone. So we called Performance Auto Repair at 7am thinking to leave a message because they open at 7:30am. Well the phone rang once and they answered 30 minutes earlier than their opening time! They worked hard for us, got us a towing service right away and fixed the problem by 10:30 that morning! They were a God send!! Definitely go to them when you need! Thanks guys!!

name: James Mason
text: Excellent service. Great folks to work with.Quality work with quick turnaround.  I recommend this auto service to everyone on the capital district area.

name: Alexander Hatch
text: Probably never letting my dealership touch my car again

name: Kama Mason
text: I highly recommend this auto repair shop.. Brandon, the shop supervisor and fellow workers are always willing to help in any way they can. They are up front with the problem and do their best to make it right.

resp.text: Mrs. Mason, thank you for the review! We strive to be honest and upfront with our customers. We look forward to seeing you and Mr. Mason.

name: Robert Annibale
text: Overall great experience and very satisfied with the work done on my truck. I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Annibale. Your truck looks great!  It was our pleasure!

text: Fast, friendly quality service at a fair price. Can't ask for much more than that.

name: Patrick Tidwell
text: Good job with my battery when I needed a new one despite what AAA said

name: Survive N Thrive
text: Went here with a truck, had tire fixed in a reasonable time. Staff was friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you, let us know if we can help in the future.

name: Kevin Krouse
text:
Disclaimer: This is not intended as bad mouthing. It is purely a report of the facts.*** Okay, I literally walked into the shop. The employees were not rude, so a plus for that. I asked for a quote for Rancho shocks (all four) for my 2001 Dodge Ram 1500. They wanted to sell me each shock for $175/piece. Yes, $175 for one shock X4. Additionally they wanted to charge $14.96 for shop supplies. $715 for parts (including shop supplies...) On top, they wanted $296.97 for labor to install the shocks.

Bottom line: Those shocks are going for $75/shock on Amazon. I understand and support a small mark up. Everybody must make money. However, charging $100 for mark up?? I recommend military personnel boycott this place. I have no bias against this place. I'm not from here, and have no past dealings with them. That is all.

I've attached the estimate for your viewing pleasure.

resp.text: Mr. Krouch, we apologize for your experience. That is not how we do business. We support our military 100%. We would like to have the opportunity to make it right. Please, give us a call or come by during business hours today and we will do our best to make it right.

name: Alice Yelder
text: Had a f250 lifted on fri may 31, I was very disappointed I wanted truck lifted because it was scrubbing, the people there lifted truck like I asked but truck tires were still scrubbing so we asked why someone didn't call since that was the reason we took it there, they weren't concerned about the quality of the work or did it solve the problem they just took the money. This was the first and last time we will ever use them. There expertise should've been used and should've reached out to us and have customer service and just plain sense but all they could see was money. What about fixing the problem and all they could tell us was "we did what you asked", what great regard for customers

resp.text: We’re very sorry that you feel like you had a bad experience. We strive to have good customer service. Give us a call Monday morning or if you’d like, we can call you and we will do what we can to change your experience.

name: Majyst Thalsbane
text: The service was great. I replaced all tje suspension components on my car o er the weekend. I came in and wanted a performance alignment specific to my car and suspension setup. They were able to get extremely close to the measurements, which is normal as all cars are not capable of achieving the perfect requirements. The technician that worked on my car "fixed" a few issues from the work and informed me of the issues. This was a free set of extra eyes. The price was reasonable for the work performed, they basically had to 4 wheel align twice because of the extensive work done to the suspension.  I definately recommend Performance Auto Repair. I will be bringing my other project cars here for similar service.

name: Brian Barth
text: Aaron and staff are great to deal with. Always take our company trucks there and are very pleased with their service. Anything we ask for they always are there for us. Thank you guys!

resp.text: Mr. Barth, Thank you for the review. It is our pleasure taking care of ALL of your fleet maintenance needs.

name: Troy Brown
text: Cant fix foriegn cars

resp.text: Mr. Brown, we are sorry that you did not have a 5 Star experience with Performance Auto Repair. You can give us a call at 334-260-3582 and we will try to help in any way we can.

name: Thomas Davis
text: Had a bad experience was going to work when my box truck lost electrical power and went dead Lawrence Robinson service advisor said it will be $640.00 to fix it was a month for them to call and say it was the alternator and called back saying that thay was trying to crank it and even trying starting fluids which is not good for diesels now truck needs a starter and flywheel that it will $2,500.00 it cost me $640.00 to get my truck back not fixed now i have more problems than i started with

name: Jack Harrington
text: At times my pickup would misfire and lose power. After reading my Nissan check engine light code, Performance Auto Repair replaced the catalytic converter. The check engine light was not on and the truck had a lot more power. However, the truck continued to occasionally misfire and start loosing power. This would last from 1 minute to several minutes before resuming with good power. Without any engine codes indicating the issue, they continued to search for the problem.  The pickup is now repaired and I can't remember when it has run so well. The total cost of repair was most reasonable for what they did.  Thank you Performance and especially Lawrence!  I will be using them for future repairs/service. I will recommend to friends.

name: atcarter75
text: Greated at the door immediately, and the staff had expert advice.

resp.text: Thank you, we're here to help if we can.

name: Bob Atchison
text:
Prior to my recent visits I’d never used this business.  When I walked in I was greeted by no less than two people.

Zack greeted me and asked how he could help.  From that point forward he was very accommodating and helpful.  He would pull the products up on the computer that I was interested in and show me what they looked like on the vehile.  He made excellent suggestions and made it easy to get just what I needed.

The prices were good and the service excellent.  I would highly reccomend Proformance Auto Repair.  Ask for Zack and you’ll be sure to receive excellent service.

Bob

name: Jamie Jamison
text: I have dealt with mostly Lawrence. He is one of the most concerned, considerate and professional sales and service providers at performance.  I would highly recommended this company to anyone. Especially military.  I am retired military to include law enforcement. This is a great company.  Keep up the grand work.

name: Michael Britton
text: These guys take care of my work beast. No matter the repair or maintenance issue. I’m in and out with little to no interruption of my work day. This place rocks. I was allowing Gipson’s to do my service work. I will never allow that to happen as long as Performance is open for business.

resp.text: Mr. Britton, thank you for the review and for your business. It is an honor to take care of your vehicle and at Performance Auto Repair we take pride in doing so in a timely manner and for a fair price.

name: Terrence Coleman (tcoleman701)
text: Was having problems getting my Putco Switchblade Tailgate Bar installed at other places (the dreaded "we only service or install what we sell" spill). However, the guys at Performance Auto were more than willing to install it and my Tailgate Assist on my 2016 Ram 1500 without hesitation and they performed an excellent job! I made sure to get a business card because I most definitely will be a regular customer! Awesome group of guys! Highly recommend for all of your auto needs!

name: Whitney Banks
text: Remember the $400 your company took from me by the second visit for one wheel bearing? Well, I’m being told that the bearing is still bad.

resp.text: Ms. Banks, we strive to perform quality work and make sure that our customers are happy. If one of the wheel bearings that we replaced back in 2017 is bad, it could possibly still be under warranty. Give us a call at (334) 245-6600 and we will gladly set up an appointment for you to come in and we will check it out for you.

name: Rob Rance
text: I strongly recommend this place.  You can find what you want for your truck at reasonable prices with great service.  Their auto technicians are qualified and skilled.  They do both car repair and truck repair which I didn't know till I visited.

name: Tina Stanley
text: My family takes all of our automobiles to Performance Truck & Automotive.  The staff there is very professional, courteous and friendly.  They  always provide quick and great service.  They go out of their way to provide excellent customer service.

name: Audrae Mayo
text:
My boyfriend and I traveled from Kansas City to Montgomery, AL for a business trip last Friday and Saturday.  Unexpectedly, our front brakes went bad, really fast.  I found them by Google, took it in without an appointment on Saturday morning and was done and out within 1.5 hours.  Very friendly and professional.  I did not feel like they were taking advantage of "out-of-town, desperate" travelers.
Lawrence was very helpful, courteous and genuine!!!!  I even received a follow-up call to make sure everything was good and that we made it home safely.  THANK YOU!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

name: S D Butcher (AdventureFamilyInMotion)
text: AWESOME work! Wonderful staff! We looked at the local reviews online before choosing Performance Truck and Automotive Repair and their reputation is legit! Fast, precise, and friendly! There is even a toy chest with toys for kids to play with! I will be back!!! Thank you for your work!

name: Chandler Bise
text: Just got brand new tires on my 13 Jeep JKU. The guys here did an amazing job, correctly on the first time. Ill definitely be coming back for any more work done to my vehicles.

name: Cody Greene
text: I work for Admiral Movers so keeping our fleet of vehicles in check is a key part of our success. Performance Auto does all of our fleet vehicle repairs and maintenance at a very affordable price. I would highly recommend them for any job.

name: Denise Jacobson
text: I have been through 3 different vehicles in 4 years but I haven't changed where I go for automotive repair.  Performance Truck & Automotive takes care of my vehicle.  They communicate clearly my vehicle repair needs, offer fair pricing and the best part is they pick up my vehicle and bring it back when they are done.

name: Jac Chapman
text:
Amazing service and amazing people. You can't beat them. My truck is driving and shifting great.
Thanks for the help.
J. Chapman

name: Lynn Henry
text: I have been very impressed with Performance Truck.  They know a lot about fixing cars and work on them till the job is finished.  Their customer service is excellent and everyone that I have met there is friendly and nice.  Great folks!

name: Joshua Fields
text: Go to vendor for just about everything including light body work. Can't speak highly enough of the service. Would recommend to anyone. I take my personal vehicles and all of my fleet vehicles over.

name: Mike Dean
text: I sat in the lobby for an hour and a half before they told me that they didn't have my size tire and that they should be here any moment. Could have told me a lot sooner. Poor customer service. Will not go back. UPDATED!! I received a call from Lawrence shortly after posting my review. He apologized and was very swift in taking care of me for my inconvenience. That is how you manage your business. They will continue to get my business. Highly recommended! Thanks Lawrence.

name: Venessa Menefee
text: My experience at Performance was superb! The people were very professional, knowlegable and courteous. I trust their work and opinion when it comes to my vehicle. I will come back when I am in need of any type of service on my vehicle.

name: Bonnie L Temple
text: Large regular maintenance time in Santa Fe.  Kept me informed and gave me estimate.  Enjoyable conversation with young man waiting.  Overall pleasant.

name: Dave Ely
text: My Subaru broke down on interstate 65 and AAA had my car towed to this shop.  After a 3 hrs wait for the AAA truck Lawrence saved the remainder of the day.  We had discussed by phone that my fan belt had broken; he took my vehicle information, ordered the part and had it delivered as we waited to arrive.  When we finally got to the shop they recommended a couple of near by restaurants and offered us a ride.  While eating they called to tell me the idler pulley seized and needed replacement.  We returned from lunch and with about 20 more minutes the car was ready to go.  I'd certainly return to this shop for repair work.

name: Lamon Logue
text: Outstanding service !! I was traveling through Montgomery Alabama and my fuel line busted. I almost made it to their shop breaking down just a block away. The service men where very courteous and made arrangements to get my truckto the shop. The rrepair was a difficult one due to the location of the line.They were extremely nice offering me and my girlfriend cold water on this hot summer day even arranged for us to get lunch. For me this is business done right. I wish they were local to me.

name: amanda smith
text: Lawrence, Aaron, and their team at Performance Auto Repair took an unfortunate situation and provided excellent service.

resp.text: Ms. Smith, I’m sorry for any inconvenience. Please email me at aaron11sprayberry@gmail.com and I will send you my phone number or you can email me your phone number so we can try to get this situation fixed ASAP.

name: Bob Wingenfield
text: I have used PTAR for more than 10 years for  my company and private vehicles for tires, periodic maintenance, as well as auto repair.  The staff is courteous and the mechanics treat your vehicle as if it was their own.  When service is required, a simple phone call will get your vehicle picked up, serviced and returned.   Service like that is hard to find these days.  Absolutely five stars for PTAR.

name: seyth smith
text:
Great service
Straight forward and was very pleased with the outcome of the work preformed

name: Rhonda Miller
text: I have a 2010 Silverado. Zach and the guys did an outstanding job on my truck. This is the second truck that I've had a lift installed by PTC. I didn't have the opportunity to meet the technician that installed the lift but none the less his work was flawless. I'm extremely happy with the looks and function of my truck. Thanks Zach.....

name: Raymond Head
text: The service and repair to my truck was done very proficiently. There was a problem after I got my tuck returned to me. When I took the truck back the problem was very quickly repaired and the staff was completely apologetic and helpful in supporting my schedule.

name: Buford Strength
text: Not friendly, everything I've tried to get there they have to order, expensive

name: Joe Pettis
text: I started going to them when I had a tow hitch put on my Saturn Vue, many years ago.  When the warranty ran out on my newer vehicle I noticed they had moved and started using them for a hitch on my current vehicle, oil changes and tire changes or any of my other automotive needs.  I am moving to NC and one thing I will regret is having to go through the hassle of finding another honest mechanic shop to service my automotive maintenance needs.  Great people, honest service.  Need I say more !!!!!!!  hey, they had breakfast the Tuesday I got my oil change and yesterday the coffee was good while they fixed a leaking tire.  Just a small screw in it.   But hey, it's fixed now.

name: colvin conway
text: I work for csx and they do a great job on our hi-rail vehicles, and all other maintenance.

name: Robert Jenkins
text: Front desk people are helpful and happy. Didn't want to pay for new rotors but they assured me it was time. I trust them so I went with it.

name: Joshua Carmichael
text: Performance Truck has always taking good care of our work truck and has made sure they do it right and fast so that they don't take up to much of our work day, so we can keep moving forward..Thanks, from the Ewing Team out of Montgomery

name: Camacho Family
text: These people really know what their doing and they are fair.  They told me up front what it would cost to get the job done.   Instead of cashing in, they explained that my truck was worth a whole lot less than the cost of the repairs.  Of course I did the google thing and started to research all they had told me was wrong with it.  Comparing Ebay prices and the average cost of labor in my area, and the book value of my car.  They were right.  The repairs would have cost more than the truck was worth. They saved me from the money pit that was my car.  I will be returning with all of my car maintenence and will highly recommend their team to anyone needing a honest mechanic.

name: Blackqueen70
text: My name is Tammera. PTC has performed nothing but exceptional service on my suv. They are friendly, knowledgeable and perform quality service on the level that you would expect from a dealership. Also, they are reasonably priced and have a fast service turn around. I highly recommend them to everybody!

name: John K

Second service trip to PTC for repairs to my 3500 Dually; brakes this time.  Lawrence and I worked out what I needed to upgrade the performance for the heavy trailer I tow and came up with a perfect system.  Yes it was much more than most brake jobs but I wanted something that would last as well perform under towing conditions.

I was referred to PTC from fellow RVer and have been very happy with the quality of service and professionalism I receive from all the staff.  They are pros compared to the Chevy/GMC dealers I have dealt with over the years.

Because of their great service and quality I trust no others with the maintenance of my home hauler.

text: I can’t possibly say enough nice, positive things about this FIRESTONE location. I came in for a simple tire replacement and they provided me with an unforgettable experience and worked to get me the best deal! Amazing and I absolutely recommend this shop and location to any and everyone. Thanks a lot Eric, Jordan, David, Tyler, and Don! Can’t say enough good things. Great people!!

resp.text: Hello. Thank you for your great review. It was our pleasure to serve you as a customer. We appreciate you taking the time to leave this positive review about your experience. We are always happy to hear good things from our customers. If at anytime you find yourself in need of our services, do not hesitate to reach out to us at socialcare@bfrc.com and we would be more than happy to assist you in scheduling an appointment. Thank you for contacting Firestone. We look forward to working with you in the future. ^Morgan

name: e douglas pratt
text:
Friday January 17 and Saturday the 18th, 2020, Michael and Jonathan at the Oxford, Alabama Firestone store exceeded my expectations . I was traveling from Atlanta to Birmingham when my tire light went on. I made it on my run-flat to their store. They showed me the irreparable damage and found a tire in Birmingham. It would be delivered Saturday; but the Saturday delivery failed to bring that tire. Instead of waiting til Monday, Michael and Jon immediately offered to get the tire from Birmingham themselves. Jonathan made the trip and I was driving safely away later Saturday afternoon. Michael, Jonathan, and their Oxford, Alabama team make Firestone look very good. Please give them a substantial raise. If that's not immediately forthcoming, please embarrass them with lavish praise at your next regional meeting.

Dr. E. Douglas Pratt
Atlanta, Georgia

resp.text: Hi, E Douglas. Wow! We are so thrilled to hear that your recent visit was superior to satisfactory. Vehicles are our passion, but you really are our priority. We appreciate you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We look forward to working with you again, and thank you for choosing Firestone! ^Mariah

name: Kandi Willis
text: I love this place when it's time to work on the car.  Guys are always so friendly.   Working with Jeremy last night on my wiper blades,  he was nice and friendly and it's the little things that make it worthwhile.

name: Deborah Waddell
text:
While the price for my tires and oil change were less than quoted, I do have some complaints: the employee did NOT do requested alignment
he tried talking me into "Fuel System Cleaning" & Renu Fuel System
Cleaner" ($89.99 & $9.99) which I just had done 2 wks prior at my
dealer)
DID NOT cold pressure balance my tires (from the photo of my dash PSI
info: LF 39 RF 39; LR 38 RR 43--what the heck??); on 2009 Chev HHR LS recommended PSI is 30-32 for 15s, 16s respectively. While it won't necessarily affect mileage that much for minor variations, it will affect the wear and tear.
It makes me mad when MEN in the automotive industry think they can pull things over on women. LADIES BE AWARE.
It pays to be an informed consumer and to listen, and if they are slick salesmen like the one serving me, listen twice as hard because he made me think that the alignment check was the alignment being done. Shame shame shame.

** This happened at the Oxford Quintard Mall location but it won't let me put my review on their page.

text: Almost 400 dollars for 4 new tires and the next morning one is completely flat and one is half way. The completely flat tire clearly has a hole at the valve stem and not sure why the other one is losing air. Tried calling ALL day yesterday and every 25 times I called they would say hold on and hang up in my face. I drove from tallassee so looks like I'll be figuring out a way to take the tires back there. Not to mention the tires were bought for a planned fa.iky trip which I missed. Thanks walmart for bad tire job and poor customer service. Also reassured me an hour at the most an hour and a half. Me my 8 year old amd 2 year old was In Walmart OVER 4 hours.

name: Shamard Jackson
text: I just went to Walmart (9:40 am) to get 4 tires mounted on my trailer. It was NO cars in the bay at all. I was one car in front of me that was getting one wiper replaced. The next car 4 tires mounted and then me. THEY TOLD ME IT WOULD BE THREE HOURS BEFORE THEY COULD GET TO ME! I left and drove two mins and saw the King Tire sign. I called them and they pulled me right in. The tires came off in less than two minutes after I parked and installed in less than 30 minutes! The service is great and quick 5 stars!!!

name: e o
text:
This team did a fantastic job with how busy and short staffed they were. We travelled in from out of state and wanted to make sure our tires were good enough for the drive home. We had to purchase two new tires. They gave me the best price for the tires they had in stock. Mostly I’d like to commend Chico the tire tech. He came into store to speak with me to ensure we placed the correct tires in the correct positions. It really shows he cares about the safety of the customers and is passionate about what he does. Very thorough!

Thank you for helping my family get home safely.

name: Jason Kirkland
text:
The gentleman who writes up the ticket is one of the most unprofessional people I have came across. Rude and threw down his hand held and told another employee to handle. It all stem from me and him talking about oil and I followed him to check and see what oil
He had. I cross into shop and he went crazy. The two gentlemen he passed me off to was wonderful. This happen at 815am on 2-4-20.

name: Cora Marsh
text: I was pleasantly impressed with the service I received at Walmart on the Southern Blvd a couple of weeks ago. The young lady was very good she got  my info as to what I  wanted and answered my questions which she could answer for  me and verified 1st that the tires I wanted was there and referred me to the Mechanic and he was very helpful and I was in and out and got groceries paid for and walked to the Service Dept with my groceries in the  buggy and paid my bill and rolled out to my car loaded my groceries in the car and  another young lady said she wld return my buggy to the store so I was very happy and excited to get my new tires and groceries and they put 2 of my tires in my trunk as I requested since they still had more rubber than the 2 front tires and they may come in handy one day!BLESSINGS to the WALMART FAMILY!👍🏼👍🏼😇

name: Brandon Godby

text: I’m 60 yrs old; and have never enjoyed an oil change until today. I pulled up to the obviously vacant area. Guy came out immediately and asked about my needs. name: Heath King
text: The guys over at Express Oil in Muscle Shoals are unbelievable.  Lots of drive up oil change places have a faded old sign hanging up that lists their free 200 point inspection, but you end up leaving with no low fluid levels, a stripped oil plug, and nothing more said about the condition of your vehicle than "it's full of oil." Not these guys, they are in a league by themselves. They do great work, they are knowledgeable,  friendly, reliable and most important, Honest! Best of all they have another shop on site with techs that can do a wide range of repairs and diagnostics. Plainly put, you can rest assured that you, your wife, your teenager, etc will drive off with a well-serviced vehicle, Every Time!!

text: While working out of town company truck broke down due to a fuel filter. Truck died pulling in parking lot. Asked where closest part store was, I was told and I quote "we have several around". Very disappointed in customer service. Will not be back to this place

name: Mary Hall
text: I usually use a different service, but they were very backed up so I drove down the road just to have my tires checked because my TP light came on. The gentleman looked at my low tire for about 30 seconds and told me there was a nail and because of where it was on the tire they wouldn’t be able to patch it and I needed a whole new tire. Also that the tread on all my tires was getting low so I needed a whole new set. The set he tried to sell me was almost $1,000. Luckily I had my dog in the back seat, so I had a good excuse to get out of there and tell them I’d come back later. I don’t know a whole lot about cars, but I know when my tire tread looks low and I’ve got at least until the end of this year or the beginning of next before I’ll need new tires. And as for the one with the nail, my cousin patched it and I’ve driven to Birmingham and back on it with no problem at all. Seems like to me they saw a single woman and assumed I wouldn’t have any sort of knowledge and tried to take advantage.

resp.text: Hi Mary. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Blue Octopus
text: I've been going to Express Oil Change for about 2 years to get my oil changed. Recently, my car decided to break down pretty close to these guys. I got it to the place and they had to order a few new parts for my clutch. The job took twice as long as expected. Unless they were trying to add more stuff to my bill, I was not updated about the status of my car unless I called or randomly showed up. I was severely over charged. When I picked up my car, all my saved radio buttons had been changed to different stations. Coffee, a notebook and some small car part (not even sure what it was) were left in my car, none of which were mine, all of which I threw away. I'm glad I had nothing valuable in my car if their workers are this unprofessional. I WILL NOT be going back. Go somewhere else. This place is not worth your time or anyone else's.

name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Jason Hughes
text:
Jaye at the front desk was very professional and courteous and the service was awsome so far, however I was charged 4 hours labor and it only took 2.. At over 100$ an hour labor, I had over 200 dollars stolen from me where service's were not performed... I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then
try to  justify it by saying my computer says I have to.... This was my first and last time visiting Meineke...

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Jason. Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: The service and this branch location was impeccable. Hunter the manager & my tech specialist Isaac were professional courteous and really went the extra mile to ensure that I was satisfied. They have definitely gained my business and I would personally recommend this location!

resp.text: Thank you for your wonderful review, Javan! Exceptional work and exceptional service are what it's all about. Thanks for shouting out Hunter, Isaac, and the team. You can count on our crew to go the extra mile. Happy to hear about the great work on your vehicle!

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: I came in to get an oil change. I spoke with Andrew Boutwell. He was very professional, knowledgeable, honest, and respectful. Andrew and the technicians were very friendly and prompt. Andrew took time to explain what was work was needed on my vehicle. My wait time was not long. The store/shop was very well cleaned and kept up. The service was top notch and the prices were great! Definitely recommend going to Meineke Car Care Center on south parkway to see Andrew Boutwell.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Amber. Thanks for shouting out Andrew and his team. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Alex Sims
text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. After a few hours, the work was done and they said they test drove my car to make sure it was working properly. I picked my car up right before they closed tonight and went on my way. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

resp.text: We understand your concerns, Alex. We want to make sure we are doing car care right. We are escalating your concerns internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to regain your trust and confidence.

name: Robert Terry
text:
Absolutely stay away from this location. Do not trust them to perform a simple oil change. When you are charged for an oil filter that is not installed, it is called fraud. When you refuse to stand behind your work, You are not reputable. If you expect them to return your calls, you will be waiting till the cows come home.

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action.  If you proclaim that you are customer oriented and responsive, just do the right thing and pay for the parts charged but not installed and the damage you caused.

name: Richard Bruce
text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. Your concerns are very important to us, and we're saddened to know this experience has jeopardized your future loyalty. Please allow us to allay your concerns by contacting our Customer Service team at 800-447-3070. Thank you.

Never again.

Almost 2 hours for an oil change when you are the only the only customer there.

I’ll give them credit for comping the service for me, but didn’t appreciate them saying it was because the wrong part was delivered, when I heard them order the filter for the wrong model vehicle and also never communicating that there would be a delay because they didn’t have the correct filter in stock.

Also, so much drama.

resp.text: It's disheartening to know that your visit did not exceed your expectations as we would have intended, Renae, as we would never want anything to deter you from returning for future services. We do not take your comments lightly, so we ask that you call our Customer Service at 800-447-3070 to allow us a chance to fully address your concerns. Thank you.

text:
Our battery died and we drove to a national auto parts store that advertises they will install your battery after you purchase it. After they refused to install a battery for us, we called this location knowing that we would arrive 15 minutes before they closed. We were told they would stay open if needed.

Even with paying $12 for the installation, we saved money by getting our battery at this location. The best part, however, was not the money we saved it was the customer service. Sterling is awesome and Walmart should pay him to teach a class on customer service to other locations. He is an excellent communicator and even assisted with the battery installation. We will be back.

It only uses a quart between oil changes and I know how to check my own oil. I ended up changing my own oil and saving myself money anyway so thanks for that I guess. Still don't understand why they were making a big deal about an oil leak that consumes a quart between oil changes. I will never bring any of my vehicles to them again.

JBurns

text: Typical fast lube place. Friendly service. Will try to upsale you on service you may or may not need.

text: These folks take care of my vehicle and do a decent job of it

name: Jacob Kearley
text:
My wife brought my truck here today to get the oil changed. They were doing a light check (which from my experience with these types of places is routine) and they told her that the tail lights were out. Being the good wife she is, she was confused and asked for a person there to hold the break while she checked. The lights were (in fact) not on. Still in disbelief, she told the guy to step away and put her bag on the brake and lo and behold when she checked herself all lights worked!!!

They guy tried to act dumb and said there must have been a short when he checked it. She got back in the car and told the guy what an insignificant little ant he was and drove off. This company, not only this particular store will NEVER have my business again and I will let everyone know of this experience. They tried to take advantage of her being a female in her early 20s. If you ever come here make sure you talk to someone who has all their teeth and never let them "fix" anything!

name: Ice House Muzik
text: I came here with my friend to get oil change and had no idea we could stay in the car as the oil was being changed. Not only that the customer service was excellent. Learned stuff about the vehicle we never even knew. He made sure we knew what was happening and showed us that they had filled the oil back to full. Only took about 15 mins total. They have this way they talk to each other that is so cool.  Lol I'd refer them to any of my friends.

name: John Krahm
text: I was told that the threads on my oil pan were stripped and they could replace the oil pan for me.  It sounded suspicious so I said I would take it to the dealer.  They tried to convince me that was unnecessary and they could do the work for me.The next day at the dealer there was no problem with the threads and the price for the oil change was cheaper than the $65 LubeFast was going to charge me.

name: Mark Barber
text: always friendly fast and pressure free.

name: Steven Sparks
text:
My father and I have used these people for years. He owns a local company and has a fleet account with them. Well, this week, I have I took my Mustang (Hot-Rod crate engine) and they put cheap, super thin (5w20) oil in it. I just told them to but the best premium synthetic oil and the best oil filter they would sell me on it (and assumed they would put the correct oil to the engine). The next day, my new engine was knocking and they almost blew up my new engine from putting ridiculously thin oil in something that needs 10W30 or 10W40 oiland they put the cheapest oil filter on it you can buy. My father took his truck up there a week before to get transmission treatment and oil change. The next day the transmission fell out of the truck and he had to buy a new transmission. They also put way too small of an oil filter on his truck.

Basically, they use the cheapest stuff and charge you a premium price. They do terrible work, and they do not care what happens to your property. They are very pushy salesmen when it comes to the useless (or harmful) and overpriced additives that they want you to buy. I took my Mustang back to them and asked them to replace the oil with what it needs. They refused. I ended up being on the phone with the management and all I got offered was $20.00 off another oil change. The oil change they just have me with flushing out my coolant and oil and replacing coolent and the wrong oil was just over $200.00.  Needless to say, I change my own oil now and use Royal Purple oil (the best) and K&N oil filters. If you do it yourself, you know it is done right with the best parts and is cheaper. DO NOT USE LUBE FAST ANYWHERE, I went to the one one Opelika Road by the Grubmart gas station and the Tractor Supply store.

text: Went for an oil change it them over and hour, these guys were to busy running off at the mouth. Not only that they didn't tighten something because I'm losing oil fast!! Four quart in less then two days. I informed corporate today of this problem, this is a first disappointment with them.

name: Rena
text: Great customer service in the auto department. The young lady who waited on me was very polite and professional.

name: The Eclectic Mama creator
text: I went twice to get tires put on ...they did not listen to me when I told them what I needed . They made there own choice on what tires needed replacing and almost got rid of still good tires I had on there before. When in there own policy it states they are not to gage tires to know what’s bad or not.  they had claimed that the tires they had taken off were bad and practically said the second day I came in that they did me a favor even though my truck broke there lift that they should not of put on there lift in the first place but it was my fault. They acknowledged that there lift would not work  because my truck was too big....but went ahead and put my truck on the lift anyway the first day. Now the tires they were supposed to remove one was too big and was throwing off the trucks balance due to a different Walmart tire center. And the other one was a balding spare tire that they apparently did not look at at all or they would have not taken the still good tires off and almost through them away. The only good thing they did is make me realize that they can’t be trusted to do the job ....and don’t communicate with the customer properly. There may have been some polite people there at first but the second day I was there to get the problem fixed thinking they would be professional about it instead this I guess manager raised her voice at me and made all these claims that I had said this ...when I thought it was because I asked for a rotation I thought I had confused them and they had assumed what was right. I was not blaming anyone, I just wanted the work I paid for to be done. There were a few things that maybe on me but if they were real professional people they would not of teamed up against me like they did. In the end I went to a different tire shop and I did ask them to put on the tires Walmart almost thrown away and to gage them before putting it on to make sure they were not bad. And this other tire shop I went too said “ no your tire ain’t bad they still got a couple years on them if you use the truck regularly”

name: Rose Burgess
text: The cashier was too busy talking about everything to her co workers. The customers waited in line until she finished this conversation about a customer who had walked away with the co worker.   She waited on me and when I explained that my tire was only 14 days old and had a screw in the side wall I asked if the tire was to be patched or replaced.  The young lady proceeded to explain to me what road hazard meant and a new tire was out of the question (very loudly I must say).   The co worker who fixes the tires spoke up and said if the tire has a screw in the side wall the tire most likely will be replaced.  I thanked him and sat down.   This same cashier called me to the desk to get checked out.  I had to wait while she redid the paperwork so her supervisor could understand what happened (which did not understand).   So I waited till she rewrote everything and I was asked to  pay a pro rated amount of 11.00 for the new tire.  I paid this amount with no comment because she was so (confrontational and annoying) even though I felt it wasn't fair.  But that's the kind of people you meet today in stores they do not understand the meaning of customer service.  The service team did a great job, the wait for changing the tire wasn't long at all.

name: Josh B
text: When I arrived there was one car ahead of me. When that car was picked up mine was put in the garage and was there over an hour for a simple battery replacement and 2 new tires. No reason given for waiting over an hour for something so basic.  Go to AutoZone and get a battery installed in a few minutes and find an actual tire store.  Walmart doesn't care about you.
